text.en_US: Unlocked all trophies. The mark of a true completionist.
Reach \c[3]Level 99\c[0]. Nothing can stop you now.
Amass a \c[3]total of \v[misc.localNum.250000] Credits\c[0] throughout your journey.
Amass a \c[3]total of \v[misc.localNum.500000] Credits\c[0] throughout your journey.
Amass a \c[3]total of \v[misc.localNum.750000] Credits\c[0] throughout your journey.
Amass a \c[3]total of \v[misc.localNum.1000000] Credits\c[0] throughout your journey.
Play the game for a \c[3]total of 10 hours\c[0]. Don't worry there's no speedrun version.
\c[3]Find\c[0] and use at least \c[3]25% of all Consumables\c[0].
\c[3]Find\c[0] and use at least \c[3]50% of all Consumables\c[0].
\c[3]Find\c[0] and use at least \c[3]75% of all Consumables\c[0].
\c[3]Find\c[0] and use \c[3]100% of all Consumables\c[0]. Write a book about it!
\c[3]Find the \v[item.154.name]\c[0]. Unlock all the bronze chests!
\c[3]Find the \v[item.155.name]\c[0]. Unlock all the silver chests!
Obtain \c[3]4 Cross\c[0], \c[3]8 Mega\c[0], \c[3]16 Chef\c[0], \c[3]32 Hi\c[0] and \c[3]64 Normal Sandwiches\c[0].
Have a \c[3]total of 99 Metal Gears\c[0] in your Inventory. Gaming has changed.
\c[3]Obtain the Old Man's Drill\c[0]. Pass it on to the next generation when the time arrives.
\c[3]Visit all perfectly normal landmarks\c[0] in all areas.
Finish all Trial Caves in Bergen with \c[3]all handicaps in under 1:45\c[0].
Execute a \c[3]Level 3 Combat Art with each Element\c[0].
\c[3]Perfect Dodge\c[0] a total of 100 times. So close.
Survive 50 fights with \c[3]33% or less of your max health\c[0].
Defeat \c[3]100 enemies by using the environment\c[0] as the final blow.
\c[2]Unlock 76%\c[0] of all Enemy Reports. We're all Reporters now.
Win the \c[3]every PvP Battle against Apollo without losing any rounds\c[0].
Deal \c[3]\v[misc.localNum.50000] Damage with a single hit\c[0]. A punch that echoed throughout history.
Win the \c[3]second PvP Battle against Apollo\c[0].
Win the \c[3]third PvP Battle against Apollo\c[0].
Acquire the \c[3]Heat Element\c[0]. It's getting hot in here.
Acquire the \c[3]Cold Element\c[0]. Can anyone else not feel their fingers?
Acquire the \c[3]Shock Element\c[0]. This is Shocking!
Execute a total of \c[3]\v[misc.localNum.1000] Combat Arts\c[0].
Execute a total of \c[3]\v[misc.localNum.5000] Combat Arts\c[0].
Execute a total of \c[3]\v[misc.localNum.10000] Combat Arts\c[0].
Execute a total of \c[3]\v[misc.localNum.50000] Combat Arts\c[0].
Defeat a total of \c[3]\v[misc.localNum.50000] Enemies\c[0]. At this point you know the drill.
Deal a total of \c[3]\v[misc.localNum.5000000] Damage\c[0]. It's time to stop now.
Stay in a combo streak for \c[3]5 minutes\c[0].
Stay in a combo streak for \c[3]10 minutes\c[0].
Stay in a combo streak for \c[3]15 minutes\c[0].
Stay in a combo streak for \c[3]20 minutes\c[0]. Come on, this is is enough.
Defeat a total of \c[3]25 enemies doing a combat streak\c[0].
Defeat a total of \c[3]50 enemies doing a combat streak\c[0].
Defeat a total of \c[3]100 enemies doing a combat streak\c[0].
Defeat a total of \c[3]200 enemies doing a combat streak\c[0].  Calm down!
Throw and hit a total of \c[3]\v[misc.localNum.1000] Balls\c[0].
Throw and hit a total of \c[3]\v[misc.localNum.5000] Balls\c[0].
Throw and hit a total of \c[3]\v[misc.localNum.10000] Balls\c[0].
Throw and hit a total of \c[3]\v[misc.localNum.50000] Balls\c[0]. Your arms must be tired.
Sucessfully land \c[3]\v[misc.localNum.50000] close combat attacks\c[0]. Mashing to victory!
Dash a total of \c[3]\v[misc.localNum.50000] times\c[0]. My head feels dizzy...
Successfully guard a \c[3]total of \v[misc.localNum.5000] times\c[0]. Don't touch me!
Land a total of \c[3]\v[misc.localNum.1000] critcal hits\c[0].
Land a total of \c[3]\v[misc.localNum.5000] critcal hits\c[0].
Land a total of \c[3]\v[misc.localNum.10000] critcal hits\c[0].
Land a total of \c[3]\v[misc.localNum.50000] critcal hits\c[0]. Hit 'em where it hurts.
Find and analyze \c[3]25% of all Environmental Objects\c[0].

\c[3]Find 100% of all Lore Entries\c[0] in CrossWorlds. All mysteries solved?

\c[3]Find all Landmarks\c[0] in Autumn's Rise, Rookie Harbor and Autumn's Fall.

\c[3]Find and open all Chests\c[0] in \v[area.shock-dng.name], \v[area.wave-dng.name] and \v[area.tree-dng.name].

A bright and lush area painted in the warm colors of autumn.
The small guild village sometimes called "Hidden Leaf".
An abandoned Observatory, now crawling with enemies.
Western Exit leading to Rookie Harbor.
Exit to the rural Bergen Trail area.
A memorial of unknown purpose in the center of Autumn's Rise.
Known for it's many ponds and ruins this area is the little brother of Autumn's Rise.
East Exit of Autumn's Fall leading to the Sapphire Ridge.
The remains of a ancient village serve as a second entrance into Autumn's Fall.
North Exit of Autumn's Fall leading to the Gaia's Garden.
South Exit of Autumn's Fall located near an ruined outpost of the Ancients.
A rural area leading up to the cold town of Bergen.
A lonesome house, commonly used as half-way break from the difficult climb.
This landmark is only a few steps away from Bergen Village! You can do it!
The base of \v[area.bergen-trails.name]. Often used as a preparation spot before the climb.
A sleepy village hidden in the snowy heights of Mount Berg.
Once an Inn this landmark now serves as library an official bureau.
Checkpoint for tired travelers who just finished the climb on \v[area.bergen-trails.name].
One of the many cargo ships belonging to the maintenance crew of CrossWorlds.
A once busy Mine with an uncovered temple crawling with hostile robots.
This is where everything goes that is not wanted.
The tranquil ridge filled with bamboo structures and hidden paths.
And old training ground build by early settlers.
A rough path between caves leading to an old dojo.
An Inn designed after temples used to build centuries ago in a foreign land.
West Exit of \v[area.forest.name] leading to the \v[area.autumn-fall.name].
A dusty and barren area where only the fittest survive.
The western entrance of \v[area.heat-area.name] leading to  \v[area.heat-village.name].
A single pillar inside the Great Scar from which a temple of the Ancient can be seen.
A landmark located close to the arcing stone structures of Maroon Valley.
A lush and vivid oasis crowned by a majestic maroon tree.
The eastern entrance of \v[area.heat-area.name] leading to \v[area.bergen-trails.name].
An ancient temple whose shape granted it the nickname "Hourglass".
A quiet Shad village set in a small ravine in Maroon Valley.
Right in front of the largest Building in town and only a few steps a way from the market.
A techno-castle build on an island inside \c[3]Gaia's Garden\c[0] where it always rains.
The rainy and shiny center of Basin Keep, home to many traders.
The great jungle of the north, home to the giant Tree known as "Gaia".
A crossroad leading to the Zir’vitar Temple, So’najiz Temple and the Grand Krys’kajo.
These marshes have been infested by the corruption spreading from the north.
This landmarks links the two main paths to the Grand Krys’kajo.
A small Shad settlement using trees as homes and bridges to connect them.
A covert with a bright lake hidden in the north-west corner of \v[area.jungle.name].
The entrance to \v[area.jungle.name]. A popular place for traders.
The final tutorial dungeon teaching players the basics of CrossWorlds.
The pulsating heart of CrossWorlds. Only accessible for advanced players.
The Balcony right above the main teleportation hub of CrossWorlds.
The main teleportation hub of CrossWorlds and the central entrance to Rhombus Square.
A bustling city positively bursting with life, start of many adventures for new players.
The entrance to Rookie Harbor from Cross Central.
A beautiful fountain sitting in the center of the busy marketplace.
An ancient shad temple, home to many shocking creatures.
Hey, how can ye read this? This is not part of the bloody playground, ye dobber!
Testing a landmark, is like testing a landmark. I have text.
Overgrown by a gigantic tree, this temple is guarded by an ancient entity.
An ancient underwater shad temple, home to many bouncing foes.
It seems like they still have not given those average quest NPCs more nuanced responses.
Well, that is good news for us.
Otherwise doing sidequests might be problematic with your limited means of communication.
Yes, I am sorry.\. I will continue working on it now.
Huh... I guess we have to reach those glowing spots, right?
More glowing spots... all over the place.
Bunnies. We're currently fighting cute little bunnies.
Let's see how those \v[combat.name.hedgehog]s will fare!
A snowman? W-Why would it attack us?!
NOOOO!! NOT THE BUGS! WHY WOULD YOU FIGHT THE BUGS, LEA?!
WHY ARE YOU DOING THIS TO ME?!
WHAT IS THIS? ARE THEY WALKING?!
ARE THOSE SWORDS?! WHY DO THESE BUGS HAVE SWORDS?!
LEA PLEASE! MAKE THEM GO AWAY!!
LEA I HATE THOSE THINGS, PLEASE!
I THOUGH I'D SEE THOSE THINGS IN THE JUNGLE. WHY ARE THEY HERE INSTEAD?
NOOO! STOP FIGHTING THE BUGS PLEASE! LEA!
THOSE THINGS ARE TOO CREEPY! AND FAST! AND JUMPY!
NOO! WHY WON'T YOU STOP FIGHTING THE BUGS?!
Damn it, Lea. I can only handle so many bugs per day.
Again with the bugs? Can't we fight something else?
Alright, I get it! You like fighting those bugs!
Actually... I think I truly start getting used to those... things.
This enemy seems strong, better be careful!
You do like a challenge, don't you Lea?
We may want to level up a bit before taking this one on.
Mon dieu, it's strong and aggressive! I hate those!
Lea, maybe we should, you know... \c[3]run\c[0]?!
We didn't ask for this battle, or did we?
I guess someone needs a lesson here!
You'd be the type to run marathons in your spare time, Lea?
...Lea?\. I think I need a break.
Do you ever plan to stop, Lea?
How about some live and let live, Lea?
L-Lea...? There is no need to keep fighting, right?
Y-You don't plan to stop anytime soon, do you?
Mon dieu! You just keep going!
Uhm... anyone up for a break?
You're pretty into fighting, aren't you?
ARE THEY GONE?! PLEASE TELL ME THEY'RE GONE.
IS IT OVER?! PLEASE LET IT BE OVER.
Are those things supposed to be... Samurai or something? THEY'RE STILL BUGS, THOUGH!
You won't stop fighting them anytime soon, won't you?
What is this? Some kind of shock therapy?
Let's fight something else next, d'accord?
Did we fight enough bugs already?
Wow, I think I'm healed. It's all good, Lea. We can now stop fighting them!

Not sure if awesome 
or just creepy.
And that was our first hedgehag. Simple enough!
Do you ever wonder what kind of music those things are listening to?
They do seem very much into it, non?
They were cute at first, now they're just annoying.
No, I won't accept this. Snowmen are great.
I love building snowmen. Peaceful snowmen.
Bunnies, hedgehogs and now snowmen of all things.
Everything tries to kill you. The Track of the Ancients is messed up.
Aaaand that was a flying seahorse shooting bubbles. D'accord.
Oui. Penguins on mountains. That's a thing in CrossWorlds.
Well, at least they have some water around here.
They just defy gravity and climb wherever they please.
Well.. at least regular goats won't shoot horns at you.
We used to have a zoo with goats at my place, you know?
And they kept escaping their compound. Simply climbed over that fence. Pas de problème!
So you had goats all over the zoo, that was awesome!
So yeah, that zoo, right? The one where the goats escaped.
Of course they tried to change the fence so the goats couldn't escape.
Made it higher and more difficult to climb over.
Guess what? The goats still managed to escape using a small building next to the fence.
Oui, I take that back. Those bunnies are not cute.
Those bunnies are not cute. Non.
Those bunnies have quite the kick!
But it's nothing compared to the Pentafist's punch, am I right Lea?
I think we can safely rename Bergen Trail to "Bunny Mountain", non?
Huh. Did we just beat up a cow with some kind of iron mask?
We used to have cows in the neighborhood when I was a child.
I kinda liked the cows in our neighborhood.\. They were cute.
Oui, these buffalos are rough in comparison, but still.\. Feeling sorta bad about this.
I used to see cows everyday on my way to school.
After some time I think they even started recognizing me!
Did you ever drink fresh cow milk? It's délicieux!
I actually once milked a cow myself! Sorta weird feeling at the beginning.
Hey, you're not doing this to mess with me, oui?
Wait...\. Yes.\. What do you mean by that?
Oui, oui, they brought back the cows!
Still feeling bad for punching them.
We finally got birds in CrossWorlds. Très bien.
Other than those space birds, that is.
Hm...Snowman... reminds me of ice cream~
You... like ice cream a lot, don't you?
Don't even think about licking those Snowmen, Tronny!
W-What? No! I'm sure they won't even taste like anything.
...\. ...\. That's a good point. Now I'm curious.
Of course we can't have a desert without scorpions...
At least I think these are scorpions.. with 4 legs instead of 8.
They say smaller scorpions are more dangerous... Doesn't quite apply to those.
Scorpions are actually pretty amazing.\. They can survive up to one year with just one meal.
Are those shark skeletons? That's funny.
Sharks don't even have proper bones. It's all cartilage.
These sharksters can be tricky to hit. Good thing I have homing VRPs!
Vulturbines, huh? Must be inspired by vultures.
Vultures with... guns? Makes you wonder how they can still fly.
There are a lot of interesting facts about vultures.
Though a lot of them involve bodily fluids. I'd rather not mention those.
Drillertoise? I honestly have no idea what those are supposed to be.
Tronny, you like to keep your distance in battle, don't you?
Well... I'm a Hexacast. I specialize in ranged attacks.
You should join me in punching the enemies up close! It's more fun!
Punching? We Hexacast don't punch. We use a close-proximity magical impact.
So what? I can call my fist magical too, if you like.
I don't like those earth turtles. They are hard to punch.
Very true. Also Emilie, those are tortoise. Turtles would mostly be in water.
Are you sure? They do dive into the earth like it's water, non?
Learn how to use \c[3]Melee Arts\c[0] in combat.
Press and hold \i[special] to charge the attack.

You can change your \c[3]direction\c[0] while charging.
Release \i[special] again to execute the attack.
Learn how to use \c[3]Throw Arts\c[0] in combat.
While aiming press and hold \i[special] to charge the attack.
You can change the direction while charging.
Release \i[special] again to execute the attack.
Learn how to use \c[3]Dash Arts\c[0] in combat.
\c[0]Dash\c[0] into a direction and press \i[special] at the \c[3]same time\c[0] to charge a Dash Art.
Release \i[special] again to execute the attack.
Learn how to use \c[3]Guard Arts\c[0] in combat.
While you guard, press and hold \i[special] to charge the Guard Art.
Release \i[special] again to execute the attack.
Learn how to view and track your \c[3]Quests\c[0].
You can see all your quests within the \c[3]quest menu\c[0].
Focus a quest to see details on the left.
You can see more details by selecting a quest.
Press \i[help2] to \c[3]mark\c[0] a quest as favorite. You can mark any number of quests!
You can circle through the tasks of marked quests outside the menu by \c[3]pressing\c[0] \i[left-stick] and \i[right-stick].
You can circle through the tasks of marked quests outside the menu with \i[circle-left] and \i[circle-right].

Learn how to view and track your progress in the
\c[3]Botanics Menu\c[0].
You can find the \c[3]Botanics Menu\c[0] within the \c[3]Synopsis menu\c[0].
See how much drops you need to complete the entry.
Once progress reaches 50% you can find a more detailed location here.
Elite Quest are difficult quests marked with an \c[3]exclamation mark and red outlines\c[0].
Even on the same level these quest can be very challenging. However, they often offer \c[3]better loot as reward\c[0].
Mon dieu! What is going on?!
I'm back to kick some derrière!
I see there are still enemies left for me!
...Pardon. That was just too much for me to handle.
Excellent! Got new gear to punch enemies even harder!
Lea, look at the new stuff I just bought!
Getting closer to the ultimate punching machine, one step at a time!
I got new gear! Too bad your appearance doesn't change, non?
Dang-it! That attack came out of nowhere!
...You know that water can have 3 states. And this is the only deadly one.
I'm back! I see you're still going strong... right?
Looks like I wasn't quite up to the challenge, sorry.
Gosh... That didn't go too well... sorry.
I got some new gear. Yes, mages have gear, too.
I got my gear up-to-date now. It was about time.
I got some really cool gear this time!
Got new gear. Though I wonder how those edges and triggers are supposed to improve my magic...
Hm... I think we have to enter the dungeon somewhere else to continue.
Lea, Lea. Taking your time to revisit previous dungeon rooms while the race is on hold, non?
And back to the race! Gee, where did I leave off again?
Dungeon time, it is! See you again, soon!
So you need a break from that gloomy mine? Alright.
But let's hurry. We still have to finish the race!
Wait... If anybody needs a break, everybody leaves the dungeon?
That is... a very lax kind of race, isn't it?
Sure, it's not like I was right in the middle of that one puzzle...
No problem. I can simply redo that one battle I just had to cancel.
And all the immersion is gone.
Ahh, finally some daylight! It's just way too gloomy in those dungeons.
Uhm, hey Lea. Why the DL? I'm in your party, non?
Bonjour Lea! Tronny and me are still waiting at the \c[3]statue\c[0] in \c[3]Autumn's Fall - Ancient Center\c[0]! Let's meet there!
Lea, just meet me and Tronny at \c[3]Rookie Harbor Center\c[0]! We'll be waiting next to the \c[3]fountain\c[0]!
Hey Lea! Pardon I got nothing interesting to say today.
Lazy devs didn't get the work done yet.
Hey Lea! We should go back to the \c[3]First Scholars\c[0] and do that quiz already, non?
Sorry, I'm really tense right now.
There could be more of those horrible bugs around every corner, you know?
What is it Lea? Already tired from dungeon crawling?
Good! I sure hope you won't drop out of our race!
Just now, I saw a group of \c[3]penguins\c[0]!
I'm preeeetty sure that penguins are usually not around mountains.
Aaaanyway, just tell me when you want to start a party!
And don't forget, no entering the next dungeon without me, d'accord?
Bonjour! I'm currently in \c[3]\v[area.autumn-area.name]\c[0] enjoying the landscape.
Hm? It's getting a bit late Lea. I actually think I'll log off soon.
So no more party today, pardon.
Let's just chill a bit longer here on top of Faj'ro Temple.
Bonjour Lea! Tronny and me are still waiting at the \c[3]statue\c[0] in \c[3]Autumn's Fall - Ancient Center\c[0]! Let's meet there!
Lea, just meet me and Tronny at \c[3]Rookie Harbor Center\c[0]! We'll be waiting next to the \c[3]fountain\c[0]!
Hey Lea! I'll just focus on finishing that quest myself, oui? See you later!
Yes! Party time! Une seconde, I'll be right there!
I see you're looking for a formidable punching force. I'm ready!
It's time for chakrams and fists to roll over the field!
So you want to do the Autumn's Fall Quest by yourself after all? D'accord!
Just make sure to tell me once you collected the Shade!
That was fun! Any time again!
Awww, already? Well...\. see you soon!
Hi, Lea! It's nice running around with you in CrossWorlds!
Though... I think it's ok if we just talk normally, right? No need to use a Direct Link.
Hello Lea! We are waiting for you at the \c[3]statue\c[0] in \c[3]Autumn's Fall - Ancient Center\c[0]! See you soon!
Hello Lea! Emilie and I are waiting for you at \c[3]Rookie Harbor Center\c[0], right next to the \c[3]fountain\c[0]!
... Well... Not much to talk about so far, right?
Small talk has never been my forte.
But I may have more to say to you in \c[3]future versions\c[0] of the game.
Uhm... it's getting rather late isn't it?
I'm also a bit tired right after beating Faj'ro Temple. Let's call it day, okay?
Hello Lea! We are waiting for you at the \c[3]statue\c[0] in \c[3]Autumn's Fall - Ancient Center\c[0]! See you soon!
Hello Lea! Emilie and me are waiting for you at \c[3]Rookie Harbor Center\c[0], right next to the \c[3]fountain\c[0]!
Are you in need of a mage? I'll be right there!
Sure I'd gladly join if that bit of magic of mine is enough for you.
Sure, it's always nice chillin' in CrossWorlds together, right?
Oh, so you want to do the Quest yourself after all? That's fair.
Please don't forget about the Raid though. Let us know when you collected the Shade!
It was a cool time! See you soon!
Thanks for the chill time! Glad to join you again!
I'm just glad I didn't bust up the wrong thing today. Until then!
Good morning! You are online again, I see.
When you logged in, you probably ended up in the empty headquarters, eh?
Everybody is busy with other things right now, it seems.
But you can still contact everybody with \c[3]Direct Links\c[0] if you have any questions or need help.
Lea, dear, is this really the time for a DL?
I'm waiting with the others in the seminar room.
Let's redo the quiz once you refreshed your knowledge about \c[3]Di'aro\c[0]!
Lea, dear! How is it going with the dungeon?
It has been some time now. Then again, the Temple Mine is quite long.
Hm? What is it? Wait...\. did you beat the boss already?
Oh Wonderful! Then make sure to read all the information you get at the heritage site.
And come back to the \c[3]First Scholar HQ\c[0] afterwards.
I'm waiting with a nice \c[3]quiz\c[0] for you!
Hello, Lea! How is it going? Already exploring the dungeon?
Dear, just remember it's a game.
And with patience I'm sure you'll be able to get through it!
Lea, dear! We just shared contacts and I already get a message, how sweet!
I'm really looking forward to your quiz!
I'll prepare the best questions for you two!
Don't worry, dear! I'll keep it simple.
Good day. Is something the matter?
So why would you contact me?
Are you by chance wondering about my \c[3]nickname\c[0]?
You may have noticed nobody calls me that.
I understand they find the name cheesy.
I mean it's the name of an old legendary hero.
But it seems it's rather overused. What a shame.
I probably should have gone with something simple like your name.
Good day. Is something the matter?
It's rather strange to contact someone just to say "Hi!", isn't it?
Hello! And how is it in the dungeon?
Did you already see the... \c[3]non-mechanical\c[0] enemies?
Come on, bugs are awesome, right? Especially if there's a lot of them!
No? Man, bugs are so underappreciated.
Hello. You reached the voice mail of First Scholars member "Buggy".
Please leave a message after the beep.
You almost bought it, didn't you?
Hi there, Lea! Already in the dungeon?
Good luck, then! Hope you won't be overrun by all the machinery!
I'm sure you'll handle it fine!
Hallihallo! Trying out contacts via DL?
Japp. Modern communication as you'd expect it.
Voice with hologram representations - the full packet.
It's weird if you think about it. A hologram of your avatar.
So the player is hidden behind the avatar as well as the hologram. Pretty indirect, hm?
Ah've just got a beep from ma machine.
Ya'll already found 25% o' all them plants.
Now that's what I like to hear.
I hav' a lil somethin' for ya'll. Ya'll come meet me in \c[3]Bergen Quest Hub\c[0].

When it's dark and spooky out in the night, the blazing pumpkin will come and eat you alive. 
One wrong step, one loud noise, be afraid of the pumpkin in the night.

A strange being that roams the lands of \c[3]\v[area.arid.name]\c[0]. It randomly jumps on prey and attacks them multiple times. 
Luckily their defense is rather low and can be disposed off quickly with any attack.

A version of the \v[combat.name.arid/virus-neutral] that uses Heat based attacks. It uses the neutral Viruses as pawns to attack its enemies. However this is also its weak spot. Once the neutral ones are stunned, push them into the Heat Virus to break their shield.

A version of the \v[combat.name.arid/virus-neutral] that uses Cold based attacks. It uses the neutral Viruses as pawns to attack its enemies. However this is also its weak spot. Once the neutral ones are stunned, push them into the Cold Virus to break their shield.
This training dummy is used for new players to test \c[3]Combat Arts\c[0] and other techniques without the fear of getting attacked.

A self acclaimed warrior of justice who accuses Lea of cheating and thus challenges her to a duel. Which he lost. However he still is quite the fighter and gets more vicious the more desperate his situation. Using melee combos followed by \c[3]Spin Dance Art\c[0] or a double \c[3]Azure Strike\c[0] are moves to watch out for.
As expected when winning over you he acted quite smug and managed to lecture you again. Classic.

A guard patrolling the route used by the \c[3]Calzone Family\c[0] to smuggles mushrooms from the infested area to \c[3]Basin Keep\c[0]. Their job is to walk the corridors of the cave system and check for any suspicious entities; all day.

A corrupt guard that holds no respect for the Shad that are native on Shadoon. Did formerly hold a respectable position in the \c[3]Maroon Baki Guard\c[0], before his crimes were uncovered.

While his sense for justice is warped, he is still a very capable fighter. He wields the standard issue Laserlance of the guards with great skill and always carries a few of his favorite sandwiches, in case the battle tires him.

An armed human, currently or formerly employed by one of the many city guards on Shadoon.

Wield a powerful type of weapon that is used by most guards, the Laserlance. Also usually carries a standard ration of Sandwiches to recover from tiresome battles.

This large hedgehog creature can usually be found in packs of up to 20. Normally it is peaceful but when provoked it will use its sharp needles to attack its predator. 
No one really knows why it was named \c[3]\v[combat.name.hedgehog]\c[0]. Some say it was a typo when the enemy was first named. Other say it stirs from it's violent nature when provoked in packs. It's a mystery.
According to some players defeating multiple \v[combat.name.hedgehog]s in a certain area of \c[3]\v[area.autumn-area.name]\c[0] will lead to a rare event.

This rare Hedgehag can only be found under certain conditions and is commonly theorized to be the leader of other Hedgehags in the region. He is feared for his speedy attacks and his blue color and red eyes make him unique. Usually mistaken as a third eye the object on it's forehead is actually a gem. If someone is brave enough to face it and defeat it it often leaves behind a golden ring of unknown origin.

A rare type of \c[3]Pengpeng\c[0] that setup a den deep in the mountains of \c[3]Bergen Trails\c[0]. When approached it immediately thinks that you want to steal its flow and jumps up to his "stage". He will summon Pengpengs and command them to do different attacks based on his temper. Anger him by defeating all Pengpengs to make him jump down.
It can make offers, you can not refuse.

This strange bug hides inside rocks to lure on its prey. It attacks everything without warning. Despite its short height it capable of inflicting dangerous wounds by dashing towards its mark with great speed. The attacks are also cold based which makes them an even larger threat.

This little bugger is actually a cybernetic parasite capable of taking over mechanical systems. Once infested the machines are used to fight off hostiles and expand the colony. To fight them off your best bet is fire since these bugs are extremely vulnerable to heat. So basically like every bug. Kill it with fire.

This littler bugger is actually a cybernetic parasite capable of taking over mechanical systems. Once infested the machines are used to fight off hostiles and expand the colony. To fight them off your best bet is fire since these bugs are extremely vulnerable to heat. So basically like every bug. Kill it with fire.

A sub type of the \v[combat.name.mine-coldbug]. Instead of combining powers to send a single bug against you, this variant creates a large fire cyclone. 
Against all instincts this enemy is very weak to Cold. So... kill it with Ice!
A ghostly image formed by the \v[combat.name.minibosses/cursed-sandshark]. They can't be hurt but you can interrupt their attacks to keep them off you for a while.

A cursed beast that lurked below Maroon Valley. It once stole coins from a cursed chest and turned into a undying creature. The only way to defeat it, is by finding the cursed content of the chest and returning it. 
I can summon ghostly version of itself that can not be defeated unless the chest is filled with coins.

These slimy creatures spend most of their time halfway underground almost looking like a deformed stone. The bodies of Tims a extremely flexible and can fit into holes the size of a hand. 
Ironically they do not like overheating and will get extremely hostile when exposed to it for to long. In their enraged form they will spit out scorching hot rocks and move much faster.
According to some insight by C'tron worms posses 5 hearts. It's mystery how they fit into this elastic body.

A slightly mutated version of the normal \c[3]Tim\c[0] which made the cave be low the famous \c[3]Maroon Tree in Maroon Valley\c[0] its home.
It seems to have some sort of control over the rock formations inside the cave being able to to rise and lower parts of the cave system. 
It uses this to attack intruders from higher ground without them being able to reach it. However disposing other Tim can raise platforms to make it possible to reach him.

This bug is a true warrior and master of the hidden arts of the blade. Trained by a master since its birth it takes down enemies with powerful strikes. Strikes so powerful they combust the air around them and create flames.
Its weapon of choice are dual swords known as "Sun Blade". When threatened it can summon a heat barrier and uses an fake-out attack by jumping behind its enemies following up with a huge fire swirl.

This bug is a true warrior and master of the hidden arts of the blade. Trained by a master since its birth it takes down enemies with swift strikes. It is said to be so fast that it can even dodge bullets.
Its weapon of choice are dual swords known as "Moon Blade". When threatened it can summon a shock barrier and uses an extremely fast attack that uses both sword to slice through its enemies.

Mostly found in caves in \v[area.forest.name] this supersized spider is the nightmare of many miners. It slows downs its prey and then attacks with a deafening scream. In groups it teams up with other \v[combat.name.forest/spider]s. Watch us as it leaps on with ice cold power.
