Soft armor infused with the lifeforce of headstrong bovines.
Piercing weapon that is low in power but offers a surprisingly deadly potential.
Footwear with some mysterious, thus unrealized power.
Heavy boots with additional weight. Reinforces the stability of whoever wears them.
Comfortable sandals which offer little protection but grant a liberating feeling.
Symbolize agility, surefootedness and a weakness for moving lights.
Revitalizing garment of living material. It's gnawed on one side.
Ferocious vest forged for fearless front-line fighters. Friggin' fantastic.
Cap with a simple scope attached that allows for a faster aim.
What seems like a desperate attempt at class can reveal a foe's weak spots.
Actually looks like a key, fitting into a triangle-shaped hole.
A rather odd looking key. The key bit is shaped like a triangle.
Looks like a heart. Stands for the will of an old kingdom.
Though in bad shape now, it was once a regalia of an Ancient civilization in the desert.
Keeps sweat out of the eyes and supposedly helps to concentrate.
Small, rusty blade for close quarters. Cheap, yet dangerous.
A huge radish that can be both a fearsome weapon and a healthy meal.
Weapon of choice for hoodlums with a passion for arson.
Heavy plate made from spare metal parts. Offers good protection but limits mobility.
Shaped like a bulls hooves. Infuses their wearer with obstinacy.
An old shard used as template in the beta phase of CrossWorlds.
The ultimate sandwich made by a legendary cook. \c[2]Heals 80% of max HP\c[0].
A well seasoned loaf for heated battles.
Bread made with zesty hot sauce.
Brings the eternal inferno right to your mouth.
Fresh wraps made with grilled tofu.
Hits your body with pure joy on every bite.
A refreshing beverage for sunny days.
Healthy salad. Does not contain any tomatoes.
An exquisite pastry topped with exotic fruits.
A cracker made of rice. It's a bit salty.
Perfect with a tiny bit of soy milk.
The classic cheese cracker. Never gets old. Never.
Best enjoyed at sunset on top of a clocktower.
Prepare for mild to severe discomfort.
A rare type of tomato salad seasoned with some ginger and salt.
Perfect to shortly keep you warm on a cold winter night.
Someone must have hit it with a blunt object at high velocity.
Pointy needles plucked from a \v[combat.name.hedgehog]. Ouch! Told you so.
Actual skin from Bovines which feel almost like leather.
Nobody really knows where hillkats get them but they sound amazing.
Useful to have when traveling the mountains and fighting snowbeasts.
Ideal for those who aspire to move at high velocities.
If you don't have one, you might get yourself killed.
Chili Con Carne in a bun. The favorite food of blue hedgehogs.
Meat from animals brutally butchered in the wild.
Almost tiny drill whose strength depends on the willpower of the user.
Said to be able to pierce through the heaven itself.
Simple leaves commonly found in Autumn's Rise.
Eating them apparently helps to keep the doctor away for one day.
These little bugs hide on plants near rivers and only come out to search for food.
Used to grow rare plants that need pure and clean water.
A rare autumn bug who only chants his melody in bright moonlight.
These beautiful creatures sparkle azure blue at dawn until the sun sets.
Mostly obtained from traders. Contains everything from beans to sweet potatoes.
Mostly obtained from traders. Contains everything from bananas to strawberries.
Various metal parts. Might look old but could be used to create new equipment.
A rare gem which forms a strange helix spiral.
They will make you sparkle with every step. Literally.
Ranged weapon, ideal to defend a fortified border against hostile neighbors.
A single leaf from the infamous Feather Trees only found on Bergen Trail.
Nuts and Bolts. Ancient history says they where once used as currency.
Dropped by solitary conifer trees. Could this crystal cone be a sign of their loneliness?
Falling butt first on these sure must hurt. So you better watch out!
Common metal ore probably found in one of the many mining shafts.
Once used as material for nobility furniture. But who wants to sit on a spiky throne?
Makes you feel incredibly cool inside.
This gauntlet may have seen better days but can still take and dish out a solid beating.
This long-ranged weapon is often used by soldiers at sea.
A sharp and reliable classic of warfare.
A robust tool, often used to dig through mountain and monster alike.
A shining weapon that was once even used to battle among the stars.
A headscarf drenched in cooling liquid that protects against heat and sunburns.
A headband with long, fluffy ears that resemble those of a bunny.
Very robust goggles. Frames are iron. Glasses are glass.
The ideal headgear for cold climates. Very hard to keep clean though.
High boots with spiked soles. Useful on slippery ground.
Well-crafted footgear that ensures both mobility and safe feet.
Very reliable body armor. Also the standard equipment of an elite delivery service.
Heavy plate made out of almost unbreakable rock. Emits distinctive sounds on hit.
Made from needles and bug shells to create a natural protection. Be careful in crowds!
A mysterious belt that constantly covers the owner in protective bubbles.
People often burst in sheer joy when touching this soft fur.
An absurdly hard beak. It can actually be molten into a rare type of metal.
Yes, this is a bubble. It simply won't pop and some people like that.
Someone dropped this mic hard. It's shattered and unusable.
Mostly obtained from traders. Contains everything from black pepper to saffron.
It's the end. But patience will be rewarded.
While eating it emits a strange echo mimicking chewing sounds.
Rusty and broken. This weapon is as useful as it looks. A true waste of metal.
Grants insight into the mysteries of the world.
An old artifact used to catch a fleeting glimpse of a vast treasure.
Another example of a useless piece of equipment.
A package of freshly picked ingredients from Autumn Rise for an important business lunch.
A carrot preserved with a thin coating of ice. It's full of precious vitamins!
A really fancy type of hat. Sadly this hasn't protected it from some vicious holes.
Long, slightly curved horns, made from shiny metal. They also have a distinct smell.
The legendary bunny captured in what looks like a ball-shaped capture device.
Scarcely used gloves belonging to a young martial artist, learning an ancient art.
A roundish-shaped device. It can absorb the soul of defeated enemies.
A regular key for Faj’ro Temple.
The pass for \c[3]Temple Mine\c[0]. Acquired after extensive amounts of forced exposition.
A conventionally shaped rock that emits neutrality. Might one day empower your circuit?
A repair kit for the generator in the basement of the Hermit's House.
A regular key for the Temple Mine.
The master key for Temple Mine.
A rusty but astoundingly sturdy key. Opens bronze chests.
A silver key so bright it appears white. Opens silver chests.
A golden key emitting a mesmerizing pulse. Opens golden chests.
A spherical jewel, shifting smoothly between orange and red colors.
A shell shaped like a bug. It emits a blue aura, pulsating almost like a heartbeat.
You can hear something buzzing inside.
An expertly patched tophat. It's not uniquely impressive but at least without holes.
Decorated with goat horns and a pink flower. It really shows that you mean business!
Just gears made out of metal, yepp.
Worn out sandals, probably of Ancient origin. Still emit some residual aura.
Still quite sour despite lots of sugar, but filled with precious vitamins.
So hot, you will stop feeling cold for quite some time.
The best flavor of ice cream, everyone knows that!
A special hat you got from \c[3]Holiday Man\c[0] for helping him.
A present from \c[3]Holiday Man\c[0]. Give it to other players!
Grants access to the guild village and First Scholars home in Autumn's Rise.
A liquid extracted from the fruits of the \v[area.autumn-area.name]. Allegedly heals sick trees.
Geographical data collected by the explorer Tucos, stored on a small data storage.
A lost and found data probe installed by Henry the Researcher.
Special sand used to forge extremely sturdy glass.
A rock that shimmers brightly when held against the sunlight.
This unique gem only forms at cliffsides during the rare rainfalls.
Sweet water, rich in minerals. Found in the rivers of Maroon Valley.
A mix between a palm tree and a pineapple. It might sting when eaten.
A hybrid between a water melon and a cactus. Both juicy and sweet!
Fossilized bones with engraved symbols on them.
This tremendous fossil is colored in shades of red and yellow.
It's almost transparent, making it appear as ordinary glass to most people.
An gem so old that it precedes the time of the Ancients themselves.
A mysterious piece of tech dropped by the \c[3]Hillkat Bandleader\c[0]. It might store data?
This salty crystal is shaped like a leek and is used in local cuisine.
A piece of wood so sturdy that it can survive without water for centuries.
This inconspicuous rock holds the most durable ore on all of Shadoon.
A rare chestnut found only close to the old maroon tree in Maroon Valley.
A highly concentrated healing ointment made from the fruits of the \v[area.autumn-area.name].
Polished yet still used metal parts. Created from old metal parts.
High quality metal created by melting refined metal parts.
Metal popular among the Ancients. Extracted from precious metal parts.
An outstanding steak with the perfect marinade.
A stinger from the tail of a \v[combat.name.heat.scorpion]. Still full of poison.
A incredibly sharp stone in the shape of a drilling head.
Tail bone of a \v[combat.name.heat.sandshark] which is more fragile than one might think.
A tooth that is soft to the touch. Truly uncanny.
Despite it's name this liver is free of any strange substances.
Does not cure death despite popular belief. But it does look nice.
Yellow silk used to craft nigh-impenetrable garn.
No matter how you stretch it, the shape of a triangle persists.
Left by the extreme heat a \v[combat.name.heat.heat-golem] creates when attacking.
A crystal ball that is said to grant the feat to shoot rays of light.
Steel frames with reinforced glasses allow for an excellent protection of the eyes.
A powerful weapon crafted from a highly tempered alloy of iron and carbon.
Fine body armor from reinforced steel. Sadly also popular with criminals.
Very robust but still as light as possible. Even blisters are a rare occurrence.
A huge fin attached to a cap. Helps to keep balance and grants a predatory aura.
A long, self-regrowing carrot. It's vitamins give life, the pointy end takes it away.
A lacquered vest, often worn in dry regions. Was named for its sweet smell.
Can't be made without Sand, so they're obviously ideal for the desert.
Typical headress of hunters in the desert who are said to be excellent marksmen.
A fine headscarf blessed with cooling protection to withstand even scorching heat.
Polished glasses that give off a threatening glare. In need of regular readjustment.
Shad-crafted flowing robes, blessed by the Ancient power of the elements.
Light clothes for covert operations that are made to look strikingly inconspicuous.
Heavy plate, reinforced with crystals and gems that actively defend against harm.
Amazingly soft and comfortable footwear that somehow also manages to be curly.
Heavy boots with extravagant decorations. Reinforce both stance and self-esteem.
Feel almost alive on your feet. The soles are crafted from real magic carpets.
Small, surprising and deadly. The preferred weapon of spies and assassins.
Once wielded by a young hero of great courage but little sense.
Gauntlets with excellent armor. Many owners would already be dead without them.
A lost and found data probe installed by Henry the Researcher.
Opens the passage to \c[3]Maroon Valley\c[0] and activates \c[3]Neutral Level 2 Circuits\c[0].
A fine, lightly cooked piece of meat that is supposedly not very common.
A dark gem which emits strange sparks when touching it.
Just wearing this band will make enemies drop more Credits in fear.
Once used to train a young warrior aiming to be an all mighty hero.
Opens the path to \c[3]Autumn's Fall\c[0] and activates \c[3]Elemental Level 2 Circuits\c[0].
Grants passage to Grand Krys’kajo together with the Azure Drop Shade.
Worn and old gloves once belonging to a master of parries.
Some old looking image of a Frobbit, hewn into stone from Mt. Bergen.
Soft and warming socks, hand-knitted from healthy goat-wool by very patient monks.
Pass to access the sacred cave below the \c[3]Maroon Tree\c[0].
A shiny orb that is indeed very shiny. The statue in \c[3]Ba'kii Kum\c[0] should react to it.
A highly advanced mining tool based on a ages old classic.
Conventional chemical explosives combined with lasers. What could be stronger?
A long documentation describing the workings of the mine, complete in 70 languages.
Leaves covered with strange markings resembling animals.
These sweet apples are commonly used in juicy fruit salads.
Pure grain found near ruins all over Autumn's Fall.
Minerals found inside this dew make it appear orange when held against light.
A legendary autumn bug. Its melody resembles that of a howling wolf.
These creatures only appear at night, sparkling dark red.
The ultimate speedrunning item. Aim to become the fastest thing alive!
Weird lump of mass secreted by Flintzer. Is usually very soft but hardens on touch.
This leaf fell from a jungle plant and curled up on the ground.
The honeycomb is so sturdy that it is used to craft armor.
A piece of wood from the oldest trees found in the jungle.
Poisoned mushroom used to brew oils for weapons.
A luminescent sphere glowing because of chemical reactions inside it.
One of the roots responsible to the Infestation of a part of \v[area.jungle.name].
The bluish color of this fruit make it look inedible despite its sweet taste.
This colorful resin is commonly used to harden wood constructions.
Star-shaped fruit. Its origin date back to a small island in the ocean.
This fish jumps out of rivers into plants to absorb healthy nutrients.
\v[combat.name.jungle/parrot] store these in nearby water plants in case they need food.
A yellow bent fruit only found in rainy parts of \v[area.jungle.name].
Strange shimmering fruit. The inside seems to magically spin.
A special bee hive with the same density as a diamond.
Some old looking image of a PengPeng, hewn into ice-coated stone from Mt. Bergen.
Both silver frames and the flawless glass are giving of an impressive shine.
Very durable goggles that also offer visual augmentation.
Said to be effective against the unnatural. Works just fine against everything though.
With two of these powerful weapons you could slay even the largest of foes.
A sturdy mail, made from silver. Perfect when sleeping in a haunted castle.
Made from titanium, one of the strongest materials known to man.
The quality of these boots almost makes up for all the polishing they need.
While extremely robust, they are not actually made for titans, so they will fit just fine.
A regular key for Zir’vitar Temple.
Goat Interspecies Translator. Allows for communication with intelligent goats.
A really soft ball of fur close to the critical mass.
The classic. Probably want to keep that in a jar.
This leaf can be used to create all possible colors. In a range of 0-255 that is.
Spit out by Pagaguns as defensive measures. Can only be busted with strong pliers.
This callous claw is in need of a thorough manicure.
Impenetrable plate used by Behesloths to protect most of its body.
A vegetable of mythical power. Greatly increases the flexibility of fellow plants.
A mass of electricity with something that some describe as a "soul".
Are 100 gram of them as heavy as 100 gram of regular feathers? It's a mystery.
Perfectly rectangular shaped cube. There is nothing unusual about it.
A glowing bulb in form of a pear. Yepp.
A truly perfect guide for the exquisite plant lover.
Grants passage to Grand Krys’kajo together with the Purple Bolt Shade.
This inconspicuous hat enables the wearer to find even the rarest materials.
Pass to provide access to the temple complex within \v[area.jungle.name]
Surprisingly big variant of a tasty nut. Opening the shell is half of the fun!
Small, tasty plant seeds that are popular as a relaxing snack.
A classic wake-up drink. Drink it black to also feel more mature!
Highly-concentrated coffee with a distinct taste. Will eliminate all sleepiness.
Highly advanced, sharp looking shades. Don't throw them, though.
A rather tattered red Bandana once worn by a wandering warrior.
Construction helmet that creates a static field which disperses incoming voltage.
A classic hat, popular in cities. This version, though, emits a strange aura.
Headdress made by a famous Shad-Designer, modelled after a popular hairstyle.
Ranged weapon with high-precision, used to bring down game with few attacks.
Highly advanced gauntlet associated with hands-on approaches in law enforcement.
According to a translator it means "honor". In any case it keeps the wielder healthy.
Vicious looking weapon that always seems to be restless and unpredictable.
This savage tool was inspired by the weapons of nature and sharpens your instincts.
Small weapon that is easy to hide, especially in an opponent's weak-spots.
Ferocious armor made from the hardest parts of wild Bovines.
Heavy plate with built-in life support system that protects against the elements.
Weird looking clothes made from a mass of finely intertwined roots.
Countless petals that somehow stick together naturally. Still emits a strong lifeforce.
Always looks slightly too big for your body. Still a favorite of clever investigators.
They protect both the feet and lower legs. The natural foes of kicks to the shin.
Heavy boots that are still very mobile thanks to internal hydraulics.
Reinforced combat boots for martial artists that prefer pragmatism over honor.
Classy looking shoes of the highest quality and extremely comfy to boot!
Solid boots, made to explore even the deepest part of an unknown world.
Sadly you got no means to access the mass of information stored on this weird object.
Will turn into something tasty in the future! #notabug
Will turn into something tasty in the future! #notabug
Will turn into something tasty in the future! #notabug
Will turn into something tasty in the future! #notabug
A regular key for So'najiz Temple.
A cold flame which naturally forms inside \c[3]\v[combat.name.jungle/pumpkin]\c[0]. It looks nice.
An ancient guide to important Ancient places was engraved into this old stone.
This weapon holds the power of a small micro-cosmos inside itself.
It seems old and used but the power inside it unimaginable.
This gem gets its name from the dark red liquid that swirls inside it.
Created centuries ago by a force as strong as the big bang.
It took 10 years to make this ring and is only bestowed on worthy rulers.
Something is engraved here: "It's \v[misc.time]". Whatever that means.
Once owned by an eastern prince it's now old and lost all color.
According to lore wrapping this around your head will bring you fortune.
Mass-market knockoff of a legendary weapon. It promises victory, but...
A small but well mixed package of different snacks for handfood on the go.
It's a branch from a tree! Truly the treasure of legends.
Large weapon of massive size. It is very huge and packs an immensely gigantic punch.
A great variety of dishes, served cold on a large plate. \c[1]Slow\c[0].
A complete dinner, consisting of several courses. \c[1]Slow\c[0].
Armor crafted from bronze chests. Offers no extra storage room, though.
Armor crafted from silver chests. Strong against werewolves, weak against keys.
Armor crafted from golden chests. Stronger than it has any right to be.
The innate power of this small fish seems to be sealed by a need for food.
Armor crafted from all kind of chests. WIP
A simple, rectangular communicator, supposedly belonging to Billston. Waterproof.
A most convenient bomb emitting a dense smoke. Use to escape bothersome guards.
A chip tracking your movement. Includes a parental control manual.
This pass grant it's owner access to the trader hubs in Basin Keep's Pond Slums.
This peculiar remedy soothes the pain of whoever takes it. \c[1]Slow\c[0].
A lost and found data probe installed by Henry the Researcher.
It looks almost new but scratches show it was used for many years.
A regular key for the Grand Krys'kajo.
A blade made out of thick sheets of metal. Used by blood hungry warmongers.
Heavy Boots which are often used against windy days.
A flat roll filled with meat and vegetables.
A wrap inside a roll which is a wrap too. Confusing but tasty nonetheless.
A hot-steaming batch of risotto with chunky meat pieces.
This risotto has been spiced up with chili and a shrimps.
A healthy risotto served with roasted vegetables.
This is the ultimate dish. Nothing compares.
A pretty beat-up satchel used to store medicine and herbs.
A neatly stitched belt featuring multiple pouches in different colors.
This bag is seemingly infinitely deep. Many Adventures used them on their journeys. (ADD MORE MODS)
Unique Residue left behind by a Ti'im.
The torn pieces of these gloves tell the tale of a great warrior.
A storage unit used by the \c[3]Omni Gilders\c[0] to hold trade materials.
An enhanced visor that allows for quick analysis even at a distance.
Molten ice, held in some sort of container. Dangerous in large volumes! \c[3]Fast\c[0].
Drink evoking the strength of bears, the most unstoppable of forces. \c[3]Fast\c[0].
Drink evoking the sturdiness of crabs that can resist massive damage. \c[3]Fast\c[0].
Drink evoking the cleverness of foxes that always catch their prey. \c[3]Fast\c[0].
Drink evoking the vitality of whales, giant rulers of the oceans. \c[3]Fast\c[0].
Ingredients to brew "Bear Beer". Use at the Brewing Machine in Ba'kii Kum.
Ingredients to brew "Crab Mead". Use at the Brewing Machine in Ba'kii Kum.
Ingredients to brew "Fox Sake". Use at the Brewing Machine in Ba'kii Kum.
Ingredients to brew "Whale Wine". Use at the Brewing Machine in Ba'kii Kum.
A lost and found data probe installed by Henry the Researcher.
A book belong to an old man you traded with. It mentions \c[3]Sapphire Ridge\c[0].
A transparent liquid from the purest of sources. \c[3]Fast\c[0].
A sturdy box of ever-changing size. Very popular with artists in Ancient times.
An unpowered mechanical device. Shaking it will make a rattling sound.
A delicious snack for every Kawaii Gun Jumper.
This grass obtains its blue tint thanks to the rare nutrients found in \v[area.forest.name].
These petal never loose color as long as there are kept away from direct sunlight.
How does it taste? Only one why to find out!
Sharp Spikes used as an alternative to metal on pikes by the Shads.
A spiky orb that used by \v[combat.name.hedgehog] to trap prey.
A rare bamboo breed said to be able to pierce even the hardest defense.
Despite its name this rubble can be used to sharpen weapons.
A metal that emits a light electric spark when touched.
This ore is the name giver of Sapphire Ridge and extremely durable.
A sphere which surface mimics the one of Shadoon.
Futuristic looking goggles that enhance sight. Even help while reading in the dark!
A weapon that is as beautiful as it is dangerous. Swings create a satisfying blur.
Extremely powerful armor. Surprisingly not letters from small, naughty creatures.
These extravagant boots prevent tripping by a shining blue with every step.
Empowers your sight with lasers! Not as deadly as it sounds but still very effective.
Powered by deadly energy, these weapons are truly a force to be reckoned with.
Surrounds the body with energy that constantly circulates with the speed of light.
These shiny boots keep your feet as indestructible as the bridges they walk on!
It looks like a piece of metal overgrown by pulsating vines.
A DNA shaped spiral that cycles slowly through the color spectrum.
A coin with a skull engraving.
Rusty and dented in various spots.
This shell is used as metal coating to enhance a weapons durability.
This shell is used as metal coating to enhance a weapons sharpness.
A piece from a broken blade. Even in this state it can cut through anything.
This mysterious object magically enables the \v[combat.name.forest/panda] to hover above the ground.
This web is so sticky that it can be used as an all-purpose glue.
It's a hardened hat for your head. Not the most refined design but nigh indestructable.
A versatile tool used for cutting, cooking, killing... a true lifesaver and -taker!
Exceptional ranged weapon, originally used under the command of a certain "Mark".
An armored fist that is very reliable. Might be the reason for Pandza's lack of arms.
Dark cloak of uncertain form. Very useful for covert operations.
Extremely heavy body armor with twice the expected plating. Almost impenetrable.
Footwear sewn together from some of the sturdiest plants of nature.
Heavy boots worn by warriors that conquered their fear and embraced the danger.
An unstable weapon that seems to purely follow wild, aggressive instincts.
A red mask with an extraordinarily long nose. Supposedly contains Ancient wisdom.
Incredibly thin and flexible weapon than can penetrate at the speed of sound.
A long and flexible rod. Has a good grip but you can't quite determine it's potential use.
A long, resilient line that shows signs of watery influence.
A long, jagged hook that is covered in rust. Is it treasure or just bait?
An old robe made from empowered plant fiber. It's shimmering in a light blue.
This toggles something, what? I'm not sure, I guess a var.
This is literally just an stone carved to look like a key.
Can be used to reset \c[3]one Circuit-Tree\c[0] in \c[3]Rookie Harbor - Information B1 (Combat Arena)\c[0].
The \c[3]Frequency And Impulse Rattler\c[0] used to find the source of the Gaia's Garden Infection.
Hot parts of a generator that was presumably even hotter. Needed for advanced metalwork.
Raw meat, prepared with honey, fruits and spices. Now it just needs a bit of heat.

You can play CrossCode with any X-Input compatible gamepad.
What to do:
1. Connect your gamepad
2. Press any button (not the analogue sticks)
If you read 'connected' next to the gamepad symbol, your gamepad should work!
Analyze the the enemies on the field.
Party members will focus enemies as they please.
Party members will focus the same enemy as you.
Party members will focus enemies you are not attacking.
Party members will use an aggressive playstyle.
Party members will stay back and focus defensive maneuvers.
Party members will stay far away and do nothing.
Party members will use combat arts at a normal interval.
Party members will use combat arts as much as possible.
Party members will never use any combat arts.
Your party members will take action as they see fit.
Your party members will focus the same enemy as you.
Your party members will stay back and focus on defending/evading attacks.
Your Party members will do absolutely nothing and stay back.
Insufficient Data! Fight against this enemy to reveal more information.
Items are in your cart. Still return?
Shows how much of the quests available at this Bulletin Board have been finished. This does not count hidden quests.
Shows the number of quests currently available in the surrounding areas. Come back from time to time to find new quests.
Shows how much trophies are unlocked as a percentage.
Shows the total number of trophy points acquired.
Indicates that the levels are well aligned.
Indicates that the levels are aligned good enough.
Indicates that the levels are not well aligned.
Indicates that the levels are badly aligned, which could lead to problems when fighting enemies of a similiar level.
Shows you your current and Max HP.
Shows you your current and Max SP.
Shows how much more experience you need for a level up.
A list of all your active buffs.
You favorite consumables. Add one to see its name and description here.
Values below are displayed for the element shown here. See the manual to see how to switch between elements.
Name of the current Page. See the manual to see how to switch between pages.
Shows the suggested level for you to be to do this quest.
Quests with a red exclamation mark are much more difficult but reap better rewards and challenges.
Display the tasks you have already finished and the one you currently have to completed. The 3 dots show that more tasks have been finished and can be checked int the devailt view.
Displays all finished tasks for the quest in a scrollable view.
This shows where you started the quest.
Shows you the name and image of the quest giver.
A list of rewards you can obtain for finishing the quest. Entries with a question mark are revealed once the the quest is completed too.
An overview over the points you have available for each element tree.
Shows the skills on one side of a skill branch. The arrows shows which skills are swapped.
The equipment of the selected friend. They will automatically upgrade when visiting shops.
You current objective. This is tied to your story progress. Check back if you ever get lost.
Shows the current marked quest and the current task for the quest.
Displays your latest activities, such as quest tasks, new encyclopedia entries and more.
Shows you the amount of chests left to find in this area.
Shows you the amount of stamps set by yourself as well the maximum per area.
This displays the type of the lore entry. Note that some entries can have multiple pages and conditions as indicated by the completion percent.
The content of the entry. Unlocked more pages for an entry by exploring the world!
Displays the trader and the location to find him.
Shows what items are needed to acquire this item. Current owned items are shown in brackets.
Find the fee you need to pay for the trade here.
The type of the enemy as indicated by the tab. Golden ones are bosses and have a special tab.
Shows the elemental resistance of the selected enemy. The lower the value the more damage you do with the shown element.
Displays the enemy. Maybe if you wait, you can see them do something special? Below the display you can find the EXP and Credit gained be defeating an enemy.
Shows you the items you can get by defeating this enemy, including the rank needed. To unveil the name of the item you only need to have at least found one of it.
Maximum amount of Health Points for the selected enemy.
Attack power of the selected enemy.
Defensive power of the selected enemy.
Focus of the selected enemy. Determines how often it deals critical hits.
After analyzing an object long enough by collecting its drop you find the location and drop chances for them here.
Sorty the list by item level. Highest first.
Sorts the list by a natural order.
Sorts the list by the area the enemy is found in.
Sorts the list based on the level of the enemies.
Sorts the list by unlocked entries. Unlocked Entries are sorted by \c[3]Auto\c[0].
Sorts the list by the item's names.
Sorts the list based on the amount of each item.
Sorts the list based on the rarity of each item.
Sorts the list based on the level of the quest.
Sorts the list based on the time or date you accepted the quest.
Sorts the list by the hp stat of the equipment.
Sorts the list by the attack stat of the equipment.
Sorts the list by the defense stat of the equipment.
Sorts the list by the focus stat of the equipment.
Sorts the list by the online status and if the player is in your party.
Sorts the list by the level of the contacts.
Invite the player to join your party.
Can't invite because party is full.
Cannot be added or removed right now.
Remove the player from your current party.
Contact or leave a voice message for the player via Direct Link.
Sorts the traders by the order you found them. Newest first.
Sorts the plants by the order you found them. Newest first.
Sorts the list by the plant's names.
Sorts the list by unlocked trophies first.
Sorts the list by the name of the Trophies.
Sorts the list by the amount of points you can get, highest first.

Upgrade your abilities by activating nodes on the circuit boards.
Equip items to enhance your battle stats.
Check your Status, including all Skills, Modifiers and Equipment.
See all the things you found and experienced in CrossWorlds.
Take a look at your current location and use the Teleport-System.
Take a look at all active and completed quests.
Change the options to fit your play style.

Displays the current player- and average equipment level.
 - Green: Levels are aligned.
 -White: Levels are okay
Maximum amount of Health Points. Determines the damage you can survive and the efficiency of regeneration.
Increases the damage of your attacks. The higher the number, the more damage can be inflicted.
Reduces the damage you take from hostile attacks and increases the power of your shield.
Determines the probability of critical hits, your SP gain, status conditions rate and invincibility while dashing.
Resistance against the heat element. The higher the number the less damage you take from heat attacks.
Resistance against the cold element. The higher the number the less damage you take from cold attacks.
Resistance against the shock element. The higher the number the less damage you take from shock attacks.
Resistance against the wave element. The higher the number the less damage you take from wave attacks.
Using Items cannot be stopped by any attacks. However you can still suffer damage.
Increases SP regeneration of any form.
Increases damage done by close combat attacks, including Melee Combat Arts.
Increases the speed of getting precise aiming.
Disables exp gain from quests or defeating enemies.
Increases amount of experience gained from defeating enemies
Increases damage done by ranged attacks, including Throw Combat Arts.
Increases knockback from charged shots on enemies.
Fires additional projectiles when using melee attacks with a fraction of the attacks strength.
Increases the duration of invincibility when dashing.
Increases knockback resistance to weak attacks, depending on your MaxHP.
Regenerates given percentage of HP every 10 seconds during combat.
Increases drop rate for items from enemies and environmental objects.
Strengthens your shield and decreases the damage taken while guarding.
Increases the effect of healing items and duration of buff items.
Slows down Overheat while using an element.
Decreases the loss of aim from quick aim movement and dashes.
Damages enemies that hit your shield, based on the absorbed damage and defense.
Increases your movement speed while aiming.
Increases the amount of credits you get from defeating enemies.
Increases damage on attacking or charging enemies.
Survive exactly one attack that would normally kill you.
Resets your perfect guard when landing a successful perfect guard.
Increases the time window for a perfect guard.
Restores SP on guard based on the power of the attack. Double that for a perfect guard.
Combat Rank also increases the drop rate of items from environment objects.
Increase damage on enemies that are in stunned, weak or in break state.
Increases damage dealt when at critical HP. (Below 33% of Max HP)
Allows to guard against attacks from the side. Activate twice to shield attacks from above too.
Increases numbers of available buff slots. Every step of 100 unlocks another one.
Increases the speed of inflicting the \c[3]Burn\c[0] Condition.
Increases the speed of inflicting the \c[3]Chill\c[0] Condition.
Increases the speed of inflicting the \c[3]Jolt\c[0] Condition.
Increases the speed of inflicting the \c[3]Mark\c[0] Condition.
Increases the resistance against the \c[3]Burn\c[0] Condition.
Increases the resistance against the \c[3]Chill\c[0] Condition.
Increases the resistance against the \c[3]Jolt\c[0] Condition.
Increases the resistance against the \c[3]Mark\c[0] Condition.
Increases the recovery speed from negative status conditions.
