Hover over any place you like to set a Stamp and press \i[help3] to set it. Stamps cannot be set close to other Stamps or Landmarks.
This is where you can take a look at all your collected items or set certain consumables as your favorites.
Use \i[circle-left] and \i[circle-right] to cycle through the categories or press on the tabs if you use the mouse.
The first tab shows the last items you have collected to keep an eye on all your loot!

Most consumables are \c[3]buffs used to aid you in battle\c[0]. Hovering over a consumable that is also a buff shows a little interface telling you what the item does in the \c[3]bottom left corner\c[0].

The symbols you see tell you what stat or modifier changes and how strong the stat is increased. While in the Help Screen, select the \c[3]UI in the bottom-left\c[0] to see what each of the symbols mean.
Hover over an item in the Consumables Section and press \i[help2] to add it as a favorite
In this menu you can equip your collected gear into 5 different slots.
Select a body part by clicking on one of the buttons. You can also use the mouse to click on the buttons in the center.
Additionally you can cycle through the body parts using \i[circle-right] and \i[circle-left] or \i[left] and \i[right].
Press \i[help2] to go directly to the status menu.

Hovering over a piece of equipment shows the changes to your \c[3]status\c[0] on the left. Having already equipped an item will show how your parameters change when switching to another piece of gear.
\c[3]Modifiers\c[0] are shown below the status parameters. Press \i[help4] to expand the list if more modifiers are equipped or shown then fit into the list.
Use the \c[3]Status Menu's "Modifier"-List\c[0] to get a detailed description for each equipped modifier.
In this menu you can spend your collected \c[3]Cross Points (CP)\c[0] to unlock skills on the skill trees.
select one of the unlocked trees and press on it to enter the detailed view of the associated tree.
Scroll right to get more info on the detailed view that appears once you press on one of the trees.
Use \i[key-up]\i[key-left]\i[key-down]\i[key-right] or drag the mouse to move around the skill tree.
With the gamepad you can use \i[left-stick] to move the cursor around and \i[right-stick] to just move the camera.
Hover over a skill to see what it does and how many CP you need to activate it.
Note that in order to activate a skill you must first unlock its parent.
Notice the branches on some paths along the skill tree? Those always offer 2 ways and you can only walk on one of them.
However you can \c[3]switch between both paths at any time without spending any additional points\c[0] as long as you have a skill activated on one of the branch paths.
By pressing \i[help2] you can enter a special swap mode in the overview where you can quickly swap branches. Just select a panel and press it to swap the skills!
The aforementioned branches always contain at least one \c[3]Combat Art\c[0] on each way, which you can recognize by their \c[3]light-grey background\c[0].
Those Combat Arts are skills that don't increase your parameters but instead allow you to perform special abilities during combat, in exchange for \c[3]Special Points (SP)\c[0].
Combat Arts can greatly increase your chances in battle, so it is advised that you learn at least one of them as quickly as possible!
Here you can check out your current position, see how many treasures you have found or the the teleport system
Use \i[key-up]\i[key-left]\i[key-down]\i[key-right] to move the camera or drag with the mouse. You can also use \i[left-stick] to move or \i[right-stick] to pan the camera with the gamepad.
Pressing \i[help3] places a custom \c[3]Stamp\c[0]. You can update the stamp by clicking on it or creating one. Stamps cannot be placed close next to each other.
Once a \c[3]Landmark\c[0] is activated it can be selected by hovering over the symbol \i[landmark] with the mouse or the gamepad cursor.
Clicking or pressing \i[gamepad-a] on the gamepad opens a confirmation dialog.
Selecting yes closes the menu and teleports Lea to the location of the landmark
If a landmark is greyed out it means it was blocked. (eg. because of Story progression) To access them, simply find them gain.
Pressing \i[help2] opens or closes the worldmap of CrossWorlds. In this menu you can select an area you have already visited.
Hovering over an area reveals a the name, a short description and the chests found in the area.
Clicking or pressing \i[gamepad-a] on the gamepad displays the maps of the area. Here you can use the teleport system to warp you to landmarks you activated in the selected area.
In this menu you can change various settings to customize your game experience. Use \i[circle-right] and \i[circle-left] to navigate through the tabs.
Some options might require a restart. Options like these are \c[3]marked with a red information text.\c[0]
Options are saved as soon as you leave the main menu.
Use \i[help2] to reset all settings back to default. This will also reset all your key bindings.
This menu features a wide array of information about all your quests, stats and achievements!
On the left side you can a see a quick summary including your \c[3]current task\c[0], your \c[3]marked quest\c[0] and your \c[3]latest activities.\c[0]
To see more activities go the \c[3]Activity Log\c[0] Tab in the Records Menu.
In this menu you can watch all your active and finished quests.
Cycle through the tabs using \i[circle-left] and \i[circle-right].
Selecting a quest shows you a quick summary including the latest fulfilled tasks and description.
Pressing on a quest opens the \c[3]Detail View\c[0]. This menu gives you a more precise look at a quest.
To quickly cycle through the quests in detail view use \i[circle-left] and \i[circle-right].
Pressing \i[help2] while hovering over a quest in the active section marks it as favorite quest. Pressing \i[help2] on a marked quest un-favorites it.
Favorite quests are highlighted outside the menu in the top-right corner of the screen.
You can change between them outside the menu by using \i[circle-left] and \i[circle-right] on the keyboard or by pressing \i[left-stick] and \i[right-stick] on the gamepad.
You will only cycle through the ones you marked as favorite.
A quest can have up to 4 sub quests.
In case such a quests is activated, all sub quests are indented below the parent quest when the \c[3]Data\c[0] or \c[3]Auto\c[0] Sorting is active. This way you always know where a sub quest belongs.

Hover over a quest in the Active Quest Section and press \i[help2] to set it as a favorite! 

Do the same on a faved quest to un-favorite it.
In this menu you can buy items or sell them if you don't need them.
Use \i[circle-left] and \i[circle-right] to cycle through the categories or press on the tabs if you use the mouse.
Press on an item to select the quantity you want to buy. You can use the \i[up]\i[left]\i[down]\i[right] to change the amount.
Press \i[help2] to open the checkout view when you have at least one item in your cart. Once you sure you want to buy or sell the selected items, press Buy/Sell to confirm.
When an item is selected you can use \i[left] and \i[right] to de- or increase the number by one directly.
Some vendors might only have one category from which you can buy items. This is indicated by the grey buttons next to the category name.
In this menu you can save your progress and see all the save files you have created.
Scroll through the save slots using \i[mousewheel] with the mouse or the direction buttons on the gamepad.
Click on a slot or press \i[gamepad-a] on the gamepad to save the game on the selected slot.
Press \i[help3] to create \c[3]a new save file\c[0] or \i[help2] to \c[3]delte a save file\c[0] by hovering over a slot.
You can also use the first entry in the list to create a new save file.
A single save file displays some basic information about you progress:
--\c[3]Chapter\c[0]:-- Reflects your story progress via the chapter you are in and a small graphic.
--\c[3]Level\c[0]:-- The level you have on this save file.
--\c[3]Location\c[0]:-- The area and map you saved in.
--\c[3]Version\c[0]:-- Displayed next to Leas head. Reflects the version of the save file in contrast to the current game version.
--\c[3]Playtime\c[0]:-- The play time of this save file.
In this menu you can load a save file and start where you left.
Scroll through the save slots using \i[mousewheel] with the mouse or the direction buttons on the gamepad.
Click on a slot or press \i[gamepad-a] on the gamepad to load the save file on the selected slot.
Press \i[help2] to \c[3] delete a save file\c[0] by hovering over a slot.
A single save file displays some basic information about you progress:
--\c[3]Chapter\c[0]:-- Reflects your story progress via the chapter you are in and a small graphic.
--\c[3]Level\c[0]:-- The level you have on this save file.
--\c[3]Location\c[0]:-- The area and map you saved in.
--\c[3]Version\c[0]:-- Displayed next to Leas head. Reflects the version of the save file in contrast to the current game version.
--\c[3]Playtime\c[0]:-- The play time of this save file.
In this menu you can read about all the interesting topics you come across while exploring CrossWorlds.
Cycle through the tabs using \i[circle-left] and \i[circle-right].
Select an entry to to highlight and scroll through its content.
You can also use \i[left] or \i[right] while hovering an entry to scroll through it directly. On gamepad using \i[right-stick] does the same.
There are multiple ways to unlock lore entries. You can either just talk to people or find more information about a topic by progressing the \c[3]Track of the Ancients\c[0].
I added some extra code here for you, Lea. Next to the in-game categories I added one for your progress, one for characters and one for your memories.
I will insert those entries for you when they come along!
In this menu you can find detailed information about every enemy you encounter.
Cycle through the tabs using \i[circle-left] and \i[circle-right].
Select an entry to reveal the first page of the enemy and use \i[page-left] or \i[page-right] to switch pages.
If you find the tag "special" above the enemy view than that means you unlocked an enemy through a \c[3]special event or a quest\c[0].
Reports are unlocked by first defeating an enemy a certain amount of times.
They show useful information or trivia about the selected enemy.
This first page, including the species of the enemy, will always be unlocked.
Additional reports are unlocked through various tasks, such as defeating even more of enemy, solving quest, progressing the story and so on.
This menu offers a log of every trader you met in each area.
Cycle through the tabs using \i[circle-left] and \i[circle-right].
Select an entry to reveal a detailed overview over what items you need and how much it will cost you.
While the detail view is open you can still switch through tabs and select different items.
This menu gives you a detailed look at all your stats and parameters for all available elements.
Use \i[page-left] and \i[page-right] to switch through your elements.
To switch between the different views, use \i[circle-left] and \i[circle-right].
As the name suggests the summary services as an overview over your equipment and stats.
The parameters shown on the left are your final parameters for the currently selected element, including equipment and skills.
This views displays your base parameters for the currently selected element.

For each parameter you can see how the final value comes together based of the \c[3]Base Value\c[0], the \c[3]Equipment\c[0] and finally the \c[3]Skill Additions\c[0] from the Circuits. The description shows the purpose of each parameter.
To see the absolute values of each step for the final value of a parameter press \i[help3].
This views displays all modifiers from your equipment and the currently selected element.

For each modifier you can see how the final value comes together based of your \c[3]Equipment\c[0] and the \c[3]Skill Additions\c[0] from the Circuits. The description shows the function of each modifier.
To see the absolute values of each step for the final value of a modifier press \i[help3].
In this menu you can invite/remove other players into your party or contact them.
Hover over a contact to get a closer look at the stats and equipment of the player.
Click on a slot or press \i[gamepad-a] on the gamepad to invite/remove the player.
This way you can also contact the player. Note that some players might not answer if they are not online.

This menu is a compilation of all your progress in numbers. Use \i[circle-right] and \i[circle-left] to navigate through the categories. To scroll through a category use the mouse wheel or \i[down] and \i[up].

For as long as CrossCode is in \c[3]Early Access\c[0] the stats in this menu might change. You might also see incorrect numbers when new stats are added or removed and you load a save file with a version lower than the current one.
This menus lists all destructible environmental objects found in CrossWorlds. Use \i[circle-right] and \i[circle-left] to navigate through the areas.
Each object first needs to be analyzed, which is done by simply destroying them and collecting the drops.
Once \c[3]50% are analyzed\c[0] you can see the location of the object and once \c[3]100% is reach, all items the object can drop are revealed\c[0].
Here you can trade your items against other items as long as you fulfil the requirements and have enough credits.
A trader can have multiple offers. Use \i[circle-right] and \i[circle-left] to navigate through them.
The values in \c[3]brackets show how many of the required items you have\c[0]. If the offer is a piece of equipment you can check the parameters on the left side.
This menus lists all quests \c[3]available in the surrounding areas\c[0].
The 3 tabs show open, active and finished quests in that order. Use \i[circle-right] and \i[circle-left] to navigate through the tabs.
At the bottom you can see how many quests are currently available and your completion rate on this Bulletin Board.
This menus showcases all your accomplishments. You can also see what you need to do for to unlock a trophy, at least for most of them.
Trophies are separated by 3 categories: \c[3]General\c[0], \c[3]Combat\c[0] and \c[3]Exploration\c[0]. Use \i[circle-right] and \i[circle-left] to navigate through the tabs.
Each tab can have multiple sections. Click on one or use \i[left] or \i[right] to show the trophies within them.

Increases MaxHP by [xyz]%.
The more HP the longer you can survive.

Increases Attack by [xyz]%.
Determines the damage you can deal.

Increases Defense by [xyz]%.
Determines the damage you take.

Increases Focus by [xyz]%.
Determines critical hits, SP gain and dash invincibility
Increases resistance to all Elements by [xyz]%.
Increases the damage of Ranged Attacks by [xyz]%.
Increases the knockback distance of charged projectiles by [xyz]%.
Increases the damage of Melee Attacks by [xyz]%.
Melee attacks fire additional small projectiles for [xyz]% of the base damage.
Increases the damage of Critical Strikes by [xyz]%.
Decreases time needed to aim by [xyz]%.
Decreases the loss of aim from quick aim movement and dashes by [xyz]%.
Increases your movement speed while aiming by [xyz]%.
Prolongs the invincibility when dashing by [xyz]%.
Strengthens your shield and decreases the damage taken when guarding by [xyz]%.
Allows to guard against attacks from the side. Activate twice to guard attacks from above too.
Allows to guard against attacks from above.
Increases the immunity to knockback from attacks by [xyz]%, depending on MaxHP.
Increases the speed of inflicting the \c[3]Burn\c[0] Condition and its effect by [xyz]%.
Increases the speed of inflicting the \c[3]Chill\c[0] Condition and its effect by [xyz]%.
Increases the speed of inflicting the \c[3]Jolt\c[0] Condition and its effect by [xyz]%.
Increases the speed of inflicting the \c[3]Mark\c[0] Condition and its effect by [xyz]%.
Increases the resistance against the \c[3]Burn\c[0] Condition and reduces its effect by [xyz]%.
Increases the resistance against the \c[3]Chill\c[0] Condition and reduces its effect by [xyz]%.
Increases the resistance against the \c[3]Jolt\c[0] Condition and reduces its effect by [xyz]%.
Increases the resistance against the \c[3]Mark\c[0] Condition and reduces its effect by [xyz]%.
Increases the recovery speed from all negative status conditions by [xyz]%.
Regenerates [xyz]% of HP every 10 seconds during combat.
Slows down the Elemental Overheat by [xyz]%.
Increases the effect of healing and the duration of buffs from items by [xyz]%.
When guarding, reflects [xyz]% of the total absorbed damage back on the attacker.
Increases damage on enemies that are attacking or charging by [xyz]%.
Increases Damage by [xyz]% when at critical HP. (Below 33% of MaxHP)
Increases Damage on enemies that are stunned, weak or in break state by [xyz]%.
Survive exactly one attack that would normally kill you.
Restores SP on guard based on [xyz]% of the attack's power. (Double for perfect guard)
Placeholder for a Special Attack that can be learned in future versions.
Changes the size of the item notification window.
Changes how completed tasks in quests are displayed.
Changes how new landmarks are displayed when found.
Changes how new Encyclopedia entries are displayed when found.
Changes how new Botanics completion is displayed when achieved.
Changes how new trophies are displayed when achieved.
Change under which party members status bars are shown.
Change how Combat Arts execution is shown for party members.
The access style to toggle the quick menu.
True if skipping cutscenes should be confirmed.
Enables the display in the equip menu which shows the player- and average equip level.
True if all optional tutorials should be skipped. \c[1]Not recommended for first playthrough!\c[0]
True to make right sidebar smaller. Only works with a \c[3]Pixel Size\c[0] of 2 or higher.
True to show an effect if an NPC can be talked while text is above it.
The difficulty of the game. TODO add better text
Changes the strength of screen rumble effects.
Changes the padding around texts in dialog bubbles/boxes.
The speed at which text appears in dialogs and side messages.
The size of the info box when hovering over a skill node in the circuit menu.
The time the info box stays after leaving focus on a node in the circuit menu.
Displays only the name and progress of the quest in the favorite quest window.
Allows to chain activate nodes in the circuit menu when selecting a node.
Toggles the status display in the top left corner.
Toggles the circle indicating the close combat range for mouse input.
Toggles the current element display when switching elements on Lea.
Toggles the corner graphics indicating element overload.
The language of the game. \c[1]Parts of the game only in English right now! Needs a restart!
Toggles the corner graphics for low health.
Toggles if the name of a combat art should be displayed above Lea when executed.
Toggles if the SP bar should be shown when using Arts or recovering SP.
Toggles the damage numbers. This applies to healing numbers too.
If selected only shows critical hit numbers. (Healing numbers are still displayed)
Toggles the item notification window when obtaining an item.
Toggles the money notification window when obtaining money.
If on, saves the cursor position in the quick item menu.
If on, allow to use \i[up]\i[left]\i[down]\i[right] to change element in quick menu.
\c[3]Quick\c[0]: Show when in Quick menu. \c[3]Map\c[0]: Show when entering map. \c[3]Disable\c[0]: Never show.
Changes the Scaling used for the box the game runs in.
Button for attack and throwing. The other button will be used for special attacks.
Button for dashing and guarding. The other button will be used for the quick menu.
Increases the pixel size resulting in less blurry graphics.  \c[1]Needs a restart!
Higher size means sharper image. May reduce FPS. \c[1]Needs a restart!
Toggles the weather effects like rain and snow.
Sets the details on overall effects.
Sets the overall volume of the game.
Sets the volume of the music in the game.
Sets the volume of the sounds in the game.
Enables WebAudio for better sound quality and positioned sounds. \c[1]Needs a restart!
Enables being able to click close to Lea to execute a melee attack.
If on you can use the mouse wheel to change the element mode.
Set the normal or alternative key used for the selected option.
Some options take effect after a restart of the game.
Can thee not seeth yond i am singing?
Trophies have changed and we tried to make sure you got all the trophies you should have until this point.
The Skill tree structure has changed, so we had to reset your skill configuration. Sorry! You can reassign your skills again.
This save file is outdated, bugs might occur. Use at own risk!
Some quests have changed. Those have been resetted. This means you might have to re-do some tasks or you get your rewards after you close this message.
Aannd again! Water in a cave. Below a lake. We're literally below a gigantic lake.
There is just no way you could make this work! Just imagine the water pressure!
Who cares? It's just a game!
We're on an actual moon here. Physics still apply!

desc: LocationEvent START IF party.alive.Glasses && party.alive.Emilie && plot.comment.waterCave

text.en_US: More water. Is this water even real? Maybe it's all virtual!

desc: LocationEvent START IF party.alive.Glasses && party.alive.Emilie && plot.comment.waterCave
LocationEvent START IF party.alive.Glasses && party.alive.Emilie && plot.comment.waterCave
LocationEvent START IF party.alive.Glasses && party.alive.Emilie && plot.comment.waterCave

text.en_US: Well, the augmented reality tech they're using is pretty advanced, so it's hard to tell.

desc: LocationEvent START IF party.alive.Glasses && party.alive.Emilie && plot.comment.waterCave

text.en_US: And it would allow them to break physics as they please.

desc: LocationEvent START IF party.alive.Glasses && party.alive.Emilie && plot.comment.waterCave

text.en_US: Monsieur Scientist, I propose we do an experiment!

desc: LocationEvent START IF party.alive.Glasses && party.alive.Emilie && plot.comment.waterCave

text.en_US: We kick you into the water repeatedly. Just to make sure it's real!

desc: LocationEvent START IF party.alive.Glasses && party.alive.Emilie && plot.comment.waterCave

text.en_US: That...\. That wouldn't even confirm anything!

desc: LocationEvent START IF party.alive.Glasses && party.alive.Emilie && plot.comment.waterCave

text.en_US: Maybe, but wouldn't it be fun?

Traveler, envoy of change,
you have mastered the trial of these fields.

I will bestow upon you the shade
to open the passage to the north.

Let your every step
form the path of your growth.

Your journey has made you cross
these signs of prosperity long passed.

Seeking your next destination
in the wilderness to the north...

... you must first accomplish
the \c[3]trial of these fields\c[0].

Pursue the path 
of the \c[3]luminous creature\c[0]...

...and prove your mastery
of the elements acquired.

Traveler, envoy of change,
will you accept this trial?

Let your every step
form the path of your growth.

Come back and accept this trial
when you feel prepared.
Man I sure wish I could jump around like that.
Wouldn't that make exploration too easy?
I guess...\. but how much fun would it be...?
Well, at least we can do our regular small jumps, right?
Oui, regular jumping whenever we want. It's at least something.
I see you got the \c[3]\v[item.410.name]\c[0] with you! Nice, nice!
Well then, good luck in \c[3]Sapphire Ridge\c[0]! Beware of bugs!
If you want to pass the barrier up ahead you first have to collect the \c[3]\v[item.410.name]\c[0].
You get it at the end of the \c[3]Grand Krys'kajo\c[0] dungeon in \c[3]Gaia's Garden\c[0].
If you've already finished the dungeon... just revisit the \c[3]final boss room\c[0]. I'm sure you'll find the shades somewhere in there.
Thought Ah'd rest a spell here after all that awful cold an' heat.
Feels a mite familiar, t'be honest.
Well, how's the explorin' comin' along? Doin' good so far?
Good ta hear! Y'all keep it up now.
Solve the quest "\c[3]Chase of the Hologram Frobbit\c[0]".
Here comes the Bunny...\. that annoying bastard.
No Spoiler. Just look at it jumping away! We all know it's gonna be annoying.
You should tell Emilie via D-Link!
I suppose you just got the Shade!
I think Emilie wanted you to contact her at this point, right?
Bonjour Lea! How is it going? Did you collect the shade?
That means we're all set for the raid!
But before that... there's one thing I wanted to tell you.
About this Shade...\. It gives you access to \c[3]Gaia's Garden\c[0] to the north.
And well...\. Lukas told me that area is essentially a \c[3]jungle\c[0].
You know what you usually find in jungles?
I really don't want to go there by myself.\. So uhm...
It would be great if you could wait for me so we can enter the Jungle together, d'accord?
But let's wait on that until after the Raid is over, alright?
Oh and now that we're all ready, we should meet up at the \c[3]First Scholars HQ\c[0]!
Lin wanted to give us a small briefing about the Raid and explain all the details.
Meet with the guild members at the \c[3]First Scholar HQ\c[0] to discuss the raid in detail.
The others already went ahead to the raid area.
All we have to do is wander through this cave here.
We still have some time left, though.
We should make sure we're well prepared.
I wouldn't mind checking equipment options in Rookie Harbor one last time.
Don't be such a worrywart, Tronny.
I'm ready to kick some derrière right now!
Meet up at \c[3]Para Island\c[0] in \c[3]Autumn's Fall\c[0] to start the \c[3]Raid\c[0]!
Lea, that's the way to \c[3]Gaia's Garden\c[0]. We wanted to go there together, non?
But let's wait with that until after the \c[3]raid\c[0], d'accord?
Lea, that's the route to \c[3]Gaia's Garden\c[0].
I think you wanted to enter that area together with \c[3]Emilie\c[0] after you're done with the \c[3]raid\c[0], correct?
A \v[lore.title.seeker]?\. You were sent to help me with the operation, I suppose?
I see.\. Good, good.\. Almost got worried I needed a tent if assistance took any longer.
Hey, I really need some sleep!\. Spent all day surveying the area and calibrating our probe here.
Yep, this work of wonder was fed the data of the device taken from the Hillkat Leader.
We can use it to extract energy and data from \c[3]Ancient Powerspots\c[0] directly on the Track.
And this area has quite a lot of those, which is ideal for a proper test run and data gathering.
Well, I should just explain how to operate it, so we can finally get this over with and me back to bed.
Simply put, you need to \c[3]push this device around\c[0] and move the \c[3]Powerspots\c[0] that appear in the area.
You can \c[3]move\c[0] it by \c[3]attacking\c[0].\. Using \c[3]Heat\c[0] will greatly increase the distance and velocity.
Approaching a Powerspot will usually \c[3]attract some hostile wildlife\c[0] that will protect those places.
Worse, the Powerspots will grant them a \c[3]shield\c[0] that is almost impenetrable!\. Invincible, angry critters!
Yes, exactly!\. But luckily for you, you've got our probe here!
\c[3]When placed on an active Powerspot\c[0] it will sap away the energy and \c[3]deactivate the shield\c[0]!
Just make sure it doesn't get knocked away.\. Hitting it with \c[3]Cold\c[0] will \c[3]stabilize\c[0] it for a bit which should help.
And that's it.\. Surely an experienced \v[lore.title.seeker] can figure it out, right?
Good.\. Talk to me again when you're ready and prepared.
Heyo, \v[lore.title.seeker].\. You ready to do this?
Alright, then let me start this thing up!
Everything's running.\. The first spot of power should appear in a second.
Ah, there it is.\. Knock our device to that position and then defeat all the enemies in the area to proceed!
Just repeat that procedure with every new Powerspot that pops up and then we can go on.

Knock the \c[3]Probe\c[0] on the \c[3]Powerpoints\c[0].
\c[3]Heat\c[0]: More knockback
\c[3]Cold\c[0]: Stabilize
Alright, come back when you feel fresh and ready.
Okay, let me explain it again.
You need to \c[3]push this device around\c[0] and move it onto certain spots of power in this area, short \c[3]Powerspots\c[0].
You can \c[3]move\c[0] it by \c[3]attacking\c[0].\. Using \c[3]Heat\c[0] will greatly increase the distance and velocity.
Approaching a Powerspot will usually attract some \c[3]hostile wildlife\c[0] that will protect those places.
The Powerspots will grant them a \c[3]shield\c[0] that is almost impenetrable, meaning invincible enemies.
\c[3]Placing the probe on an active Powerspot\c[0] will \c[3]deactivate the shield\c[0], though, so that's a priority!
Make sure it doesn't get knocked away again.\. Hitting it with \c[3]Cold\c[0] will \c[3]stabilize\c[0] it for a bit which should help.
I hope you got it now, \v[lore.title.seeker].

desc: EventTrigger questBall-camera START IF tmp.questBall-start && tmp.questBall-onMarkChange
EventTrigger questBall-camera START IF tmp.questBall-start && tmp.questBall-onMarkChange
EventTrigger questBall-camera START IF tmp.questBall-start && tmp.questBall-onMarkChange
EventTrigger questBall-camera START IF tmp.questBall-start && tmp.questBall-onMarkChange
EventTrigger questBall-camera START IF tmp.questBall-start && tmp.questBall-onMarkChange

text.en_US: Well, my scanners show that you've harvested all the Powerspots.\. Thorough work, I suppose.
Shame we're not quite done yet.\. Just a minute ago I spotted a high concentration of energy just South of us.
Yeah, seems like the Track doesn't want me to get my overdue sleep.\. In any case we need to handle that as well.
The data we can extract there could be too valuable to ignore.
Follow me south so we can get this over with.
Our little journey is almost over.
Now for your last trial I want you to show me...

Traveler.
You have proven your proficiency.

You passed the trial.
Seek your reward from where it began.
Still annoyed they didn't make it explode.
They made us chase that thing for so long! The least they could give us is a proper bunny explosion!
Alright, you better get ready, Lea.
Oh, come on! It's so clear that this is the final stage!
I see you found your way to the location of the raid, eh?
Oui, you should call Tronny to join our party again.
Hurry! I wanna start the raid already!
Oh that's right, you should call Emilie to join our party again, Lea!
We can start the raid once we're all assembled!
Oh, but \c[3]Emilie\c[0] and \c[3]Tronny\c[0] aren't with you.
I think they wanted to meet you at the \c[3]statue in Autumn's Fall\c[0].
That's the same statue where you stared to chase after \c[3]hologram frobbit\c[0], remember?
Please be so kind and pick up those two. They're waiting for you.
If you decided to split before, make sure to \c[3]call them back to your party\c[0]!
It looks like everyone is assembled for the raid!
I hope you all are \c[3]well prepared\c[0]! There are a lot of battles ahead of us!
So how about it? \c[3]Are you ready for the raid\c[0]?
I see. No worries, there is still some time.
If you want some advice for equipment you can talk to \c[3]Lukas\c[0]! He knows his stuff.
Hey there! The raid is about to start. Of course we all should be well prepared.
Do you want me to have a look at your stats and equipment?
Good equipment and stats for your level. You'll be fine!
Hm... I'd say you \c[3]could do better\c[0].
Things might still work with those stats, but it won't be a breeze.
I suggest you look for \c[3]better equipment\c[0]. It's the most important factor for your stats.
Oh junge. You really gotta \c[3]work on your stats\c[0]!
Those may have been sufficient back in Faj'ro Temple, but you'll have a \c[3]hard time\c[0] like that in the raid.
No really, you really should \c[3]improve your equipment\c[0]. It's by far the most important factor for your stats.
Also make sure to \c[3]check your circuit tree\c[0] if there are any more skills you can learn.
Oh yes, and when you look for equipment just pay attention to the \c[3]level number\c[0] you see at the icon.
Just make sure it's roughly around your level. The higher, the better!
And if you don't want to bother with traders just check the \c[3]equipment of the stores\c[0]. Those will do the job as well.
Fine. I'll trust your judgement, then.
There you are! Ready for the raid?
I heard there's a ton of bugs waiting for us to fight up there!
An important milestone of the track!
They say that in old times the Ancients used these grounds for a \c[3]test of teamwork\c[0].
And now it's up to us Seekers to prove to the Ancients that we're no strangers to teamwork as well!
They say a great reward waits for those that reach the \c[3]top of the hill\c[0] on this island.
However, the top shall only be reached when two teams move in unison.

The first team, ascending on the left, will be the Newcomers of the First Scholars: 
\c[3]Lea\c[0], \c[3]Emilie\c[0] and \c[3]C'tron\c[0]!

The second team, ascending on the right, will be us old timers:
\c[3]Schneider\c[0], \c[3]Buggy\c[0]... and \c[3]I\c[0]!
"Old timer", huh? I definitely don't get that a lot.
Well you got the matching hairstyle.
Now, reaching the top of this hill is quite the challenging endeavor, indeed!
There will be many foes and obstacles that will put our teamwork to the test!
Our attacks will have to be coordinated. That is why \c[3]communication is key\c[0]!
Don't worry, Lea! I didn't forget about you.
In fact, I think I have the perfect role for you!
See, one member of each team will be the \c[3]column tackler\c[0]! And I think you'd be a good choice for this.
It will be your task to attack specific enemies during the raid.
Tronny and Emilie will support you and keep the communication with us going.
D'accord! As long as there is stuff left for me to punch.
Alrighty! I'll give you more instructions during the raid! Just keep your heads up, eh?
So who'll be the column tackler in our team?
Can I be it, please?\. Please, please, please.
Alright, Raphael. But please be mindful and don't forget about the teamwork.
Let's go! Let's go! Let's go!
Alrighty! Everyone, get in front of your track! \c[3]Column Tacklers\c[0] please step on those marks on the ground!
Complete the \c[3]raid\c[0] together with the other First Scholar members!
That's just warmup! Stay on your guard!
More Hillkats. Great. Gimme some new stuff to punch!
Come on. Give it some time, Emilie.
We now have to fight the \c[3]Pillars\c[0]! Now it's time for the \c[3]Column Tacklers\c[0] to act!
Basically we all have to fight the small blocks with the \c[3]same color\c[0]!
Let's start with the \c[3]red blocks\c[0]! Lea, Buggy, only attack those!
Once the blocks are activated, everyone can help to bring them down!
Alrighty! Now let's take on the remaining \c[3]blue blocks\c[0]!
Achtung! The pillar will now attack with the large caliber!
On to the next stage, everyone!
Next pillar! Lets fight the \c[3]Blue Block\c[0] first this time!
Alrighty! Time to hit those \c[3]red blocks\c[0] now!
Look at this, a new color! Let's beat the \c[3]Purple Blocks\c[0] first!
I wanna get rid of those annoying Seahorses first!
I think those are \c[3]Shock\c[0] attacks! Better be careful!
Those are \c[3]Shock\c[0] attacks! Probably the first time you see those!

desc: EventTrigger waveA4 START IF tmp.waveB1 && tmp.raid.colors >= 1
EventTrigger waveA4 START IF tmp.waveB1 && tmp.raid.colors >= 1

text.en_US: Next round! Let's focus on the \c[3]Blue Blocks\c[0] first...
Wait! I already hit a \c[3]Green block\c[0]!
Raphael, don't be so rash! Alrighty, lets focus on \c[3]Greenish blocks\c[0].

desc: EventTrigger waveC3 START IF tmp.waveC1 && tmp.raid.colors >= 1

text.en_US: We almost got it! Last round of blocks!

desc: EventTrigger waveC3 START IF tmp.waveC1 && tmp.raid.colors >= 1

text.en_US: Good work, everyone! We're doing quite well!
There's one more pillar battle in that cave there and then it's time to face the \c[3]boss\c[0]!
This will be the last pillar enemy! We'll let \c[3]you decide\c[0] which element to attack this time!
Decide quickly! I want to start hitting stuff!
Hey! Which element should be destroy?
Oh dear... It' seems like Lea is all alone right now. Let's wait for Emilie or Tronny to respawn.
You waited for that one, didn't you?
\c[0]Blue blocks\c[0]! It's time to \c[3]break the ice\c[0]! Cool, delicious ice.
Monsieur, you gotta keep that craving for ice cream under control.
We're fighting the \c[0]Blue blocks\c[0]! It's a shame that Tronny is out. I'm sure those are his favorites.
Uhm we attack those \c[3]purple blocks\c[0] now. The shock blocks!
We're fighting those \c[3]Purple blocks\c[0] now! Let's be quick as lightning!
\c[3]Greenish blocks\c[0] now. Nope. No pun, I got nothing. What's this element anyway?
We're fighting the \c[3]Greenish blocks\c[0] now. Whatever those are...
That's \c[3]Wave\c[0]. And honestly, nobody quite knows what it is.
It's the element of peace and good vibrations! Let's smash it, everyone!
Out cold! All blue blocks, that is.
The element of peace is no more.
Nevermind, I must be imagining things.
Here we are! Time for the final stage! Everyone ready?
Wait...\. something is not right here!

desc: EventTrigger colorDefeated START IF tmp.raid.colors > tmp.colorsConfirmed
EventTrigger colorDefeated START IF tmp.raid.colors > tmp.colorsConfirmed
EventTrigger colorDefeated START IF tmp.raid.colors > tmp.colorsConfirmed
EventTrigger colorDefeated START IF tmp.raid.colors > tmp.colorsConfirmed

text.en_US: Is... Is this some kind of bug?
Damn it! Why now of all times!
Apparently some hacker hid items in this area.
So everyone is looking for them right now.
I see you got the \c[3]\v[item.230.name]\c[0] with you! Nice, nice!
Well then, good luck on your journey!
If you want to pass this barrier you first have to collect the \c[3]\v[item.230.name]\c[0].
You get it at the end of the \c[3]Faj'ro Temple\c[0], right after the boss battle.
In case you already beat the boss, just go to the final room and fetch your reward. It should still be there!

desc: EventTrigger questBall-camera START IF tmp.questBall-start && tmp.questBall-onMarkChange
EventTrigger questBall-camera START IF tmp.questBall-start && tmp.questBall-onMarkChange
EventTrigger questBall-camera START IF tmp.questBall-start && tmp.questBall-onMarkChange
EventTrigger questBall-camera START IF tmp.questBall-start && tmp.questBall-onMarkChange
EventTrigger questBall-camera START IF tmp.questBall-start && tmp.questBall-onMarkChange

text.en_US: Great, there you are again.\. About time we finished this task, I would say.
This time, all the energy signals can be found around that lonely tree there.
Weird coincidence that, considering there's nothing really special about the tree itself...
Though, it seems to be rather unstable and fluctuating this time.\. You should keep an eye on that.
In any case, knocking our probe onto the Powerspots as before and clearing hostiles should do the trick.
I am ready whenever you are.\. Just give me the signal, \v[lore.title.seeker].
Alright, then let me start this thing up!
Probe has booted.\. Prepare for the first point to appear.
Alright, just like before.\. Knock our device on the point and then defeat all the enemies that might appear!
Just remember what I told you about the unstable energy fluctuation.
Be prepared to readjust the probe during the operation in case the Powerspots move around.

Knock the \c[3]Probe\c[0] on the \c[3]Powerpoints\c[0].
\c[3]Heat\c[0]: More knockback
\c[3]Cold\c[0]: Stabilize
Alright, come back when you feel fresh and ready.
You need me to refresh your memory again?\. Alright then...
You need to \c[3]push this device around\c[0] and move it onto certain spots of power in this area, short \c[3]Powerspots\c[0].
You can \c[3]move\c[0] it by \c[3]attacking\c[0].\. Using \c[3]Heat\c[0] will greatly increase the distance and velocity.
Approaching a Powerspot will usually attract some \c[3]hostile wildlife\c[0] that will protect those places.
The Powerspots will grant them a \c[3]shield\c[0] that is almost impenetrable, meaning invincible enemies.
\c[3]Placing the probe on an active Powerspot\c[0] will \c[3]deactivate the shield\c[0], though, so that's a priority!
Make sure it doesn't get knocked away again.\. Hitting it with \c[3]Cold\c[0] will \c[3]stabilize\c[0] it for a bit which should help.
I hope you got it now, \v[lore.title.seeker].

desc: EventTrigger questBall-rotateMarker START IF tmp.questBall-start && tmp.questBall-wave1
EventTrigger questBall-rotateMarker START IF tmp.questBall-start && tmp.questBall-wave1
EventTrigger questBall-rotateMarker START IF tmp.questBall-start && tmp.questBall-wave1
EventTrigger questBall-rotateMarker START IF tmp.questBall-start && tmp.questBall-wave1
EventTrigger questBall-rotateMarker START IF tmp.questBall-start && tmp.questBall-wave1
EventTrigger questBall-rotateMarker START IF tmp.questBall-start && tmp.questBall-wave1
EventTrigger questBall-fightEnd START IF tmp.questBall-start && tmp.questBall-fightCount >= 13
EventTrigger questBall-fightEnd START IF tmp.questBall-start && tmp.questBall-fightCount >= 13

text.en_US: Seems like you're done.\. Everything's clear it seems.\. For real this time.\.\. Finally.

desc: EventTrigger questBall-fightEnd START IF tmp.questBall-start && tmp.questBall-fightCount >= 13
EventTrigger questBall-fightEnd START IF tmp.questBall-start && tmp.questBall-fightCount >= 13

text.en_US: I'm gonna skip further fanfare.\. Our probe needs to get back to HQ and I need sleep.

desc: EventTrigger questBall-fightEnd START IF tmp.questBall-start && tmp.questBall-fightCount >= 13

text.en_US: Talk to our leader for rewards, you know the drill.\. Now excuse me, I gotta get going.

desc: EventTrigger questBall-fightEnd START IF tmp.questBall-start && tmp.questBall-fightCount >= 13
EventTrigger questBall-fightEnd START IF tmp.questBall-start && tmp.questBall-fightCount >= 13

text.en_US: Hello Ms. \v[lore.title.seeker]!\. So great to see you here on \v[lore.title.planet].
As a humble part of our endeavor here I am trying my best to aid Seekers.
But, my skills are just not on the same level as yours are.
Might I ask you to help me out, dear \v[lore.title.seeker]?
Superb!\. Come back to me when you've defeated the \v[combat.name.hedgehog]s.
Oh, okay!\. No Problem Ms. \v[lore.title.seeker].\. Please come back if you changed your mind.
Of course you do, haha!\. Oh to be young again!
But... back to work.\. It looks like you still need to defeat \c[3]\v[quest.my-first-quest.subrequire.0] \v[combat.name.hedgehog]\c[0].
Wow Ms. \v[lore.title.seeker], you really did it!\. Here's your rewards for it!
Hello Ms. \v[lore.title.seeker], ready for another quest?\. I even have more equipment as a reward.
Happy collecting and remember that different plants yield different items!
Oh, okay!\. No Problem Ms. \v[lore.title.seeker].\. Please come back if you changed your mind.
Of course you do, haha!\. Oh to be young again!
But... back to work.\. It looks like you still need to collect some of the \c[3]items\c[0].
Wow Ms. \v[lore.title.seeker], you really did it!\. Here's your rewards for it!
Hello Ms. \v[lore.title.seeker]!\. I hope you enjoy your journey.
How to increase \c[3]Combat Rank\c[0] to improve the drops of defeated enemies.
Your \c[3]combat rank\c[0] is displayed in the upper right corner during combat.
By \c[3]defeating enemies\c[0] your rank will increase.
With a higher combat rank, enemies will \c[3]drop more items\c[0], including \c[3]special rare items\c[0].
When you're out of combat you'll enter the \c[3]cooldown phase\c[3].
When the blue line disappears, combat will end and you will  \c[3]lose your rank\c[0].
However, when you enter combat during cool down, you \c[3]keep your combat rank\c[3]!
Time to meet our pet again!
This time, we prepared a stage for you.
We took the liberty of modifying it a bit.
Now show us your best performance!

desc: EventTrigger End START IF tmp.bossKilled && tmp.bossline >= 20 && !player.hasLevelUp
EventTrigger End START IF tmp.bossKilled && tmp.bossline >= 20 && !player.hasLevelUp

text.en_US: We promised to measure the time. Behold!

desc: EventTrigger End START IF tmp.bossKilled && tmp.bossline >= 20 && !player.hasLevelUp

text.en_US: Why do you keep teasing us with this pose?

desc: EventTrigger End START IF tmp.bossKilled && tmp.bossline >= 20 && !player.hasLevelUp

text.en_US: Yes. This pose. We know it.

desc: EventTrigger End START IF tmp.bossKilled && tmp.bossline >= 20 && !player.hasLevelUp
EventTrigger End START IF tmp.bossKilled && tmp.bossline >= 20 && !player.hasLevelUp

text.en_US: Home to all guilds with small budgets!
Oh, it's like a small village!
Just wait until we reach your level, monsieur...
I'll make you regret calling us Newbies, you'll see!
Hah, you sound like my little brother planning to catch up with my age!
Oui, oui~ Laugh while you still can!
Repeating my words like parrot, cute!
Well, good luck with the cold dungeon.
Would be cool to have you two around as members.
Hey, you two! Back from the dungeon?
But I'm glad it's over.\. Damn, I hated those bugs.
Oh really? That was the best part of the dungeon if you ask me.
Didn't you think those bugs were pretty damn... \c[3]cool\c[0]?
I guess something about them must have \c[3]bugged\c[0] you!
Hello there! Great to see the newbie squad complete again.
Monsieur, stop calling us newbies already.
You two will always be newbies in my heart!
Now, Lea. I need to talk to you.
You've been missed! It's good to see you again.
You should be aware that, as a First Scholar member, being absent for this long is unacceptable.
We therefore demand the following compensation:
Also please make sure to collect the requested items with your fellow, bug-loving Pentafist friend.
What...? This is all according to protocol. Better check what you sign!
Holerö! Back in the game, I see? That's very good.
Oh Junge... You really won't let it go.
She's mad because I didn't tell her that you're mute.
You knew it and you could have told me several times since the quiz!
But that wouldn't have been nearly as much fun to watch.
Just wait until I reach your level, I'll beat your derrière in PvP. Every. Single. Day.
Great. Very bright outlooks for me.
I also heard that Emilie finally found out about your speech module malfunction, hm?
Well, took her long enough. But this is just very much like her.
You know, I could have told her about it several times... but I sorta didn't.
Yeah sorry... I was just curious to see how long she'd manage to stay oblivious.
In hindsight that probably wasn't a very nice thing to do. Emilie is pretty mad at me now.
Bringing in the girls like usual, huh?
People are waiting for you in the upper floor of the \c[3]First Scholar HQ\c[0].
Hello, my dears! So how about it, did you complete the \c[3]Temple Mine\c[0]?
Wonderful! So, are you ready to take the \c[3]quiz\c[0]?
We'll hold the quiz over there in the seminar room.
And of course both of you will be tested separately. Who wants to go first?
Oh, I'm fine with going first!
Oh? You still need some time?
D'accord, we'll come back soon, Lin!
Are you ready to retake the quiz?
I see. Take all the time you need.
Lea, dear! It's great to see you again!
And just in time for the raid! I suppose the others told you about it already?
Well then, it's important that you collect the \c[3]\v[item.376.name]\c[0] first.
You'll need it to enter the area of the raid event.
That hopefully shouldn't be too hard to an ambitious Spheromancer like you, eh?
Hm? Oh, I've heard about your duel with the green-haired Spheromancer!
Seeking challenges already this early in the game, I'm so happy to have you in our guild!
Anyway, you've got time until tomorrow. Please be so kind and collect the Shade!
Lea, dear! It's great to see you again!
And just in time for the raid! I suppose the others told you about it already?
I was planning to hold a small briefing today to explain all the details to you.
Do you have time right now?
I see. Please tell me once you do.
I see you are about to take that quiz to join this guild, right?
Would it not be challenging to answer the questions with your current vocabulary?
So you forgot about that, hm?
They would have found out about your speech malfunction sooner or later anyway.
Just remember: these kinds of things happen to players.
I just hope you will still be able to take the quiz, somehow...
Lea, I did it!! I passed!
What's wrong?\. You look really nervous...
Don't worry, the quiz is super simple!
I'm sure you can do it!
Lea, dear, now it's your turn.
I hope you read all those text tables next to the statue in the temple mine.
Today's quiz is all about the god \c[3]Di'aro\c[0]!
Don't worry, it'll be just 4 simple questions.
Di'aro is one of the \c[3]Gods of Shape\c[0]. Now...\. what shape did he represent?
So... should I repeat the question?
Huh? What is up Lea? Do you give up already?
Come on, it's really not that hard. Let me repeat the question.
Uhm...\. Yes! Lea, dear...\. That's your name.
Should... Should I repeat the question?
I sort of noticed it before....
Lea you...\. can't really speak, can you...?
Is it a speech module malfunction?
Oh Junge! I thought they managed to fix those issues.
I mean it's sort of weird that you can still say those few words.
Did they add some kind of workaround?
How did I not notice this before...
Well... Still! That's no reason to cancel the quiz!
Easy! We'll just make it \c[3]multiple choice\c[0]!
Lea, dear... I'm sure you can still count with your fingers, right?
Well then, all I have to do is give you four options, eh?
Di'aro is known as the \c[3]Creator of Solid Surface\c[0].
So... what exactly did Di'aro create?

A:\. \c[3]Mountains\c[0],\.\.
B:\. \c[3]Plants\c[0],\.\.
C:\. \c[3]Animals\c[0],\.\. or 
D:\. \c[3]The Sun\c[0]?
There was this time \c[3]E'Nel\c[0] and \c[3]Di'aro\c[0] worked together, eh?

A:\. \c[3]Waterfalls\c[0],\.\.
B:\. \c[3]Volcanoes\c[0],\.\.
C:\. \c[3]Black Holes\c[0],\.\. or 
D:\. ... uhm...
Really Buggy?\. Don't make it too easy for her!
Well I suppose it's clear that option D is not correct anyway...
Well then Lea, what did E'Nel and Di'aro create together?

A:\. \c[3]Waterfalls\c[0],\.\.
B:\. \c[3]Volcanoes\c[0],\.\.
C:\. \c[3]Black Holes\c[0],\.\. or 
D:\. \c[3]Cream Puffs\c[0]?
Oh come on, dear! Please be serious.
Well, I will count that as a wrong answer.
Remember when \c[3]Di'orbis\c[0] tried to convince \c[3]Di'aro\c[0] that the Ancients are "ready for their journey"?
He showed him one of the Ancient's achievements. What was it?

A:\. They \c[3]built huge cities\c[0],\.\.
B:\. They \c[3]traveled through the air\c[0],\.\.
C:\. They \c[3]reached the highest mountain\c[0],\.\. or
D:\. They \c[3]tamed the wildest animals\c[0].
Alright, that's it! The quiz is over.
I am sorry, dear. You only got \c[3]\v[tmp.correct] out of 4\c[0] answers correct.
We expect a bit more of our members.
It's okay! We can simply repeat the quiz.
Here's a little hint for you: You find all the info right in your \c[3]encyclopedia\c[0].
So how about you have a quick look and we try again?
So... what now?\. Can you redo the quiz?
Just have a good look in the \c[3]encyclopedia\c[0]. You find everything in there.
Well, you got one answer wrong, but we can sweep that under the rug, eh?
You answered all 4 questions correctly, just wonderful!
Yes, yes. That's all about Di'aro.
Ah wait... I think I have a small bonus question for you, Lea!
Di'aro is a God of Shape representing the \c[3]Square\c[0].
So, which \c[3]class\c[0] has been founded to honor Di'aro?

A:\. Triblader,\.\.
B:\. Quadroguard,\.\.
C:\. Pentafist,\.\. or
D:\. Hexacast?
Correct! \c[3]Quadroguard\c[0] is the class of the \c[3]Square\c[0].
Just like Di'aro's creations, Quadroguards are known for their stamina and endurance.
That's why we're the traditional "tanks" in your party.
Well then, it's time to make you and Emilie official members of the First Scholars!
It is my greatest pleasure to announce two new members of the First Scholars.
Let's work together to contribute to our understanding of the Ancients!
And, you know, just have a good time, eh?
Merci beaucoup! It's great to join you guys!
So I suppose we'll see each other more often from now on.
That's right! So you should join our party already!
Well, I think you still need to catch up to my level first.
Well, most of us are far ahead in levels.
Yes, he hasn't been online the last few days, but he told me he'd show up again tomorrow.
I'm sure he'd gladly join your party.
Pardon everyone...\. I really have to log off now.
You know... we just rushed the whole Temple Mine and did that quiz in one session.
I'm currently seeing the sun rising. I really should try to get some sleep.
Ah yes, real life is calling.
And I hope to see you again, soon!
And Lea? Next is the \c[3]Heat Dungeon\c[0], non?
You know how it goes, oui? No starting without me!
Lea, dear. Do you plan to logout as well?
I'm sorry about your speech module issue, dear.
But I want you to know: this doesn't really matter to us!
You're a member of the First Scholars, so you're always welcome.
And if you have any problems whatsoever, we're here to help!
That's right! I'm sure things will work out just fine.
You are lucky to have found such a nice guild.
Well then, I'll log you out now. Good night, Lea!
...Um...\. did Lea just talk to somebody?
Do you... see anything when you're offline?
Oh! Did you see anything new that did not happen recently?
Great! That means your memory really is returning.
So, is there anything yet that you clearly remember?
Okay. I am sure it will take some time.
But it is good to know we are making progress!
Oh by the way! I managed to add a couple new words!
So yes, I am working on adding all those question words.
Well... because you ask basic questions that way, correct?
...Because you need question words to ask questions...
I regret adding this word already.
Anyway, your next destination is \c[3]Maroon Valley\c[0].
You get there by going \c[3]West from Bergen\c[0].
Unfortunately it seems that Emilie is offline at the moment.
I am sure she will show up sooner or later!
Go to \c[3]Maroon Valley\c[0] to the \c[3]west of Bergen\c[0].
Tomorrow we'll have our first raid with all First Scholar members!
Anyway, that means we'll be 6 people in total!
This is perfect, because for this raid we'll be split in two teams of 3 people each.
The raid is balanced to match the average level of each team, so this will work just fine despite our level-difference.
Nice! So we can still fight together after all?
Sorry dear, not directly. Both teams will be on separate tracks running next to each other.
Trust me, it's better that way.\. You don't want to be close to an aggressive level 60 enemy.
Why not?\. I'm sure I'd handle it!
Oh, I'd like to see that! Luke, you should swap places with Emilie!
Hush, everyone! Let's not derail too much, alrighty?
We might be on separate tracks, but there is still a collaboration between the two teams.
That's correct! Essentially both teams have to attack the right targets at the same time.
Oh, that sounds interesting. How does it work exactly?
Oh Tronny, don't worry too much about it yet.
It's quite simple. We'll give you instructions when we're there!
Also, be aware that there will be a tricky boss enemy at the end for each team.
So make sure to be well prepared, eh?
Our slot is reserved for tomorrow afternoon in-game time. Make sure you're not too late!
Also the entrance to the raid area is within Autumn's Fall, close to the statue.
So... Let's just meet at the statue tomorrow.
Look at this! Emilie was so excited, she burst!
It's just a small connection error. It happens occasionally.
Huh?\. So they still have connection errors these days?
No, that's not a connection error, strictly speaking.
It's one of the avatar servers failing.
CrossWorlds is run by a huge distributed system.
There are hundreds of servers just for the avatars.
So it is not unknown that some of them occasionally fail.
The backup should be up in a few seconds.
Don't worry dear! Just a small technical issue.
Alors...\. Actually, I was planning to log off soon anyway.
Still gotta get some stuff done, so I have all the time tomorrow for the raid.
Tronny, Lea? Let's meet tomorrow and go to the raid together!
And make sure to be there on time! We still might want to prepare a bit!
Well then...\. See you tomorrow!\. Au revoir!
What about you, Lea? Logging off as well?
Might be a good idea.\. I will make sure to get you back into the game in time.
I made sure to log you in early, so there is still plenty of time before the raid.
Hm, was it that one location again?
Now I am somewhat puzzled. What else could you have remembered?
Actually, about the dream you had before this...
I prepared a couple of questions that could help us to pinpoint the location you saw.
Did it look like a \c[3]jungle\c[0]? With lots of plants, huge trees, et cetera?
Alright, I suppose it would not be \c[3]Gaia's Garden\c[0], then.
Was it a fairly dark location? With \c[3]bamboo trees\c[0] and similar plants?
I see! It must be \c[3]Sapphire Ridge\c[0], then.
That is one of the later locations in CrossWorlds.
It is still a ways off, but we will reach it eventually.
And once you are there, maybe it will help you to recover your memory.
Well then, let us continue with today's schedule!
In other words... let us prepare for the \c[3]raid\c[0]!
I think the guild wanted to meet at the \c[3]statue in Autumn's Fall\c[0], right?
Meet the other First Scholar Members at the \c[3]Statue\c[0] in \c[3]Autumn's Fall\c[0].

The Hedgehog Sandwich
- Myth or Fiction -
The Art of the Laser Lasagne
Uhm... may I ask what your class is?
Ah! That is the \c[3]mage class\c[0], non?
I don't know why...\. but you don't quite strike me as a mage, monsieur.
That's fine. I get that a lot.
Well then... Good luck with the \c[3]Temple Mine\c[0].
Uh...\. this one is kinda hard to talk to, non?
I must say, I appreciate your company.
Not being so chatty, only saying what is necessary.
Well then... Good luck with the \c[3]Temple Mine\c[0].
Good day. Back from the dungeon?
Yes! We're ready to take that quiz, right Lea?
Good day, Lea. It's great to see you back in CrossWorlds again.
That's good. Hexacast shine the most when in a party.
That's true. Now that you mention it, I should probably learn a few more buff and debuff skills.
Good idea, those are very useful indeed.
Actually... I have a lot more questions about this class. You seem very experienced, so if you don't mind me asking...
You're still early in the game, anyway. Not too much you can do wrong now.
Hello, my dears! Please make yourself at home and let me know if you need anything.
Lin, I was wondering...\. are you the leader of this guild?
Well, yes... you could say that.
I started this guild together with \c[3]Al\c[0].
But we're all pretty much family at this point!
It sure feels like visiting a family house.
With so many grown up children...
Why yes, we all just stayed young at heart!
Life is too short to be all serious business, eh?
Lea, dear, you're all by yourself right now?
Well, just tell me when you two completed the \c[3]Temple Mine\c[0] so we can have the quiz!
Ah don't worry, my dear! I'm sure you'll do great!
Now, now, Raphael - don't call them 'newbs'!  It's rude.
Come on, Chief! You know I'm joking.
My nickname is \c[3]Hlin\c[0], but you can call me \c[3]Linda\c[0] or just \c[3]Lin\c[0]!
Good day. Pleased to meet you.
If you two joined our guild, we'd have members of all 5 classes!
Ah, but I'm getting ahead of myself.
Nothing like I had imagined it.
It's like the house I always wanted to own.
Now of course it's not the fortress that many people expect.
But really, the few of us wouldn't know what to do with all the space, eh?
Japp. Also it's not like we could afford the castle of our dreams.
So...\. you're just...\. 4 members right now?
Not quite, dear. Someone else joined us not too long ago, but he isn't around at the moment.
So that makes \c[3]5 members\c[0] in total.
And you two just started playing, right?
Oui! We just reached Bergen and were about to enter the mine.
Ah, wonderful! The first real dungeon. It's always something special.
It's the first time you'll reach a \c[3]heritage site of the Ancients\c[0]!
Why, it's what we \c[3]Seekers\c[0] are looking for.
We try to solve the \c[3]Secret of the Ancients\c[0], eh?
Each heritage site includes a few pieces of the big puzzle.
Did you know that the full secret of the Ancients has yet to be discovered?
Oh yes, they're so crafty about it!
The official path of the game will only tell you so much.
They keep releasing new quests that will reward you with more information.
But the puzzle has yet to be completed!
And yes, that is what our guild is all about.
We are the First Scholars and we study the Ancients!
We want to be the first to unravel the secret!
And now you understand why our guild is so small!
Well, I think it's nice to be in a small guild like this.
There is just too much stress and responsibility with the big ones.
I think it's nice, right Lea?
Lea, my dear, you've been so quiet all the time. Is something the matter?
Anyway, I'd be glad to join! You too, Lea?
Now, now! We have a small tradition here for new members.
Oh don't worry, it's very simple!
We want to test your knowledge of the Ancients.
But for that I'm afraid you first need to complete the Temple Mine in Bergen!
Just make sure to read everything at the heritage site and you should be well prepared.
Come on, Lea! Let's do the dungeeeeon!
It was a pleasure to meet you two.
Feel free to drop by whenever you like.
Oh, and I suppose now is a good time to share contacts, too!
Alrighty! Tell me when you're ready for the quiz!
Learn how to contact other players of CrossWorlds.
You find your contacts in the \c[3]second tab\c[0].
You can \c[3]contact\c[0] those players to have a small chat as long as they are \c[3]online\c[0].
So you two are determined to enter the dungeon together?
You are aware that dungeons are instanced, right?
You have to beat it by yourselves.
But we enter at the same time and do a race on who completes the dungeon first.
Just like with \c[3]Rhombus Dungeon\c[0]. I was first that time.
Well, to be honest, it was very close.
Oh Junge, you're quite the competitive bundle!
Hello Lea, how are you doing? Emilie not with you right now?
Japp. You're a quiet one, alright.
Well, not that you'd get to talk much with chatty Emilie being around.
Holerö! Did you finish the dungeon?
Oui, we're ready for the quiz now!
Oh well...\. all those stupid cold bugs put me off.\. I really hate bugs, you know?
Don't worry Lea, there is still several dungeons left.
Right and I'll win all of them!!
Woah, this rivalry right there.\. Scary.
Hello Seeker. I'm terribly sorry, but this guild is currently upgrading their headquarters.
Because of this, entry to it is currently not possible.
Here we are, the \c[3]Headquarters of the First Scholars\c[0].
Aww! It's a cute little house!
Told you we're a small guild, right?
I don't quite understand this building...
You want to give this to me?
That's awfully nice of you. May I ask why?
Wait, what? Please tell me your voice module is broken.
Phew, well no problem. It can happen.
To observe those who seek all elements is our duty.
If you dare to seek our wisdom, find the key to unlock this observatory.
A key has been found but the time is not ready for you to enter the Observatory.
[Yeah that kinda means there's nothing here right now, sorry!]
Ye just go into that big room to start the fight.
I'll keep track of the time ye take for it.
Ye just go into that big room to start the fight.
I'll keep track of the time ye take for it.
Ye back for another try or to see yer best time?
Ye just go into the big room lass. I'll save the time for ye.
Ye wanna take a look at yer best times?
Alright. Ye come back later then. The challenge takes a while to be ready again.
Just like in the ol' days.
Still a big room inside a darn small building.
Them developers sure know how to make it look plausible.
Well, the counter is still there. So I guess ye can take on the challenge.
Ye want to try it out?
But ye better make sure ye're up to the task.
The challenge here is pretty darn tough.
Heh, can't stop the lass from a fight.
Ye just go into that big room to start the battle.
I'll save the time ye need for it.

desc: EventTrigger fight-start - The Mice START IF tmp.startFight

text.en_US: Ye did it! Very good performance, lass.
As promised I saved your time. So just talk to me to get an overview.
However the challenge will need some time to be ready again.
Let me guess, I'm not your first, right?
I'm not sure why, but someone just sends me gifts from time to time.
Well, I don't mind the free stuff, so keep them coming.
A Spheromancer? Not something I see very often these days.
You see, the class is very hard to master, so it became a bit unpopular, I would say.
And nowadays, you only find a handful of people trying to play it.

\i[arrow-n] Normal Clearing
\i[arrow-w] Road to Bergen Trail
\i[arrow-e] Rookie Harbor
I... I am so sorry.\. For real this time.
I am serious!\. I am out of smokebombs anyway, otherwise those damn \v[combat.name.hedgehog]s never would've gotten me.
But maybe they've been sent by the Track to show me the error of my ways.
This time I will turn myself in and atone for my crimes. Truly.
So... if you will excuse me.
B... but I was going to come to you anyway.\. Don't you trust me?
Sorry pal. Trust is nice and all but I won't take any more risks with you.
In any case, thanks girl.\. You did great work here.\. Report back to the chief to get your reward.

desc: EventTrigger thief-battlestart START IF tmp.startThiefScene && quest.rhg-1-pickpocket.task.5
EventTrigger thief-battlestart START IF tmp.startThiefScene && quest.rhg-1-pickpocket.task.5

text.en_US: Ahhh, I'm sorry, I'm sorry, help meeee!

desc: EventTrigger thief-battlestart START IF tmp.startThiefScene && quest.rhg-1-pickpocket.task.5

text.en_US: How very f-f-fortunate, I just finished my preparations.
And even exactly the kind of s-seeker I was looking for.
Good S-Seeker, I'm in desperate n-need of help.
T-That is most unexpected I must s-s-say.
P-people often rather choose to ignore m-m-me.
I d-d-don't suppose y-you would like to h-h-h-help me?
O-Okay, l-l-let me introduce myself first.
I study this fine moon's F-Flora and F-F-Fauna.
A f-fine name, a f-f-fine name indeed.
You see, I-I want to gather some d-data for \c[3]Autumn's Rise\c[0].
B-But it seems that I alone can't gather everything I w-w-want.
The \c[3]T-Track of the Ancients\c[0] only allows \c[3]Seekers\c[0] to find c-certain things.
I c-c-compiled a list of things I need.
F-First I need some items and Information on the local w-wildlife.
Additionally I n-n-need a list of all the landmarks in this a-area.
Finally I need y-you to retrieve a p-probe I installed further ahead.
I would be honored if you would help me g-g-gather all the intel.
P-Please find out what you c-c-can and return to me!
T-thank you so much for your h-h-help!
A-and in case you wondering how the p-probe looks like...
It looks the same as the o-o-ones next to m-me.
O-Oh... You are not interested after all I see...
In c-c-case you wondering what the p-probe looks like...
It looks the same as the o-o-ones next to m-me.
Were you able to f..find all the data I r-requested?
I d-don't know what to s-s-say!
With t-this I might be able to piece together h-h-how they made this area.
H-Here, take this! I'm looking forward to w-w-working with you again.
H-Hey Lea! Thanks again for h-h-helping me.
Now I only n-n-need someone to help.
How very f-f-fortunate, I just finished my preparations.
And even exactly the kind of s-seeker I was looking for.
Good S-Seeker, I'm in desperate n-need of help.
T-That is most unexpected, I must s-s-say.
P-people often rather choose to ignore m-m-me.
I d-d-don't suppose y-you would like to h-h-h-help me?
O-Okay, l-l-let me introduce myself first.
I study this fine moon's F-Flora and F-F-Fauna.
A f-fine name, a f-f-fine name indeed.
You see, I-I want to gather some d-data for \c[3]Autumn's Rise\c[0].
B-But it seems that I alone can't gather everything I w-w-want.
The \c[3]T-Track of the Ancients\c[0] only allows \c[3]Seekers\c[0] to find c-certain things.
I c-c-compiled a list of things I need.
F-First I need some items and Information on the local w-wildlife.
Additionally I n-n-need a list of all the landmarks in this a-area.
Finally I need y-you to retrieve a p-probe I installed further ahead.
I would be honored if you would help me g-g-gather all the Intel.
P-Please find out what you c-c-can and return to me!
T-thank you so much for your h-h-help!
A-and in case you're wondering what the p-probe looks like...
It looks the same as the o-o-ones next to m-me.
O-Oh... You are not interested after all I see...
One of the sick trees. Apply \c[3]\v[item.171.name]\c[0] to cure it.
Can't you see I'm in the middle of something here?
Still in the middle of something.
Oh dang it, I fell asleep again.
Sorry for startling you. Is this for me?
Mon Dieu, not this guy again~
Good!\. I see your level is now in an acceptable range.
As if that one level would have made a big difference.
Your previous actions have not been forgotten!
Being a cheater is bad as it is.
But seeing a \c[3]Spheromancer\c[0] displaying such dishonest behavior!\. It breaks my heart!
We Spheromancers are a noble, yet unappreciated class!
I can't allow a player like you to further damage our reputation!
Why of course!\. Don't you see my striking crimson outfit?
Pardon, I thought you were a Triblader with all that green and...\. pointy hair.
It's plain to see that fashion is beyond your grasp.
Anyway!\. I'm talking to you, blue-haired Spheromancer!
Come on!\. We just started playing!
Of course we won't do it right here and now.
Let's have our duel at the \c[3]entrance of Bergen Trail\c[0]!
I'll test your skills properly - to make sure you don't use any more dishonest methods!
Good!\. I'll be waiting for you!
Are you sure it's okay to accept his challenge just like that?
Then let's make sure you're well prepared!
I want you to kick this guy's derrière!
Apollo challenged you to a duel and waits for you at the entrance of \c[3]Bergen Trail\c[0]. Be prepared!

desc: Analyzable questtree-foa-1-1-analfix SPAWN IF quest.foa-1-treedoc.solved || quest.foa-1-treedoc.task.1 || quest.foa-1-treedoc.subtask.0

text.en_US: The sick tree. Applying \c[3]\v[item.189.name]\c[0] should cure it but it will take time.
One of the sick trees. Apply \c[3]\v[item.171.name]\c[0] to cure it.
We don't like it but we are forced to give you this.
Don't expect a second reward from us.

\i[arrow-ne] Autumn Residences
\i[arrow-w] To Bergen Trail
\i[arrow-e] To Rookie Harbor

text.en_US: \c[3]Defend the tree for 2 minutes\c[0] for the salve to take effect!

text.en_US: Salve lost effect. The sickness returned!

\c[1]QUEST FAILED\c[0]

Restart task to try again
Now this is the entrance to a small and humble \c[3]guild area\c[0].
You'll need a pass to enter, so here you go!
This item gives you access to our headquarters as well.

desc: EventTrigger Schneider walking off START IF plot.line >= 3710

text.en_US: The entrance is over there to the \c[3]north\c[0].
Good day Madame. I see you play the lone class of Spheromancer.
A view I consider quite rare.
It was a pleasant event to meet you.
One of the sick trees. Apply \c[3]\v[item.171.name]\c[0] to cure it.
I wonder if they'll ever bring back the fishing system...

desc: Analyzable questtree-foa-1-3-analfix SPAWN IF quest.foa-1-treedoc.solved || quest.foa-1-treedoc.task.1 || quest.foa-1-treedoc.subtask.2

text.en_US: Halfway through! I'll go to the end and wait for you.
I'm one of the testers for this game!
The devs asked me to test an almost finished new quest type: \c[3]Parkour\c[0]!
I'm kinda tired and you just came along. So\..\..\.. Wanna try it out?
Nice! Good to see some enthusiasm!
Alright, get this. You will start right next to me.
When you touch this checkpoint, another will pop up.
Your goal is to walk through every marker until you hit the last one.
Aaaaand the last one is over there.
It will only appear after you hit the last normal marker.
Yeah, I know. But it's more fun that way right?
Well, at least if you like running.
Also, if you leave the map all your progress is lost!
Awesome! As I said, just start by stepping on the first marker here!
Really? Oh man, I don't wanna do this all alone.
If you ever change your mind...
Just one more, it's right next to you!
Go on, you can do it!
Just step on this first marker here and start running!
Just one more, it's right next to you!
Go on, you can do it!
Just step on this first marker here and start running!
And there was no problem, right? No sudden shocks or anything?
Thanks a lot! Take this for your efforts.
I hope we can meet again.
...So you can help me again, you know?
A data probe installed by Henry.
A data probe installed by Henry. The data has been retrieved.
Are y'all inner'sted in plants too?
Y'all gave me quite the scare there.
They got some mighty strange doohickeys inside, don'tcher think?
Ah've takin' a notion ta findin' an' analyzin' as many as ah can.
But that's turned out ta be a lot harder than ah 'spected.
See, gettin' at what's inside seems ta only be doable by Seekers.
Ah can only collec' what they bring me.
Might y'all be inner'sted in givin' me a hand?
Y'all already seem ta know the drill.
Much obliged, girl, that there's mighty kind o' y'all.
First, lemme give y'all this here...
This handy l'il gizmo will help y'all keep track o' yer progress.
Jes' keep hittin' them plants an' analyze 'em by gettin' them doohickeys.
Y'all can check yer progress in the menu too!
Ah took the liberty of addin' mah findin's fer the \c[3]Alpha Ball Plant\c[0].
Jes' keep hittin' them plants fer me, a'right?
Alrighty, Ah'll be off explorin' fer more o' them plants.
Might even meetcher again along the way.
Once y'all're finished, come find me in \c[3]Rookie Harbor Alley Quarters\c[0].
Well bless yer heart, girl, y'all come back if y'ever change yer mind.
One of the sick trees. Apply \c[3]\v[item.171.name]\c[0] to cure it.
Hello. I am the canonical NPC.

\i[arrow-w] To Bergen Trail
\i[arrow-ne] To Rookie Harbor
\i[arrow-s] Old Path
Sorry, I'm kinda in the middle of something here...
Oh wait. You're that girl\..\..\.. Lea, right?
Jean already told me you'd come.
Sorry to get you involved. I can't understand why she's not using the Direct Link.
This is about the bunny or whatever she saw right?
I do remember that you can summon some sort of \c[3]Legendary Bunny\c[0] by collecting 5 \c[3]\v[item.139.name]s\c[0] somewhere in \c[3]Bergen Trail\c[0].
But there was another requirement. I can't remember what it was. Maybe our Hexacast-friend Jock knows more about it.
Yep, that's all. Also, I'm \c[3]Jeff\c[0], nice to meet you.
Ah, there's the problem with the speech module Jean told me about.
Nah, don't sweat it. I'll just DL Jean everything I told you.
She should learn how to use the Direct Link System anyhow.
I DL'd Jean everything, so you don't have to tell her.
We're clearly missing some key item here.
They do that to promote backtracking to previous areas.
I bet the content is totally worth it.

desc: Analyzable questtree-foa-1-4-analfix SPAWN IF quest.foa-1-treedoc.solved || quest.foa-1-treedoc.task.1 || quest.foa-1-treedoc.subtask.3

text.en_US: There you are! Thanks for dropping by.
There you are! Thanks for dropping by.
Let's just go straight to the headquarters.
It's to the \c[3]northeast\c[0]. Just follow me!
So how big is your guild, anyway?
Not big. You're about to see it yourself.
Follow \c[3]Schneider\c[0] to the \c[3]First Scholar HQ\c[0] near \c[3]Autumn's Rise - Pathway 3\c[0].

\i[arrow-nw] To Bergen Trail.
\i[arrow-ne] To Rookie Harbor
\i[arrow-sw] Ye old Observatory
Hm, I hope we don't get lost around here.
Seems we have to head \c[3]northwest\c[0] to reach Bergen Trail.
I hope it's not too far.
I will have to logout sooner or later, you see?
Oh, don't worry. I'll stay until you beat up Mr. Grasshead!
And please don't hurry too much because of me!
We have to make sure you're well trained, non?
We have been playing for a long while now, Lea.
Anyway, I suppose there is still time for you to face that duel.

Waaah...!
Don't be so loud! Do you want THEM to hear you?
I'm talking about those thieving Bovines!\. They've ambushed me and stole all the fruits and herbs I've been gathering!
Look at that beast, grazing there like nothing happened!\. And there's more of them in the bushes, just waiting for a victim!
But... you were sent to help me, right?\. I worked all day collecting that stuff, we need to get it back!
Well...\. you have to do it.\. I have to...\. watch for reinforcements.\. So...\. good luck!
Go slaughter them and bring me the package!\. I'll be right here, surveying the situation!
Great work!\. Now... please bring me the package?\. I don't trust this silence.
There they are, the fruits of my labor!\. Literally.
Thanks a bunch!\. You totally saved my butt here!\. But now I gotta get going and deliver these before it's too late.\. So...\. bye!
Sorry I can't muster more feeling, but I get these things way too often.
I don't get it. How does a stranger know what I want?
I don't know why you give me these but you gotta stop.
About time someone showed up.\. And I hear you also helped us out with that lost data?
You really saved my butt there.\. I would've lost weeks of work if some critter had decided to eat it.
But we gotta make it count now.\. I'm sure the group that jumped me had a special leader with them.
Cut that one down and they might just become your usual pack of beasts again.
Right.\. I've already spotted that sneaky rat again and tailed it to their hiding spot.
It's in a cave across the river northeast of here.\. Follow me!
You should go inside and see what you can find.\. I'll guard the entrance.
From that satisfied look on your face and the noise you made in there I assume you got it?
Ha, that should teach those things to not mess with a Falldiver Pioneer.
Seems like you also found something interesting.\. Lemme have a look.
Huh, that looks like some kind of \c[3]data storage unit\c[0] as well, but not the kind we would use.
If that Hillkat bigshot had it then it might be extremely useful.\. HQ should definitely give it a thorough scan.
Here, take it back.\. I'm not gonna hog your glory after everything you did.
A'ight, I better get back and share my report.\. 'Til next time!
Alright, here we are.\. It seems quiet out here, but don't let that fool you.
I didn't sense it leaving, so it should still be inside.
So you go inside and deal with it while I stay here and make sure no one enters or leaves.
Hey don't gimme that look.\. I'd love to settle that score myself but extermination in the wild is Seeker business.
So go on and give it a good beating from me as well, will ya?
A data probe installed by a player for Henry.
A data probe installed by player for Henry. The data has been retrieved.
Oh, this is one of those instanced caves.
Just like the dungeons. Let's see what this one has to offer.

desc: EventTrigger battleScene-Start START IF tmp.fightStart && quest.bg-2-goat_cave_1.task.2

text.en_US: Who would have thought that you were the intruder?\. Can you not let a man and his goats live in peace?

EventTrigger battleScene-Start START IF tmp.fightStart && quest.bg-2-goat_cave_1.task.2

text.en_US: It seems you are wondering what all of this is?

EventTrigger battleScene-Start START IF tmp.fightStart && quest.bg-2-goat_cave_1.task.2
