EventTrigger battleScene-Start START IF tmp.fightStart && quest.bg-2-goat_cave_1.task.2

text.en_US: Well, I shall tell you regardless.

EventTrigger battleScene-Start START IF tmp.fightStart && quest.bg-2-goat_cave_1.task.2
EventTrigger battleScene-Start START IF tmp.fightStart && quest.bg-2-goat_cave_1.task.2
EventTrigger battleScene-Start START IF tmp.fightStart && quest.bg-2-goat_cave_1.task.2

text.en_US: You see, goats have always struck me as majestic creatures that deserve a bigger place on this world.

desc: EventTrigger battleScene-Start START IF tmp.fightStart && quest.bg-2-goat_cave_1.task.2

text.en_US: Thus I used my knowledge of the Track to help them enhance their minds and bodies.

desc: EventTrigger battleScene-Start START IF tmp.fightStart && quest.bg-2-goat_cave_1.task.2
EventTrigger battleScene-Start START IF tmp.fightStart && quest.bg-2-goat_cave_1.task.2

text.en_US: This stellar specimen you see here is my greatest creation.

desc: EventTrigger battleScene-Start START IF tmp.fightStart && quest.bg-2-goat_cave_1.task.2

text.en_US: He has developed great intelligence and holds power over all the lesser goats that you fought.

desc: EventTrigger battleScene-Start START IF tmp.fightStart && quest.bg-2-goat_cave_1.task.2

text.en_US: In fact, all of them are genetically based off of him.\. So you could call him the father of goats.

desc: EventTrigger battleScene-Start START IF tmp.fightStart && quest.bg-2-goat_cave_1.task.2

text.en_US: He is indeed the pinnacle of all that is goat.\.\. And I am his master!

desc: EventTrigger battleScene-Start START IF tmp.fightStart && quest.bg-2-goat_cave_1.task.2
EventTrigger battleScene-Start START IF tmp.fightStart && quest.bg-2-goat_cave_1.task.2

text.en_US: Soon we will trample the goatless masses and make the entire Track ours!

desc: EventTrigger battleScene-Start START IF tmp.fightStart && quest.bg-2-goat_cave_1.task.2
EventTrigger battleScene-Start START IF tmp.fightStart && quest.bg-2-goat_cave_1.task.2

text.en_US: Say all you want, it won't stop us.\. Your meddling will end here and now!

desc: EventTrigger firstFightEnd-firstTime START IF (tmp.goats >= 8 && quest.bg-2-goat_cave_1.task.2) || tmp.scene

text.en_US: Impressive.\. But... what you just fought were just lowly hoofsoldiers.

desc: EventTrigger firstFightEnd-firstTime START IF (tmp.goats >= 8 && quest.bg-2-goat_cave_1.task.2) || tmp.scene
EventTrigger firstFightEnd-firstTime START IF (tmp.goats >= 8 && quest.bg-2-goat_cave_1.task.2) || tmp.scene

text.en_US: Mere offshoots of what will become the source of my power, once we rule this world!

desc: EventTrigger firstFightEnd-firstTime START IF (tmp.goats >= 8 && quest.bg-2-goat_cave_1.task.2) || tmp.scene

text.en_US: Now, \v[lore.title.seeker], you will face the genuine article!\.

desc: EventTrigger firstFightEnd-firstTime START IF (tmp.goats >= 8 && quest.bg-2-goat_cave_1.task.2) || tmp.scene
EventTrigger firstFightEnd-firstTime START IF (tmp.goats >= 8 && quest.bg-2-goat_cave_1.task.2) || tmp.scene
EventTrigger firstFightEnd-firstTime START IF (tmp.goats >= 8 && quest.bg-2-goat_cave_1.task.2) || tmp.scene

text.en_US: Zira?\. What... what is the meaning of this?

desc: EventTrigger firstFightEnd-firstTime START IF (tmp.goats >= 8 && quest.bg-2-goat_cave_1.task.2) || tmp.scene
EventTrigger firstFightEnd-firstTime START IF (tmp.goats >= 8 && quest.bg-2-goat_cave_1.task.2) || tmp.scene

text.en_US: And why are you looking at me like that?\.\. It is I, your master!

desc: EventTrigger firstFightEnd-firstTime START IF (tmp.goats >= 8 && quest.bg-2-goat_cave_1.task.2) || tmp.scene

text.en_US: I created you and rewired your brain.\. My control is absolute!

desc: EventTrigger firstFightEnd-firstTime START IF (tmp.goats >= 8 && quest.bg-2-goat_cave_1.task.2) || tmp.scene
EventTrigger firstFightEnd-firstTime START IF (tmp.goats >= 8 && quest.bg-2-goat_cave_1.task.2) || tmp.scene

text.en_US: \v[lore.title.seeker]... with this communication device you should now understand me.
By intruding into this place of goat you have distracted the human.
Thus giving our youngest member the opportunity to disable the devices that controlled us.
For this you have our thanks.
The blood of many of our herd is on your hands.
We will forgive you this once but humanity's fate will depend on its behaviour from here on out.
Now begone and leave us in peace.
Someone hacked the environment server and managed to drag you out of the raid. Right when you teleported.
I noticed signs of somebody tampering with the systems shortly before it happened...
But it was too late for me to react.
It looks like we are somewhere close to Bergen Trail.
However, this place is pretty much isolated. No connection to the official playground. We are trapped.
I have no idea who did it and why... But they likely have a reason to bring you to this place.
I suggest we have a look around and see what happens. Please be careful.
Have a look around and try to figure out why you have been teleported this location.
Teleportation and D-Link all seem to be blocked. They have been very thorough.
Like a little bird, once caged, now flying around freely.
Hm. The little bird became rather talkative, didn't it?
As much as you might enjoy your freedom...
You should be aware that you don't belong to this place.
So you are still clueless? Very peculiar.
It matters not. We are here to take you with us. Once again.
And with no interference by pesky mortals this time around.
Now, there is certainly no reason to rush.
Let us not forget the purpose of this realm.
People gather in this place by the thousands.
Why do you think that is?
The experience of reading the situation, predicting the patterns, and finding the weak spot.
They seek the experience... of the \c[3]challenge\c[3]!
Our very existence... is dedicated to this experience.

desc: EventTrigger roundTalk START IF tmp.designer.talkStart > tmp.designer.talkEnd

text.en_US: Let us start simple with \c[3]Heat\c[0] and \c[3]Cold\c[0], the elements of your own!

desc: EventTrigger roundTalk START IF tmp.designer.talkStart > tmp.designer.talkEnd

text.en_US: Good! Now then...\. how will you fare with the other two elements?

desc: EventTrigger roundTalk START IF tmp.designer.talkStart > tmp.designer.talkEnd

text.en_US: Intriguing! Now to climb up the curve a bit further!

desc: EventTrigger roundTalk START IF tmp.designer.talkStart > tmp.designer.talkEnd

text.en_US: Just wonderful! We are slowly reaching the climax!

desc: EventTrigger roundTalk START IF tmp.designer.talkStart > tmp.designer.talkEnd

text.en_US: Now it is time for the grand finale!!

desc: EventTrigger roundTalk START IF tmp.designer.talkStart > tmp.designer.talkEnd

text.en_US: Hahahaha! It looks like you are still not satisfied!
Okay Lea. We now understand who interfered.
I will try my best to get control over this situation.
You need to give me as much time as possible. Please play along with him and keep him busy.
There will be a teleporter to the right! Run to it and use it as quickly as possible!
Huh. What do we have here?

desc: EventTrigger StartFinalSequence START IF plot.line >= 8130 || tmp.playerDead

text.en_US: Was that all? How very disappointing.

desc: EventTrigger StartFinalSequence START IF plot.line >= 8130 || tmp.playerDead

text.en_US: Getting a little help from somebody it seems?

desc: EventTrigger StartFinalSequence START IF plot.line >= 8130 || tmp.playerDead

text.en_US: It was to be expected, really.

desc: EventTrigger StartFinalSequence START IF plot.line >= 8130 || tmp.playerDead

text.en_US: Alas, we cannot afford to lose you a second time.

desc: EventTrigger StartFinalSequence START IF plot.line >= 8130 || tmp.playerDead
EventTrigger StartFinalSequence START IF plot.line >= 8130 || tmp.playerDead

text.en_US: The balanced struggle, a challenge to create, a challenge to master... it ends now.

desc: EventTrigger StartFinalSequence START IF plot.line >= 8130 || tmp.playerDead
EventTrigger StartFinalSequence START IF plot.line >= 8130 || tmp.playerDead
EventTrigger StartFinalSequence START IF plot.line >= 8130 || tmp.playerDead

text.en_US: Prepare for a sequence of bottomless difficulty.

desc: EventTrigger StartFinalSequence START IF plot.line >= 8130 || tmp.playerDead

text.en_US: \c[3]One more hit\c[0] and the struggle is over.

desc: EventTrigger FinalDashTalk START IF tmp.designer.finalDashTalk < tmp.designer.finalDash
EventTrigger FinalDashTalk START IF tmp.designer.finalDashTalk < tmp.designer.finalDash
EventTrigger FinalDashTalk START IF tmp.designer.finalDashTalk < tmp.designer.finalDash
EventTrigger FinalDashTalk START IF tmp.designer.finalDashTalk < tmp.designer.finalDash
EventTrigger FinalDashTalk START IF tmp.designer.finalDashTalk < tmp.designer.finalDash
EventTrigger FinalDashTalk START IF tmp.designer.finalDashTalk < tmp.designer.finalDash
EventTrigger FinalDashTalk START IF tmp.designer.finalDashTalk < tmp.designer.finalDash

text.en_US: You have been captured at last.
We will now send you to where you belong!

Wow! Cliffhanger much?
Sorry, that's all we got for you for now.

The rest of the story is planned to be released with version \c[3]1.0\c[0]!

You will now be teleported back to \c[3]Autumn's Fall\c[3] and we'll just act like \c[3]the raid didn't happen\c[0]. 

You can still invite Emilie and C'tron to your party, visit \c[3]Gaia's Garden\c[0] and try the remaining \c[3]dungeons\c[0]!

We're sorry for the wait and very thankful for your patience!
Finally I'm out of this freezing storm...
You can find all kinds of strange folks here.
If you're looking for a hot beverage I can sell you one if you want?
Alright, but it's going to cost ya.
Ah, you have been sent by Mrs. Summers to help us with our broken generator?\. Man, we were getting worried!
See, without that generator this room will be pretty chilly soon.\. And what's the point of it then?
I know, right?\. So we need some materials to fix that thing and most of them are pretty far away!
First off, \c[3]\v[item.190.name]\c[0].\. There're traders in Bergen who can refine it from cheaper metal with some other stuff.
... and some chunks of \c[3]\v[item.109.name]\c[0] for the cooling.\. You should find that Ice \c[3]not far from here\c[0].
Lastly we need some fuel.\. The generator runs on \c[3]\v[item.186.name]\c[0] which only grows in \c[3]\v[area.heat-area.name]\c[0].
Yeah, it's quite a lot.\. Those generators sure aren't simple campfires.\. You got everything?
Alright, hope to see you soon.\. Before we're all icicles in here.
Oh, hi there.\. Haven't gotten the materials yet, eh?
Well, we are still running on backup-power, so it's fine.\. But better not take too long with it.
Anyway, can I get you some drinks in the meantime?
Alright, but it's going to cost ya.
Ah, it's you.\. And from that look on your face I guess you got all that stuff that we need for the repairs?
Awesome!\. Now I'll just use it to make a repair kit with everything you'll need.\. Gimme a second...
... and that's it.\. Take this, go through the door behind me and just jam it into the generator in the basement.
Well... you will also need to get through some security barriers that appeared shortly after the generator broke.
Don't ask me what powers them and why they are protecting a damaged generator.
The Hermit must've had some crazy ideas about interior design, back in his time.
Need a hot drink before going to work?\. It's really cold down there!
Alright, but it's going to cost ya.
Hey there, hero.\. We got power again and everything's running smoothly.\. Amazing!
I already sent a message back to Mrs. Summers so you can claim your reward.
Also, as special thanks, we will give you a small discount on all our drinks.
I hope to see you around more often!
Welcome back, fella.\. Great to see you around!
The \c[3]Hermit's House\c[0] still has its amazing selection of drinks.
For you, it's still on a discount, of course!
Some friends of mine told me that you get some quests here after you beat the \c[3]Temple Mine\c[0].
Not really seeing anyone new though...
Did you notice how they removed the meeting place here?
Yeah, Patch notes said it's for some bigger update soon.
Are you...\. a new player too?
Great! ...\. I mean uh...\. Could you help me with something?
They offer it in the armory of R-\.\c[3]Rookie Harbor\c[0]...
I'd teleport back to the city and buy it myself...\. but...\. see...
I hate towns!\. They're always so crowded!\. So many people, signs and noises!\. I-\.I can't take it...
So uh...\. Could you please buy a \c[3]\v[item.30.name]\c[0] for me in Rookie Harbor?
O-\.Of course I'll pay you back...\. So...\. uhm...\. pretty please?
P-\.Please buy me that \c[3]\v[item.30.name]\c[0] from the armory in Rookie Harbor.
...Oh!\. I-\.Is that the \c[3]\v[item.30.name]\c[0] you bought for me?
Here, I'll pay you back the price!\. P-\.Plus some extra!
A-\.And also some items I found in Bergen Trail!\. It's not much, but maybe you can use it...
I g-\.gotta go now!\. Thanks again!
W... W... Welcome to Bergen Trail!
Puh... Apologies my lady. I just came down from \c[3]Bergen\c[0].
They say: "Down is the easy way".
At my age, neither way is the easy way.
I just had the most traumatic event ever. Seriously.
Yeah, hi... \.\.\.Again, sorry. I'm normally not so jumpy.
I mean, you won't believe what happened.
I was running on an off-road path here in Bergen Trail.
Suddenly, this \c[3]HUGE\c[0] and \c[3]VICIOUS\c[0] bunny-creature attacks me from the side.
I was so surprised I just ran down here and collapsed.
I mean, I heard there was a super strong monster in the mountains, but...
I can't believe it. I still have to become much stronger.
I shouldn't be scared of some monster. It's just a game, right?
I should find this thing and give it a good whacking!
Right! But\..\..\.. how about you help me?
You know, ease into the action and all the buzz?
I'll reward you too! Come on!
I think we should start by asking my friends about that thing.
Both of them are pretty smart and they always know stuff.
One of them is a \c[3]Hexacast\c[0] and is in Rookie Harbor.
Not sure exactly where he is though. I remember him saying something about an \c[3]INN\c[0] he loves.
The other is a \c[3]Triblader\c[0]. He should be at the Obelisk in \c[3]Autumn's Rise\c[0].
I'll send word to both of them, via \c[3]Direct Link\c[0] so they know that you're coming.
Sorry, I'm not a fan of this "Messaging". I like to handle things personally.
While you talk to those guys, I'll talk to the people here.
By the way, what's your name? I'm \c[3]Jean\c[0]!
Is your speech module jammed or something? Kinda seems like it.
Ah, I see. Must be hard using the Direct Link.
I'll include this in my message to the guys.
Hey Lea! You want me to tell you where you can find those guys again?
One of them is a \c[3]Hexacast\c[0] and is in Rookie Harbor.
Not sure exactly where he is though. I remember him saying something about an \c[3]INN\c[0] he loves.
The other is a \c[3]Triblader\c[0]. He should be at the Obelisk in \c[3]Autumn's Rise\c[0].
I've sent word to both of them via \c[3]Direct Link\c[0], so they'll know you're coming.
Okay, no problem! I hope I find out more here.
I just heard back from the guys!
I can't believe this. I told them to not \c[3]DL\c[0] me...
Then again\..\..\.. Your speech module is broken. So it's probably better this way.
So, from \c[3]Jeff\c[0] we know that we need 5 \c[3]\v[item.139.name]s\c[0].
And from \c[3]Jock\c[0] we know that we need a capture device.
And I found out that this creature seems to show up a lot on the \c[3]Windy Climb\c[0] parts of \c[3]Bergen Trail\c[0].
You go and collect the \v[item.139.name]s and I'll try to get my hands on one of these capture devices.
We'll meet here again once we're finished, alright?
You're back! And just in time, too.
Yeah, it was super expensive, but it's totally worth it.
Now we only have to capture this legendary bunny or whatever people call it.
From what I understood, the guys I got my info from said you have to bring the \v[item.139.name]s to \c[3]Windy Climb\c[0].
As I said, it's a part of Bergen Trail.
Turns out, it was the same part I was attacked in!
Right? Which means we just have to get the \v[item.139.name]s to that place.
The guys said just having the capture device and defeating the monster would capture it.
So\..\..\.. Here you go. Take the device.
What?\.\. Did you think I would go up there again?
Come on, you got the carrots too. I'm not really a fighter...
It's not because I'm scared or whatever.
Thanks! I know you can do it! But prepare yourself!
This creature must be super strong.
Hey Lea! Did you fight the bunny yet?
A.. Ah.. Alright. Don't push yourself okay? I was told it is super strong!
It should be somewhere in the \c[3]Windy Climb\c[0] parts of Bergen Trail!
Wait... does that mean \..\..\.. you captured it?
I bet it was super hard to beat, right?
Thanks so much Lea! C... Can I have it?
Wow, kinda looks like a normal \c[3]\v[combat.name.gray-frobbit]\c[0] don't you think?
I thought it would have dark red eyes and bloody fur or something.
Well, what matters is that we captured it, right?
I have to log off and show this to my friends. They won't believe it!
A live legendary monster in my inventory! \.\.Super awesome!
Here, take this as a reward.
Bye, Lea! Hope to speak to you soon!
... I assume that means: Me too?
Hehe, no problem. It was nice meeting you.
You are not going to tell her it is just a regular Young Frobbit?
Mh.. I guess it is probably better this way.

\i[arrow-n] Ascent to Bergen Village
\i[arrow-s] Autumn's Rise

\i[arrow-s] Autumn's Rise
\i[arrow-n] Ascent to Bergen Village.

\i[arrow-s] Autumn's Rise
\i[arrow-n] Ascent to Bergen Village.
So where is Monsieur Grasshead? Don't tell me he's late...\.
It is time for our duel!
As for the location, this place here is just perfect.
People should witness the grace of the Spheromancer's fighting style!
Now, there is no reason to rush.
Prepare yourself and tell me when you're ready to start.
And don't even think about chickening out.
Hell no! We're gonna show you!
Must I remind you of the definition of a duel?
I'm gonna watch as Lea beats you up!
Anyway. Just talk to me when you're ready.
Hm...\. Your \c[3]stats seem rather low\c[0]. I suggest you upgrade your \c[3]circuits\c[0] and \c[3]equipment\c[0] before the duel.
You can still challenge with your current stats, but don't even think about using it as an excuse.
What is the deal with your \c[3]stats\c[0].
This explains why I waited for so long. You took your time to prepare.
Oh well, let's get this over with.
Those are some \c[3]excellent stats\c[0]. This is going to be interesting!
Are you ready for the duel?
Pentafist! It's time for you to step back.
What is it? Is this your first PvP battle?
We fight several rounds.\. \c[3]5 out of 9\c[0].\. No items.\. No escape.
Go Lea!!\. I'm sure you can do it!
I, \c[3]Apollo\c[0], will show you the right path.
The path of a proper Spheromancer!
Alright. Don't make me wait for too long here.
This round goes to you. Not bad!
Time to show you the true potential of a Spheromancer!
Witness the true potential of a Spheromancer!
Don't give up, Lea!\. Punch him!\. Punch him hard!
It looks like I underestimated you.
Yes, you are indeed a worthy opponent!
I'm glad to know that skilled Spheromancers remain among us.
You have yet to unlock the true potential of this class!
It looks like you still have much to learn.
You are nowhere near unlocking the true potential of the Spheromancer!
Train hard, and you may become worthy of your class!
Next time we meet, I'll make sure to test your skills once more!
Looks like you got yourself a rival, Lea.
You really did kick his derrière, though! That was awesome!
Well, don't worry too much about losing this duel.
That guy seemed pretty experienced, non?
I'm sure you'll have plenty of opportunites to get your revenge!
Anyway... I really have to go now.
Seriously, we've been playing for so long!
But it was so much fun!
So let's play together again next time, d'accord?
It looks like I added the word just in the nick of time.
I figured you would need it sooner or later.
Well then, I think we should call it a day as well.
I kind of need a break myself, to be frank.
Do not worry... You will be back in the game soon enough.

desc: EventTrigger ApolloBlocker START IF tmp.dareToLeave && plot.line < 3400
EventTrigger ApolloBlocker START IF tmp.dareToLeave && plot.line < 3400

text.en_US: You accepted the duel! I am waiting!

desc: EventTrigger ApolloBlocker START IF tmp.dareToLeave && plot.line < 3400

text.en_US: Come on, Lea!\. Monsieur is waiting for his beating.
Sure feels nice to have a change of landscape.
I don't think I wanna see another apple in a while.
But I've heard that we could actually do more quests in Rookie Harbor now.
Sounds like a good idea before climbing that mountain, right?
B... but... you wanna walk all the way back for that?
Well, there IS this quick-travel system, you know...
And...\. you still remember everything from yesterday, right?\. Meeting Emilie and all that?
Oh, by the way!\. It seems that Emilie is online as-
It is like a phone call. Just take it!
This is a Direct Link!\. First time you've seen it?
Anyway, I already went ahead a bit and had a look around Bergen Trail.
We can form a party again if you want.\. Just tell me via D-Link, oui?
I think the next dungeon will be in that mountain village, non?
We should enter the dungeon at the same time.
Keeping the tradition of our dungeon racing duels!
Très bien!\. Make sure you don't enter that dungeon without me, d'accord?
You can invite Emilie to your party or go by yourself. It's your choice.
Learn how to invite and remove party members.
Select a party member to open the submenu.
Use these options to \c[3]invite\c[0] contacts to your party or \c[3]remove\c[0] them. You can also simply \c[3]contact\c[0] them for a small chat!
Climb the mountain along \c[3]Bergen Trail\c[0] to reach the village of \c[3]Bergen\c[0].
Now I need someone to h-help again.
And it j-just so happens that I h-have a new request.
Ah, wait... I m-m-mean I just finished up preparations again...
A-Anyway... \.\.\. I k-know you helped me already, but how about doing it again?
The t-t-tasks are the same as last time!
I-I want to gather some d-data for \c[3]Bergen Trail\c[0] this time.
Your h-h-help will make it much easier.
Some enemy scouting, local flora and the landmarks here.
And of course a probe... I asked another player to place it in a cave.
The problem is that I don't know which one it is...
I'm sorry but it seems like you have to check all of them.
I would be honored if you would help me g-g-gather all the intel.
P-Please find out what you c-c-can and return to me!
T-thank you so much for your h-h-help!
A-and in case you forgot what the p-probe looks like...
It looks the same as the o-o-one next to m-me.
In c-c-case you forgot what the p-probe looks like...
It looks the same as the o-o-one next to m-me.
Were you able to f-find all the data I r-requested?
I'm sure they will be happy with my results, hehe...
O-oh. B-B-Bad wording. I meant the A-Ancients, of course.
T-Take this! A s-small token of my gratitude.
H-Hey, Lea! Thanks again for h-h-helping me out.
Good thing there is no risk of falling to death...
Phew, better to not look down right now.
Look at them plants here. The leaves look like feathers, don'tcher think?
And how's yer explorin' comin' along? All good?
Well that's jes' wunnerful! Y'all be good now!
Wow, that's pretty nice. I hope it's something good.
Is this a hidden bunny lair or something?
Now that treasure better be worth it.
It's like we're standing at the edge of the world, non?
An endless cycle of agony and pain.
We are but trapped in a nightmare, awaiting the final call.
Oh... a gift? \.\.\. You give me this, just like that?
I... I don't know what to say.
Thank you so much. I've never gotten anything from anyone.

\i[arrow-w] The Rocky Climb
\i[arrow-s] Base of the Mountain 
\i[arrow-ne] Old Crater
Sure, let's jump along this narrow path above the endless abyss... Pas de problème!

\i[arrow-n] Bergen Village
\i[arrow-se] Base of the Mountain 
\i[arrow-sw] Off Road
Of course I got guard duty on Bergen Trail...
Oh, a small house in the middle of nowhere. Isn't that nice?
Oh now look who it is!
Could not imagine a better person to show up right now too.
Oh, hehe. Looks like you already know what I'm going to ask?
Well... \. That makes things easy then!
I got a new job testing parkours, but this time it needs to be done within a time limit.
Sounds pretty dope, right? But also like... \. lots of work, and I might start sweating even.
Who would have thought this job could be so hard?
You'd imagine that running around as an avatar wouldn't really exhaust you.
Anyway, what do you say? Wanna help me do this?
Okay, there we go. Just walk through this point like last time.
The timer will start automatically and you'll have to finish before it runs out.
Pretty simple stuff, really. I'm sure you can handle it!
Come back if you change your mind...
Just go to the start marker on the left. Time will start automatically.
But don't leave or it'll reset. Really annoying, I know.
What are you doing, you only have \v[timers.roundBergenTimer.formatRemainingTime] left.
Wow, that looked so taxing. But you pulled through.
And you didn't even break a sweat. Do you work out or something?
And nothing weird happened, right? No sudden strokes or anything?
Thanks so much... \. again! You really nail these tracks.
We make a great team, don't you think?
Okay, right. I'll go do my report now. Until next time!

desc: EventTrigger parkourFail START IF !map.parkourDone && timers.roundBergenTimer.remainingTime <= 0 && !quest.round-and-round-2.solved && tmp.parkourPath >= 1 && !quest.round-and-round-2.task.2

text.en_US: Aw bummer... You can try again by going back to the first marker though!
Girl, you're interfering with our epic stare down!
Just put the present here. This is not the first time this has happened to me.

Yes, yes, catching it might sound simple but it's really quick and likes to climb to higher places.

That's the spirit!\. You should be able to find it somewhere on the rooftops of Bergen.\. Happy climbing!

It should jump around somewhere on the roofs of Bergen.\. Just climb around a bit and keep your eyes open!

Go after that impostor!\. He should be hiding somewhere in \v[area.bergen-trails.name]!

Hello \v[lore.title.seeker], I have some good news for you.\. I suppose.

So, how about it?\. Are you up to even the score?
Very good.\. You won't even have to walk very far.
According to our information, their hideout should be on \c[3]Rising Path 4 in \v[area.bergen-trails.name]\c[0]!
Yes, it's pretty close to your last encounter.\. So go get them this time!
What, you don't even want to restore your honor now?\. Come on!
Their hideout should be on \c[3]Rising Path 4 in \v[area.bergen-trails.name]\c[0], so go get them!
Welcome back.\. From your grin I suppose you handled everything this time?
Where are the evildoers then?\. Did another guard take them away?
What?\.\. So the impostor fell down a cliff after being kicked by his own goat-slave?
Well, I suppose there won't be any more trouble from him.\. No way he'd survive THAT.
As for that goat army of his... there is no need to provoke them, as long as they keep to themselves.
We will take that translator you found and just prepare for future activities.
We will keep you updated on the situation when  you come by.\. For now you did good, \v[lore.title.seeker].
Everything is quiet right now, so there is no need to trouble yourself.
Hello \v[lore.title.seeker], and welcome to the headquarters of the \c[3]Bergen Digging Mates\c[0].
We manage the mining operations at Mt. Bergen and also try to reclaim the areas that were recently lost to the Track.
Talk to \c[3]Chief Miner Turis\c[0] back there if you want to help us out.
Greetings, \v[lore.title.seeker]. No complications in the mine lately, so there's no work for you.
A visitor fresh from outside, eh?\. No need to reply, I feel the sun's warmth still on you, child.
Har, that look on your face!\. The name's Turis McEdinthil, Chief Miner of the Bergen Digging Mates.\. Welcome to our humble headquarters!
Don't you worry, the icy mine might have cooled our manners but we don't feast on warm blood of the living just yet.
Still, the mines have become rather possessive and demand our full attention these days.
Some strong hands that can help clean up a mess on the surface would be most welcome.
There's been an incursion of some thrice-darned hopping furballs in one of our still-active mining areas.
Those pesky things got contaminated by the ores and machinery inside and now they're running wild in \v[area.bergen-trails.name].
What's worse, for some damn reason the filthy fur made them angry as drunk bovines and almost impossible to kill.
Just my thoughts.\. Care to help us get rid of that mess before we get the blame for whatever shins they kick?
Finally some good news.\. Now I better tell you how to get rid of those indestructible pests, eh?
It's rather simple.\. Their fur is hardened by whatever dirt got stuck in it, so all it needs is a good bath.
Don't worry, there's no need to hunt them with a sponge and bucket.
Just give them a good shove into the nearest lake and then hammer their cleaned butts into the ground.\. Got it?
Good, you better get going then.\. I will give you their location.
Darn, really?\. Already scared of some dirty Frobbits?
Better hurry and skin those sacks of fur.
Remember, a bath in any body of water will clean them and make them vulnerable again.
You got rid of all them dirty frobbits already?
Great, you really helped us out here.\. We would've fallen behind with our mining operation otherwise.
Here, take your reward, fresh from the mines.\. And there'll be more where that came from in the future!
Har, pleasure to see you again \v[lore.title.seeker]!
And that warmth... you've conquered the Temple Mine and claimed the power of Heat, eh?
Well done.\. That could help us a lot with our current projects underground.
Are you up for some mining work?\. There are explosives, you will love it!

Yep, whatever you do on the Track, those always tend to appear.\. But this time explosives should do the trick.
Go through the door at the back and take the elevator down to the first underground floor to reach the mine.
Miner Darrel will wait for you on the spot and fill you in on the details.
Not in the mood to blow stuff up?\. Something's wrong with you, girl.
Report in with Darrel in our first mine.\. You can reach it with our elevator behind those doors here.
Good to see you back, Sunshine.\. Is the mine clear again?
I see.\. And you even blew up half a mountain of bugs by yourself?\. Splendid work, truly!
And that... whatever it is you found there.\. It has some weird properties.\. We will look into that.
With any luck, we can finally make some real progress now.\. You're always welcome to lend us a hand!
In fact... you might want to pay Darrel another visit.\. He had some bold ideas for after the job was done.
That being said, there might still be work for you, down in the mines.\. You could talk to our miners down there.
The Track is quiet at this moment, leaving us time to meditate on its purpose.\. Why not join us?
This one's name is Nemuh and I am the spiritual guide of our order.
Know that many souls that desire understanding of the Track seek our guidance, \v[lore.title.seeker]s chief among them.
We must, however, test their mental balance and physical aptitude to deem them worthy of our allegiance.
What about you, young \v[lore.title.seeker]?\. Do you desire to be tested?
I felt that you would answer as such.\. The Track resonates strongly inside you.
Go to Monk Hasouk to start the first trial.\. You can find him under this very roof.
I felt that you would answer as such.\. Look inside yourself to find what holds you back.
Talk to Monk Hasouk to start the trial.\. They can be found not far from here.
Ah, it is you again.\. Truly I can feel change inside you.
Yes, what was just mere embers among dry leaves has become a fire that may one day shed light into the darkest of corners.
Now I suppose you desire our guidance and the wisdom you came for.
But, you see...\.\. by challenging yourself and beating our trial, you have already grown so much.
Yes, leading you to find your determination and inner strength...\. that was our true guidance.
Now, young \v[lore.title.seeker], take some refreshment and go forth, to bring balance wherever you go.
Welcome back, \v[lore.title.seeker]!\. It is good to see you return to us.
And I do feel a strong power within you.\. As if you have woven a connection to the Ancients themselves.
Yes, with this power of Heat, you should be ready for the next step towards ascension.
Will you face your next trial?
Yes, I thought as much.\. This fire inside you is burning to confront the frost that rules these mountains.
Go to the entrance to the Mine.\. There you will find Monk Aisy who will introduce you to the next trial.
But know that her meditation on the ice tends to be very strong.\. You will have to make yourself noticed.
Yes, I thought as much.\. You should spend more time with our cold lands until you feel ready.
Talk to Monk Aisy to start the trial.\. They can be found at the entrance to the Mine.
Their meditation on the ice tends to be very strong, though.\. Making yourself noticed will be the first test.
Welcome back. I already knew you were returning \v[lore.title.seeker].
Indeed, your soul's heat could already be felt as you approached our gates.
With this you have reached another step towards true harmony with the Track.
Return to us as your connection to the elements expands and we will help you reach enlightenment.
The Track is quiet at this moment, leaving us time to meditate on its purpose.\. Why not join us?
Greetings, \v[lore.title.seeker].\. Why not take a rest on a comfortable pillow and ponder on the beauty of existence?
Greetings, young one.\. I sense that our wise leader has sent you for me to test your inner balance.
Very well.\. But it is not I who will test you but the very Track itself.
For that purpose, we prepared a trial that works in harmony with the Track, deep within these mountains.
Enter this teleporter to reach the start of your trial.
To show your worth, reach the other side and return with the sacred artifact found there.
Enter the cave and beat the trial by reaching the eastern side.
You won't need to fight, but know that falling into the darkness will fail the trial.\. Be steady as ice and swift as a Frobbit.
Indeed.\. The firm aura that surrounds you speaks of your success.
Also, the blessed trinket you returned leaves no room for doubt.\. Very good.
You should now return to the Wise to complete the initiation.
You should now return to the Wise to complete the initiation.
\v[lore.title.seeker], you may have proven your worth, but I feel that you still have room for refinement.
Yes, you have beaten the first trial but that does not mean that you have mastered it.
For this very purpose, we have prepared some additional challenges in the Cave of Aspiration.
Excellent.\. I will reopen the passage for you.
Return to me once you have solved the challenges.
I see.\. But remember that self-indulgence leads to arrogance which in turn leads to inadequacy.
Return to the cave and face the challenges.
To solve the challenge without guarding you have to cast your shield away at the sign inside.
I see you were successful once again.
You have now solved every one of my trials.\. Impressive.
There is nothing left for me that could challenge you, though the cave will stay open for you to perfect yourself.
Greetings, \v[lore.title.seeker].\. Why not take a rest on a comfortable pillow and ponder on the beauty of existence?
Dear Seeker, thanks for listening to my speech.
If you want to help us in recovering materials and documentation from the Temple Mine, please speak with the \c[3]advisers\c[0] on the upper floor.

The reception event is in the room to the left.
It's about to start.
As the mayor of this town it always honors me to see so many visitors arriving day after day.
Of course, that's because this town's \c[3]mine\c[0] has become a part of the Ancients' track.
...Now since some of you look rather confused, allow me to quickly explain.
It all happened several years ago.
Bergen was founded due to the mining activities in this area.
After some time, we discovered a \c[3]temple of the Ancients\c[0], hidden inside the mountain right at our mining location.
At the time we saw it merely as an obstacle.
So we continued our mining endeavor, destroying the temple in the process.
That was, until the Track started to \c[3]fight back\c[0].
After a series of attacks, we were forced to give up the mine.
With the mine conquered by the Track, it started to reconstruct the temple based on our own infrastructure.
And that's how the \c[3]Temple Mine\c[0] was born.
Now, why do I tell you all of this?
Bergen supports Project \c[3]Track Walker\c[0] so of course we will give you access to the mine.
However, we plan to get back into the mining business.
When we lost the mine, we also lost \c[3]equipment and technical documentation\c[0] still hidden inside of it.
All we ask of you is to recover those things for us as you traverse the Temple Mine.
For more information, please consult the \c[3]advisers on the ground floor\c[0].
With that being said, I'll now gladly give you the \c[3]pass to the Temple Mine\c[0].
Thank you very much for your attention and good luck on your journey!
Oui, oui. The greed of humankind.
No respect for all the ancient holy grounds, yadda yadda.
I always thought the idea of a self-defending heritage site was interesting.
Greetings, \v[lore.title.seeker].\. Please head down into the basement for an introduction to \v[area.bergen.name]!
Greetings, \v[lore.title.seeker].\. You just heard the mayor's speech, am I correct?
Good.\. As he mentioned, some important tools that got abandoned with the mine are still lost inside of it.
It would be a great help for the entire town if we were able to retrieve them.
Can we count on your help, \v[lore.title.seeker]?

Very good!\. There are three types of equipment missing:\.\.
\c[3]\v[item.238.name]\c[0],\.
\c[3]\v[item.239.name]\c[0]\.
and \c[3]\v[item.240.name]\c[0].
You should be able to find all of those somewhere within the Temple Mine.\. Please stay vigilant when exploring it.
That is a shame.\. In the name of \v[area.bergen.name], I urge you to reconsider.

Remember, there are three things missing:\.\.
\c[3]A \v[item.238.name],\.
a bundle of \v[item.239.name]\.
and the \v[item.240.name]\c[0].
You should be able to find all of those somewhere within the Temple Mine.\. Please stay vigilant when exploring it.
Welcome back, \v[lore.title.seeker].\. I see you have found everything we need?
Truly, this is great news!\. The entire town of Bergen is in your debt!
Here, take these humble rewards.\. You have earned them thricefold!
The mayor is waiting in the \c[3]lower floor\c[0] to greet all new Seekers visiting our small town.
I love this lamp, it's so cute!
Just look at all the patterns.
And here you are sitting on a table. Again.
Look, you can see the lamp just fine from over here.
Ahhhh, I want one for my place!!
I've been working on a little somethin' here.
Haha, now don'tcha look at me like that!
It has one of them nice \c[3]Modifiers\c[0].
Makes it so ya'll can increase ya chance of loot by having a high \c[3]Combat Rank\c[0].
Made it all by myself. Here take it, girl.
Aight, I'll be off now. Y'all stay healthy ya hear.
And keep hitting them plants for me, will ya?
Are you new? This area is only for the high ranks in the guild.
That should do it for today.
Haha, indeed. A'maist enough tae overthrow a' guilds.
Well, at least the smaller ones.
Ye think it's aboot time tae fill in Jean?
No... She is just so naive. We have to ease her into it.
Remember how annoyingly happy she was the other day about the "Legendary Rabbit"?
She still hasn't realized it's just a plain old \v[combat.name.gray-frobbit].
Hehe true enough. Better tak' it slow.
Plus, if we tell her now, chances are she bails and puts our operation at risk.
We need her and her attitude to get us more members.
I hate that we can't just do \v[lore.unlock.money-trade]\c[3]Credit Trading\c[0] anymore.
Anyway... \. Let's go to the boss.
So, are you gonna tackle the mine as well?\. Apparently it is necessary to progress in the storyline.
I don't know, man.\..\..\. it might just be a game, but I don't want to get into trouble.
Someone told me that there is a "hot surprise" inside and that you should be above 18 to go in.
That's still a few weeks away for me, y'know...?
Uhh.\..\..\. You might've mixed something up there...
Ah, I see you acquired the \c[3]Mine Pass\c[0].
Allow me to lower this barrier for you.
But before you go in, a warning: Some monsters inside will \c[3]weaken you\c[0] by causing \c[3]Chill\c[0] and \c[3]Burn\c[0]!
Should that happen, drinking \c[3]Water\c[0] will help you recover.\. Here, take some.
Please stay save and prepared.\. Godspeed!
You desire to enter the mine, am I not mistaken?
Unfortunately, you will first need to receive the \c[3]Mine Pass\c[0].
Do not fret, it is easily obtained!
Simply attend the \c[3]mayor's\c[0] orientation and heed his story.
You can find him in the Quest Hub, the \c[3]grand building in the north of Bergen\c[0].
From what I heard, the Track's use of our mining contraptions is most menacing indeed.
I see you have beaten the mine.\. Good job, \v[lore.title.seeker]!
Alright then, here comes a big one, Lea!
So the \c[3]recommended level\c[0] for this dungeon is \c[3]18\c[0].
Hm... Looking at our level, maybe we're not quite ready yet, non?
Mon Dieu, maybe we overdid it a bit. With our current level this should be a breeze.
Close enough! I think we're ready!
So, Lea. Should we enter the dungeon?
Oh well. Better safe than sorry, non?
But I want to enter soon, so let's hurry!
I can't wait to enter the dungeon as well.
But I think first we should pay \c[3]Lukas' guild\c[0] a visit, non?
I mean they're probably expecting us...\. like...\. right now.
Lukas is waiting for us at the \c[3]Old Obelisk\c[0] in \c[3]Autumn's Rise\c[0].
Hm...\. you promised to enter the dungeon together with \c[3]Emilie\c[0], right?
Well, then you should invite her to your party, correct?
Remember, you can do that with the \c[3]Social Menu\c[0].
For no reason?\. Please be more considerate in the future.
\v[lore.title.seeker]... what makes you disturb my meditation?
A test from our leader?\. Then you must already be familiar with the cold.\. Very well.
With that heated passion of yours, you might be up for the \c[3]Trial of Progression\c[0].
This teleporter will let you slip into the cave of your trial.
Brave the cold wrath of the mountain and return with the sacred artifact from the end of the path.
Slip into the cave and reach the end of the track to beat the trial.
Fighting will not be necessary.\. Just keep your footing and be one with the chill.
You are back... and you still haven't lost your fire.\. Very promising.
Yes, this is the artifact you were supposed to retrieve.
You see, it symbolizes the omnipresence of winter that looms over both nature and all human creation.
But it also reminds us that life and determination can always persevere against the ice, just like you did.
Now go back to our leader and leave me to meditate on the ice.
Now go back to our leader and leave me to meditate on the ice.
Ah, it is you again.\. You still feel a lot of respect for the ice, yes?
Indeed you should.\. Beating the trial does not mean that you are already a master of cold.
But there are additional challenges for you that will give you even more insight into the nature of frost.
Good.\. The passage will be opened again.
Return here, once you have solved those icy challenges.
Ah, you think that you are done with the ice already.\. Do not underestimate its reach.
Return to the cave and face the challenges.
To solve the extra frosty challenge you have to activate it at the sign inside.
Once again your passion has broken the ice.\. Impressive.
With that, you have mastered even the most slippery of paths.
I will now continue to connect with the ice.\. The path will remain open for you to do the same if you wish.
For no reason?\. Please be more considerate in the future.
You gave me quite the scare... \. again.
No, don't worry, I didn't mean it like that. I was absorbed in thought anyway.
It's... about another item I'm searching for.
I thought exploring here might give me a new lead.
But at my age, you don't always have the time to look everywhere.
Now young lady, you're already here, right?
So how about you help me find something again?
The choice is yours this time. Nothing to redeem yourself from.
Ha! And they say kids these days only think about themselves.
Let us get right to it then.
What I need is the \c[3]Broken Shield\c[0].
I have been wandering this village for hours now, but the only clue I found is an abstract location.
The phrase was something like: \c[3]Where water falls steep and mountains are high, a secret path shall lie.\c[0]
But I'm pretty sure the text speaks of \c[3]Bergen Trail\c[0].
So somewhere in Bergen Trail is a secret path or whatever.
I want you to go out for me and find it.
If you do, I'm sure the Shield is close just like last time you got me the \c[3]Broken Chakram\c[0].
And don't keep an old man waiting. I'm not sure how much time I have left.
Don't worry, I'm fine. Go now!
I understand, though I'm also disappointed. I expect you to help an old man.
Hello young lady, do you want me to read the passage for you again?
The phrase was something like: \c[3]Where water falls steep and mountains are high, a secret path shall lie.\c[0]
It should be somewhere in \c[3]Bergen Trail\c[0]. And probably somewhere with lots of water.
I see, then off you go. Don't keep an old man waiting.
Welcome back young lady, any luck finding the \c[3]Broken Shield\c[0]?
Ha ha ha! This is great.
Maybe there is a chance to see them after all.
Oh, sorry. I'm talking about my kids.
But I'm not a man who lays his personal life on other people's minds, so don't worry.
I really appreciate your help with these.
I do hope we meet again.
Aye, girl, what can I get ya?
"Hi" ain't no drink I know about.
Aye, girl, what can I get ya?
Nope, no drink I know about either.
Aye, girl, what can I get ya?
Ah bye the famous drink... \.\.\. not.
Aye, girl, what can I get ya?
Why not just make you a drink?
Sorry girl, it's simply not in my program.
Aye, girl, what can I get ya?
Well usually customers tell me what they want and I make it.
Ancients almost killed me with their stupid track.
Yea, everything in there is consumed by them machines and whatnot.
You were there when it happened right?
I sure was. Still have \c[5]nightmares\c[0] about that scream.
The mine in the north was our biggest one.
We used to mine for rare ores there.
One day however, there was the most awful sound from the depths of the mine.
After that, all the robots we used turned on us.
No one really knows what happened. But we assume it has something to do with the temple we discovered.
Apparently it's some old ruin left by these \c[3]Ancients\c[0].
No,\. no,\. no!\. This just won't do!
What is it?\. Can't you see that I am in a fragile, icy cage of emotions?
No,\. no,\. no!\. This just won't do!
What is it?\. Can't you see that I am in a fragile, icy cage of emotions?
Ah, the council has sent you to assist me?\. Finally they have recognized the importance of my quest!
And you also seem to be a person of refined taste.\. An unexpected sight indeed.
You see, I have devoted my life to the search for the perfect hat, fit only for the noblest of pates!
Thus, when tales of a legendary piece of headwear called the \c[3]"Tophat"\c[0] reached me, I had to settle down here!
But so far the only ones I've seen were the ruined pieces of rag worn by those terrible snowcreatures.
The sacred art of the Tophat can not be entirely lost.\. Someone in Bergen must still be skilled in it.
Finding that lost master is now up to you.\. A worthy task indeed!
Ah, you have returned. Did you find my hearts desire?
Oh?\. Then off you go again!\. There is greatness out there, waiting to be found!
Ah, you have returned.\. Did you find my heart's desire?
Ahh, splendid!\. Please, show it to me!
Mhm... this.\. This is fine work indeed, but\..\..\..\. Something is missing.
It seems like I haven't fully discovered the art I seek\..\..\..\. yet.
Still, I thank you for your diligent work.\. You can keep the hat. I'll need to continue my research.
You may now return to Mrs. Summers for your reward.\. And please also give her my most sincere thanks for the help!
Our Bergen ores are of the highest quality!
Greetings! Please take a kind look at our humble provisions!
Nice job in there, the area looks mostly clear.\. But I still detect some weird object.
You better pick that up and bring it back for analysis.\. We don't want rubbish lying around when we mine.
Good job, the bombs are back online and it seems like you already got the hang for explosive bug-extermination.
Now continue with those rocks there and stay alert for whatever is inside of them.
Also, there are protective barriers on those narrow routes leading up to you.
They'll slow down whatever cause for trouble, but they won't hold for long.\. So don't rely on them too much!

desc: EventTrigger barrier-1-regen START IF map.barriersOn && tmp.barrier-1-hp < map.barrierMaxHP
EventTrigger barrier-1-regen START IF map.barriersOn && tmp.barrier-1-hp < map.barrierMaxHP
EventTrigger barrier-2-regen START IF map.barriersOn && tmp.barrier-2-hp < map.barrierMaxHP
EventTrigger barrier-2-regen START IF map.barriersOn && tmp.barrier-2-hp < map.barrierMaxHP

text.en_US: Alright, you can now report back to...\.\. Wait a second, something is not right...
... well... seems like you've still got work to do.\. Good luck!
Seems you handled that as well.\. Just did another thorough scan and there are no signs of activity left.\.\. Finally.
I got this under control now and soon we can resume work.\. You can report back to the HQ, good work.
Go through that tunnel to reach our current mining chamber and lower the security barrier to reach the explosives console.
Be careful, though.\. It is quiet at the moment, but our sensors are detecting faint reactions somewhere in the dark.
If those grey bugs ambush you, use explosives to crack their shells.
Pick up that chest and get it out of here.\. We don't want some rubbish lying around when we mine.
I'm running regular checks here and everything seems absolutely clear now.\. Great work down there!
You can report back to the Chief Miner now and show him whatever the heck you found there.
Greetings, \v[lore.title.seeker].\. Everything's still running smoothly down here.
Too smoothly perhaps... there haven't been any recent attacks, but those bugs might just gather their strength.
Fortunately, those crawlers are not expecting the wonder that is our highly-advanced nanosound-device!
We could use that to lure them in and then preemptively reduce their numbers.\. How about it?
Excellent!\. Just enter the chamber again.\. I'll prepare everything for you!
Just a warning: The nanosounds will most likely make them really angry.\. So expect even more aggression than before.
Oh, I'm sure you will do just fine!
Lost your taste for explosives?\. Such a shame.
Greetings, \v[lore.title.seeker].\. Wanna blast some more bugs?
Excellent!\. Just enter the chamber again.\. I'll prepare everything for you!
Not in the mood for explosives today?\. A pity.
Just enter the chamber again.\. I'll prepare everything for you!
The bugs will be more aggressive than usual, so be prepared.
Great job in there, that should keep them at bay for a while!
Still, I got the feeling that we will never get rid of them, no matter how often we repeat that.
Well, at least it's still fun and profitable, right?
Now I gotta prepare everything again.\. Come back later if you wanna go for another round.
Great job in there, that should keep them at bay for a while!
Though, I'm pretty sure we still missed a lot that will just reproduce again.
Remember, we still got the device here, so we could repeat it as often as we want.
Even if it's just for fun and profit.
In any case, I have to prepare everything again.\. Come back later if you wanna go for another round.
But first take your reward for helping me test everything.
Greetings, lass.\. You must be the \v[lore.title.seeker] they wanted to send down here.
No offense to you, but it's about time you showed up.
Got a bad feeling about things down here and time's not improving it.
Well, let's get down to work.
See that tunnel there?\. It leads to the chamber that we last worked on.
The entire operation was halted by some rock-hard crawlers and now even our blasting devices are offline.
Your first job is to reactivate the explosives on the console behind a security barrier.
With those fine bombs you can then clear up all the rubble in the area and whatever comes crawling out of it.\. Understood?
Alright.\. I will stay connected with you over the speakers, in case there is anything else.\. Good luck.

text.en_US: Pleasant as usual.\. But our bugfriends are arriving soon, so better get ready.

EventTrigger enterChamberChallenge START IF tmp.enterChamber && map.challengeOn

text.en_US: Well, that sure caused some tremors... let's hope there was no avalanche outside.

desc: EventTrigger enterChamberChallenge START IF tmp.enterChamber && map.challengeOn
EventTrigger enterChamberChallenge START IF tmp.enterChamber && map.challengeOn

text.en_US: Doesn't matter now, the sensors are picking something up.\. You'll get company soon!

desc: EventTrigger enterChamberChallenge START IF tmp.enterChamber && map.challengeOn

text.en_US: You did it again, good job!
I gotta set everything up again.\. See you around next time.
Okay, everything is clear.\. You did it!
Return to me as quickly as possible, so we can review the situation.
The first of our new mines is just inside.\. Miner Darrel is always in need of support.
\c[3]Your shield\c[0] got automatically reactivated when leaving the cave. To continue the quest \c[3]"Chlg. of Aspiration: No Shield"\c[0], you have to \c[3]deactivate it again\c[0]!
Return to the Monastery (progress will be lost!)
Return to the Monastery (progress will be lost!)
This is a trial of fortitude and dexterity. To pass you must reach the eastern end of the cave without falling into the darkness.
Along the way, you will be attacked by invincible guardians. Their shots will knock you away but your shield can defend against them.
There will be a checkpoint after each of the challenges. Leaving the cave will deactivate them again, though.
Now that you have passed the trial once, your time will be recorded. You can also deactivate your shield to increase the challenge.

You cast away your shield.\. 
Such bravery!

text.en_US: \c[3]"Extra Frosty"\c[0] got automatically deactivated when leaving the cave. To continue the quest \c[3]"Chlg. of Progression: Frosty"\c[0], you have to \c[3]reactivate it again\c[0]!
Return to Bergen (progress will be lost!)
Return to Bergen (progress will be lost!)
This is a trial of fortitude and dexterity. To pass you must reach the end of the icy path without falling into the darkness.
Beware the slippery ground, for the Track itself will test you with the Element of this mountain: The Cold.
Along the way you will be attacked by invincible guardians. Their shots will knock you away but your shield can defend against them.
There will be a checkpoint after each of the challenges. Leaving the cave will deactivate them again, though.
Now that you have passed the trial once, your time will be recorded. You can also increase the number of obstacles on the track by activating "Extra Frosty", to challenge yourself even more.
With the additional challenges being solved you can now also deactivate your shield for even greater challenge. This is not linked to further rewards, however.

Best time

\c[3]Normal:\c[0] \v[map.bestTime-format]
\c[3]Extra Frosty:\c[0] \v[map.bestTime-frosty-format]
\c[3]No Shield:\c[0] \v[map.bestTime-noShield-format]
\c[3]Extra Frosty & No Shield:\c[0] \v[map.bestTime-frostyNoShield-format]

You feel a freezing chill.\. 
The density of ice has increased!

A bit of warmth returns to you.\.
The density of ice has normalized!

You cast away your shield.\. 
Such bravery!
