text.en_US: To become a \c[3]True Avatar\c[0] you first need to master all \c[3]4 Elements\c[0].
The first element, Heat, lies ahead in the \v[lore.unlock.temple-mine.first]\c[3]Temple Mine\c[0].
Prepare. It will test your wits before granting you new powers.
To become a \c[3]True Avatar\c[0] you first need to master all \c[3]4 Elements\c[0].
I sense you unlocked the mysteries of the \c[3]Heat\c[0] Element.
Use it wisely as the path ahead is filled with obstacles only an Avatar can overcome.
To become a \c[3]True Avatar\c[0] you first need to master all \c[3]4 Elements\c[0].
I sense you unlocked the mysteries of the \c[3]Cold\c[0] Element.
Never waver in face of peril and press onward, the cold should never bother you anyway.
To become a \c[3]True Avatar\c[0] you first need to master all \c[3]4 Elements\c[0].
I sense you unlocked the mysteries of the \c[3]Shock\c[0] and \c[3]Wave\c[0] Element.
You have become a \c[3]True Avatar\c[0]... It's time for you final challenge.
There is no rush, take your time.
Ah, hello \v[lore.title.seeker].\. Can I interest you in some solid metal?\. It is especially shiny today.
Ahhh, you're the assistant from \v[area.rookie-harbor.name]?\. Alright then, let me explain the deal.
We can deliver some advanced metalworking tools to \v[area.rookie-harbor.name] but only if you bring us some certain spare parts.
They are expensive to produce these days but there should still be some built into certain machines in the mine.
Word on the street is one of them is in some \c[3]room that harbors the power of heat\c[0], whatever that means.
In any case, maybe you can find one there so we can bring this deal to a close.\. Good luck.
Apparently you can find those parts in some \c[3]room that harbors the power of heat\c[0].
Not sure what it means but I'm sure you got some ideas.\. In the meantime, care for some metal?
Hello \v[lore.title.seeker].\. You got the parts we need?
Ah, yes those seem perfect.\. Good job!\. That'll be more than enough for a nicely advanced metal oven.
We will handle the rest.\. You can report back to the CTC in \v[area.rookie-harbor.name] to get your reward.
You can report back to the CTC in \v[area.rookie-harbor.name].\. I have already notified them.
In the meantime, why not buy some nice metal here?\. It's nice and fresh!
Greetings, young lady.\. Our current circumstances don't require your assistance for once.
Ah, a \v[lore.title.seeker].\. It is a pleasure, seeing more of your kind here in Bergen.
I am Mrs. Summers, holding the position of chairperson in \c[3]\v[lore.title.faction-shock-bergen]\c[0].
Lovely.\. Alas, we should not spend too much time with idle pleasantries.
After all, we businesspeople have as much a responsibility to humanity's progress as any soldier.
Sadly, some of those among us are more concerned with personal vanities nowadays.
But appeasing even associates such as those falls onto me, as useless as it might seem.
You, on the other hand, seem like a diligent young lady.\. Could I ask you to lighten my burden a bit?
Excellent.\. \v[lore.title.operation-trackwalker] truly shows its worth in all facets of our society!
The person in question is called \c[3]Jamie Twirlson\c[0].\.  You should be able to find him in the local \c[3]Item Shop\c[0].
He wastes his time and the patience of all his colleagues with fruitless fashion experiments.
Hopefully you can be of assistance to him so he can finally work towards something more worthwhile.
That is truly a pity.\. But I can not blame you.
Talk to \c[3]Jamie Twirlson\c[0] and try to assist him.\. You should be able to find him in the local \c[3]Item Shop\c[0].
Ah, there you are.\. The news have preceded your arrival.
Yes, yes, he got his wish but still was not satisfied.\. A luxury problem as old as man.
It does not matter, we have both done our duty.\. So you will get your due reward and I will hopefully have some respite.
You have done well.\. I hope your assistance will remain a reliable asset in the future.
Good day, seeker.\. You have chosen a convenient time to pay me a visit.
There has been a problem in the \c[3]Hermit's House\c[0], a popular meeting place on \v[area.bergen-trails.name].
Supposedly their power generator has been malfunctioning and needs repairs.
For that purpose they are in need of various materials from different locations.
Would your schedule allow for that kind of assistance?
Very good.\. You can find the Hermit's House at the \c[3]Spike Heights on \v[area.bergen-trails.name]\c[0].
Talk to the owner of the house for more details.
Are you certain?\. It does seem like a very serious assignment this time.
Go into the \c[3]Hermit's House\c[0] at the \c[3]Spike Heights on \v[area.bergen-trails.name]\c[0] and talk to the owner.
Welcome back.\. Another job well done, I see.
The route through Bergen Trail would have become much more arduous without your deed.
Here, take your reward.\. We will stay in contact.
Greetings, young lady.\. Our current circumstances don't require your assistance for once.
You did it.\. Yay and stuff.
What a convenient stage we have here!
Now, it is time to face your trial!
Let us see if you are the genuine article!
A display of your talents shall suffice as proof!
I am just as confused about this whole situation as you are...
It is certainly a mess, but we will get you out of this.
For now, take on this challenge and keep him busy.
I know, this enemy looks intimidating, but do not lose hope!
I am confident you will be able to handle this!
... Because I can see its battle stats.\. They match your level!
Cap, I'm back with the report!
Aye... hard to miss that lass.\. Hope ye didn't run into everythin' with those horns there.
Wait...\. don't tell me ya didn't notice the horns 'til now, Lea...
Anyway, make sure ye clean up that mess ye started down in the cargo hold soon.
I hope Sergey is satisfied.\. Is he around?
Yeah, just let me set up your headset for a sec.
My good man! It's been a long time.
Indeed.\. You are still clinging to that jet pack, I see?
Ye know I'd never travel the sea without good ol' Betty.
Anyway, I hope ye two will be ready to travel on soon.
An avatar on board just calls for darn trouble.
Of course.\. We will make this as brief as possible.
Gee, Cap.\. What kinda welcome is that s'posed to be?
Also, ain't we talkin' to Jet, former VRP dueling champ?
You keep telling us about all your combat moves from the old days.
So here I thought maybe you'd want to give Lea a small combat lesson?
Ye're tellin' me that wee lass is up for a battle?
Right, we'll see about that.\. Just talk to me later t'day.
Ye can show the lass around the ship, but don't ye stir up any trouble.
C'mon, Lea!\. It's time for some fresh air!
This is no place for ye, lass.\. Go play somewhere else.
There ye are.\. It's about darn time for yer combat lesson.
Good.\. Let's go to the balcony.
Do ye still need to prepare yerself?\. I don't got all day, lass.

Is that blue guy still out there?\.
Seriously, we never had anything like this happen before.
You'd think they'd make sure players can't escape the playground or something.
Girl! Skip the chatting, will you? We have to hurry!
Are you looking for the captain?
I think he's currently somewhere in the cabins.
Indeed, even a captain needs a break once in a while...

You're that avatar girl we were warned about, right?\.
Sorry, but I need to pay attention to the radar.

desc: EventTrigger itsComing START IF plot.line >= 400 &&  tmp.enterBridge

text.en_US: It's still on the radar, approaching us at high velocity.

desc: EventTrigger itsComing START IF plot.line >= 400 &&  tmp.enterBridge

text.en_US: No transmission, no darn ship to see.\. What's goin' on here?

desc: EventTrigger itsComing START IF plot.line >= 400 &&  tmp.enterBridge

text.en_US: Captain! I think I caught it on satellite! You gotta see this!
...Whoa!\. You spoke!\. Is your voice finally back?
Her speech synchronization is still malfunctioning.
I just hard coded the word "Hi" into her speech module.
That is all she can say for now.\. I am currently working on adding more words.
I see... It's a start, I s'pose.
Anyway, the Cap and I here have been planning out your combat training, girl.
We're almost set and good to go, right?
Aye, this is gonna be interestin'.
So, I'll be off to my cabin for some final preparations.
I'll be done in no time, so just stick with the captain, 'kay?
Aye, I'll be back on the bridge. Ye can talk to me when ye're ready for the lesson.
Make sure ye're prepared.\. I'll be expectin' yer full attention.
Make sure ye clean up the kitchen after ye're done cookin', understood?
It's not like we forgot since the last time he told us.

desc: EventTrigger messy START IF subevent.carla.messy.start && plot.line < 200

text.en_US:
Oh my...\.
Look at this mess.\. The captain will surely not like this.

desc: EventTrigger messy START IF subevent.carla.messy.start && plot.line < 200
EventTrigger messy START IF subevent.carla.messy.start && plot.line < 200
EventTrigger messy START IF subevent.carla.messy.start && plot.line < 200

text.en_US: Jet runs a strictly regimented ship.\. Every room needs to be cleaned before work.

desc: EventTrigger messy START IF subevent.carla.messy.start && plot.line < 200

text.en_US: I wonder how these guys managed to skip Jet's daily inspection.
Oh! I thought they canceled this game!

He seems pretty engaged with the game.\.
We should just let him play...
Oh!\. You must be the avatar the captain told us about.
Well, feel free to check out the ship.
It's just one of the smaller ships of the Solar class but it does its job.
But I suggest you don't go near the room across the hall...
So you checked out the room across the hall?
Don't mind it.\. Normally every room has to be clean.
But somehow she manages to get around captain Jet's inspections.
Hey there, Lea.\. You better not keep the captain waiting.
Wait, Carla... is this your room?
Sure is.\. Something wrong with it?
I mean, how did Jet not see this... \! room?
Well, you'll have to wait for another time to hear my secrets I guess.
Better go to the bridge, the cap' wants to show Lea some new tricks as soon as possible.
What? You are not curious, Lea?
Well, I guess we should go then...
Hey there, Lea.\. You better not keep the Captain waiting.

desc: EventTrigger messy end? START IF subevent.carla.messy.start2 && subevent.carla.messy.progress >= 10
EventTrigger messy end? START IF subevent.carla.messy.start2 && subevent.carla.messy.progress >= 10
EventTrigger messy end? START IF subevent.carla.messy.start2 && subevent.carla.messy.progress >= 10
EventTrigger messy end? START IF subevent.carla.messy.start2 && subevent.carla.messy.progress >= 10
EventTrigger messy end? START IF subevent.carla.messy.start2 && subevent.carla.messy.progress >= 10
EventTrigger messy end? START IF subevent.carla.messy.start2 && subevent.carla.messy.progress >= 10

text.en_US: THE TIME FOR REVENGE IS NIGH!

Awesome! You mastered the final challenge! 
This is all for now. 
Thanks for playing!

desc: EventTrigger enterRoom2 START IF map.entered || true

text.en_US: Get ready for the final challenge!

Thanks a lot for completing this tech demo of CrossCode!
If you like what you saw, please tell your friends!
We'd like to get word around! :D
Also, follow us on Facebook and Twitter!

Wait, we're not done yet!
From here on we have a small challenge for you to master, if you like to bash some more enemies. 
Have fun!
Lea, you don't open presents like this!
Come on, Ms. Avatar!\. There are still some boxes left.
Come on, Ms. Avatar! There are still some boxes left.
I got a friend back home who's a regular CrossWorlds player.
I seriously envy him!\. I didn't have the money for the game and now... well... I'm on a ship.
But at least now I can claim to have seen a real-life avatar in person!
Maybe some day I'll finally be able to play CrossWorlds as well.\. And then, who knows, we might just meet again!
Dear me, I never knew my colleague was such a geek.
The whole day he's been blabbing about CrossWorlds and avatars and whatnot.
Well, admittedly CrossWorlds is pretty amazing.
I still find it hard to believe they managed to get all the resources to essentially turn this moon into a high-technology theme park.
... I suppose it's a good thing they did!\. It's a steady income for me, being a small cog in this machine.
And she's a Spheromancer class!\. How awesome is that?
Looks like you got your first fan, Lea.
Hey there, Carla. Good to see you.\. About all these strange boxes here...
Yeah... I know.\. I'm supposed to clean that up.
But right now I have to take care of the avatar, y'know?
I'll do it in a bit, okay?\. See ya later!
She said exactly the same thing yesterday.
Anyway, Carla just passed by us again.
She told us that you could take care of all these boxes here.
I mean, really, can you believe that woman?\. Now she's loading off her work on our guests.
It's easy to destroy these boxes with your avatar weapons, right?
Awesome!\. Please, I wanna see that!
Well...\. no pressure, you know.\. You are our guest after all.\. But you'd help us out a lot.
So, will you destroy the boxes for us?
Destroy all boxes in this room.
I'm really surprised how quickly those balls were flying.
What are you even talking about?
I didn't see any balls.\. Only those boxes disappearing for whatever reason.
Yeah, you need to wear these AR goggles to see them.
The balls and their impact are all like... virtual and stuff.
I see... so that's why you've been wearing those goofy glasses all day.
Goofy? You know nothing about style, lady!
Anyway, thanks a lot for the help.
Yes!\. Thank you so much, Ms. Avatar!

Thanks a lot for completing this tech demo of CrossCode!
If you like what you saw, please tell your friends!
We'd like to get word around! :D
Also, follow us on Facebook and Twitter!

Wait, we're not done yet!
From here on we have a small challenge for you to master, if you like to bash some more enemies. 
Have fun!
Oh yeah. Lea?\. Just a heads up - don't worry about the captain being a bit on the grumpy side.
That's just the way he is.
Well, well... Our endeavor has not been concluded!
You will not escape our will!
Lea, those are high level opponents.
Do not fight them. Run to the teleporter!
Girl, you sure are a natural with that ball thing!
Carla, they are called VRPs.\. Not "balls".
Ah, c'mon! Nobody calls them that anymore, y'know?
Well done!\. Yeah that was all.\. It's a small room.
What are ya standing around here for?\. The wall is gone, the path is clear.
Well something is different about this switch, right?
I'm afraid one ball just won't cut it.
Now, several balls on the other hand...
Nah, I won't give ya a hint for that, girl.
You removed the wall, the rest is straightforward.
Oh yeah, that one is kinda mean.\. Need a hint?
Did you try to hit this switch with charged balls?
You probably realized that doesn't work.\. It's too slow.
How about you look around?\. There might be another way.
Heh, this is so much fun.\. Just too bad we can't chat along the way...
Ah, don't worry!\. I'm sure Sergey will get the speech problem fixed in no time.
It is...\. challenging to say the least.
Please, a bit of optimism, sir...
Entering the next stage, more switches await!

Wrong direction, girl.\.
Gotta reach the teleporter!
Oh yeah!\. Never mind the visor!\. I just need this to see what you're doing.
Do not worry about it for now.\. We will explain it to you later on.
Huh? Don't tell me you're already stuck?
Look, how about you try to jump over this container here?
That cardboard box ain't there for no reason.
Walk toward small object to auto-jump on top of them.
So, that wall ain't there anymore. You're free to pass.
Now all that's left is some jumping over those containers.
Move toward edges to auto-jump over gaps.
You need to find a way to remove this wall.
Basic stuff, Lea. You'll need to throw balls at something.\. That's all I'm gonna say.
Y'know, ball throwing is pretty much the solution to most obstacles around here.
Those boxes here are no exception.
Well, ain't that just another stupid wall....
But the color is different this time. Maybe that means something, who knows?
I'm pretty sure you yourself can't pass it.\. But maybe something else can...?
Well, would ya look at all those switches! Need a hint?
Yeah, that switch is pretty well hidden, huh?
Remember those charged balls?\. Those bounce on walls, y'know?
I'm sure those will help ya out here.
See those switches on the containers? Yes, you can hit those. From a distance, that is!
Just make sure you throw the balls from the same height.
Really?\. You can't figure this one out?
Just jump over the boxes and hit that thing hard.\. That's all, really.
Right, then! Go on! You're almost there!
That's all for this room!\. Nice work, girl!
Your task is to reach the door at the other end of this room.
And don't mind me! I'll just stick along and keep an eye on ya.
Well... I might give you some hints. If you ask nicely, y'know?

Wrong direction, girl.\.
Gotta reach the teleporter!

desc: EventTrigger ShreddersGo START IF plot.line >= 700 && tmp.shreddersStart && !map.shreddersSpawned

text.en_US: Damn, how're we gonna pass this one?!

desc: EventTrigger ShreddersGo START IF plot.line >= 700 && tmp.shreddersStart && !map.shreddersSpawned
EventTrigger Carla does Stuff START IF map.carlaDoesStuff

text.en_US: Carla, Instant Matter builder, at your service.
Welcome to the rats' fortress, standing unpenetrated for centuries!
Apparently somebody had a fun time putting this together.
Just hit 'em with those balls. That's all there is to it.
Yeah, you're probably missing the mouse robots here.
Those things are pretty small, y'know?\. Might be they're hidden somewhere...
Ain't no way you're getting close to those mouse robots in that corner.
But you can still hit them, y'know? Remember the orange walls? Balls flying through them and all?
Girl, that was so quick!\. Took me forever to put all of this together.
Ha, finally!\. This one's my favorite!
Here you can go wild on these robot mice!
It's a moving target practice!\. Have fun, girl!
Press \i[throw] repeatedly to hold down the enemies in a rapid fire.
Hold \i[throw] to hold down the enemies in a rapid fire.

Wrong direction, girl.\.
Gotta reach the teleporter!

desc: EventTrigger CarlaCheat START IF plot.line >= 700 && tmp.carlaCheat
EventTrigger CarlaCheat START IF plot.line >= 700 && tmp.carlaCheat

text.en_US: Time for turrets!\. Don't worry, those things won't hurt you.
This is in fact just a simple puzzle.
C'mon, you can do this yourself.\. Really want a hint?
Oh well.\. Look, these blocks are kinda like switches.
Only they don't react to the typical balls.
Maybe they react when hit by something else.
Attagirl! Use that pretty head of yours.
Hm, this one is a tiny bit more tricky. Need some help?
To make the turret hit these blocks you have to stand between turret and block.
Then you need to dodge the bullet right after it was shot.
You need to get the timing right.\. C'mon, I know you can do it!
It's actually almost the same as before.\. Only this time the turret and blocks are on a higher level.
So get up on that container in the middle and dodge some bullets!
These things are kinda unexpected, right?\. Need a hint?
That mirror-like thing only shoots bullets, when it's hit by your balls.
And it always shoots the bullets right at you.
You'll need a block between you and the mirror and still need to hit the mirror with one of your balls...
So here's the hint:\. Think bouncing balls!
Phew, that's all for this room.\. Lot's of puzzles, right?\. But don't worry, you will get some real action in the next room!
A bit of advice!\. Hit them with \i[tech]charged balls to cancel their attacks!
Enter that arena there to start the lil' sparring session.
If you liked this room, you're gonna love the next one, trust me!
Yes!!\. That was awesome, girl!\. Sergey, you were not kidding! She's really got a knack for battling.
Yeah, that sure takes me back.
Just a short warning.\. Here you'll meet your first "real" enemies.
And by "real" I mean those things will, in fact, attack you.
Don't get me wrong!\. They're really easy, but still....
If you do get beat down, your respawn point is right in this room.
Uhm...\. that means there's no real danger!\. Go ahead and kick some ass!
Ah, just a moment!\. Let me enable the dash module before we start the battle.
Dash is essential in battle, since it helps you to quickly dodge enemy attacks at any time.
Right he is!\. Now please enter to the right in order to proceed with the ass kicking.
Press \i[dash] while moving to dash, though only up to 3 times in a row. You can dash at any time, even while aiming.

Wrong direction, girl.\.
Gotta reach the teleporter!
Amazing work!\. Numbers sure can't beat skill.
Would ya look at all those cowards ganging up on you!
But don't panic,\. just keep moving and strike fast!
Aaand another victory for our fearless gladiator Lea!\.
C'mon, show me a right hook! \.\. And a left!
Standard VPI was not modeled after boxing\..\..\..
Nice moves!\. They didn't even see it coming.
Yeah yeah I know,\. a second waited is an attack wasted.
Still,\. you should know that your strikes have enough punch to interrupt some attacks.
So you can just pummel your opponents without giving them a chance to strike back.
Sounds like a plan, am I right?\. So go get 'em!
Close in fast and whack 'em over the head!

Wrong direction, girl.\.
Gotta reach the teleporter!
Hey champ, get your adrenaline down again for a second.
We gotta add a bit more edge to your arsenal.\.\. A sharp one, that is!
I see that got your attention.\.\. Sergey, you finished?
Yes.\.\.\. Unlocking Virtual Proximity Impact\..\..\..\. now.
...you can quickly tear through several targets in your path at once.
Only them close ones, \.of course.\. You got that?
Sharp as a blade!\. Now start by clearing that path for us, will ya?

Click \i[throw] near Lea inside the circle to perform a close-combat attack.
Alternatively, just press \i[key-melee].

Press \i[throw] without touching \i[right-stick] to perform a close-combat attack.
Alternatively, just press \i[key-melee].
Just do a few warm-up swings on those pesky obstacles.
Just do a few warm-up swings on those pesky obstacles.
Don't worry, those are the same weaklings as before.
More punching bags await your blade.
And here we are at the last challenge.
Don't let the big number scare you and keep focused.
That was quite the ride, huh?
Aaand you just crossed the finish line!\. Congrats!
It's like you've never forgotten the basics at all.
Oh my, you still look so puzzled about all this.
I suppose it is about time we explain all the circumstances.
You bet it is.\. But let's take a short break before that, okay?
I still need to report to the captain.\. He wants to meet Lea as well.
Good idea.\. Best not keep Jet waiting for too long.

desc: EventTrigger DesignerWarning START IF plot.line>= 700 && tmp.designerSay

text.en_US: We can sense your fear...\. your every step!

desc: EventTrigger DesignerAgain START IF tmp.designerAgain && map.shredder1

text.en_US: Let us follow Carla for now.
Y'know, the view here is nice, but you gotta see what's beyond the bow.
We're currently steering towards Rhombus Square. That's something to look at!
Actually, why not go to the bow and explain the situation to Lea there?
Seeing Rhombus Square will make it easier for her to understand, correct?
S...\. Sorry, I'm busy checking the containers here.
Hello there! You must be a guest on this ship, right?
Why, don't be shy! We seamen may look rough, but we're easygoing folks, really.
You want to know what I'm doing here?
I'm currently checking up on the solar panels here.
These are our primary energy source, so they better work properly!
Otherwise our nice and shiny M.S. Solar won't budge a centimeter.
Trust me, being stuck in the ocean too long is not something you want to experience.
Just let me do my work, okay?
Huh... I suppose he did not even notice you are an avatar.
Well, the human appearance is pretty convincing.
You don't look like a proper seaman. So, I reckon you're a guest?
Not very talkative, huh? Sorry, I'm in the middle of a maintenance routine.
Ah, look who's there.\. You must be that avatar, right?
Well then, welcome to the M.S. Solar!
If you lean over the railing a bit you might even see the name of the ship.
Oi, make sure you don't fall into the sea.\. I'm pretty sure avatars are bad at swimming.
I have no idea what is going on, but you better listen to the Cap' and get going!
Hey, can't you see I'm busy here?\. ... Wait, who are you?
Oh right, I remember now.\. You're that pseudo-robot thing.
Oh, no offense.\. You see, I just recently had this discussion with a colleague.
It was about avatars being the same as robots.
And I have to insist they are not!\. Avatars are just some fragile, temporary collection of instant matter.
Everybody knows real robots are made of metal.\. Like these beauties here.
So I just can't share the excitement of my colleagues about your presence.
You're just an avatar.\. No true robot, see?
Anyway, I have to take care of my babies here.\. So if you'll excuse me...
Oh my!\. That's some extremely colorful hair you have there.
I had heard that avatar designs tend to be flamboyant, but... really?
You're not happy about them either, huh?
Now I have to wonder who put those things on you.
I expected the embodiment of some gamer kiddie's wildest dreams.\. Lots of beefcake and such.
Yet, here we have such a cute girl.
Too bad that doesn't really say anything about the player's actual appearance.
Just like in the old days of MMOs.\. Some things never change.

desc: EventTrigger Carla to the front START IF plot.line >= 130

text.en_US: Bow is just ahead.\. It's a bit of a walk, though.\. Just follow me.

desc: EventTrigger Carla to the front START IF plot.line >= 130

text.en_US: Go to the bow of the ship.

desc: EventTrigger Carla to the front START IF plot.line >= 130

text.en_US: Carla, what were all of those destructible boxes doing in that room anyway?

desc: EventTrigger Carla to the front START IF plot.line >= 130

text.en_US: I was just practicing how to use those things, y'know?

desc: EventTrigger Carla to the front START IF plot.line >= 130

text.en_US: Probably should have done that somewhere else.

desc: EventTrigger Rhombus Square View 1 START IF plot.line >= 141 && map.standAtFront

text.en_US: Now, girl, have a look at this!

desc: EventTrigger Rhombus Square View 2 START IF plot.rhombus-seen

text.en_US: Well, I guess this cleared up some things at least, right?

desc: EventTrigger Rhombus Square View 2 START IF plot.rhombus-seen

text.en_US: Alright then, I think this is a good time to split.

desc: EventTrigger Rhombus Square View 2 START IF plot.rhombus-seen

text.en_US: I'm gonna go talk to the captain and help him set up that combat lesson for you.

desc: EventTrigger Rhombus Square View 2 START IF plot.rhombus-seen

text.en_US: Meanwhile you can have a look around the ship, if ya like.

desc: EventTrigger Rhombus Square View 2 START IF plot.rhombus-seen

text.en_US: The crew knows about ya.\. I guess you already noticed that, right?

desc: EventTrigger Rhombus Square View 2 START IF plot.rhombus-seen

text.en_US: You can meet me and the captain later.

desc: EventTrigger Rhombus Square View 2 START IF plot.rhombus-seen

text.en_US: Until then! Just make sure not to fall into the water, girl!

desc: EventTrigger Rhombus Square View 2 START IF plot.rhombus-seen

text.en_US: By the way, Lea.\. I had a closer look at those speech synchronization issues.

desc: EventTrigger Rhombus Square View 2 START IF plot.rhombus-seen

text.en_US: Unfortunately I do not think I will be able to fix them soon.

desc: EventTrigger Rhombus Square View 2 START IF plot.rhombus-seen
EventTrigger Rhombus Square View 2 START IF plot.rhombus-seen

text.en_US: However, I found a little workaround.

desc: EventTrigger Rhombus Square View 2 START IF plot.rhombus-seen

text.en_US: I might be able to hard-code specific audio patterns into your speech module.

desc: EventTrigger Rhombus Square View 2 START IF plot.rhombus-seen

text.en_US: ...That means you will be able to say certain words.

desc: EventTrigger Rhombus Square View 2 START IF plot.rhombus-seen
EventTrigger Rhombus Square View 2 START IF plot.rhombus-seen

text.en_US: That should help a bit, correct?

desc: EventTrigger Rhombus Square View 2 START IF plot.rhombus-seen

text.en_US: So, let us try it out.

desc: EventTrigger Rhombus Square View 2 START IF plot.rhombus-seen
EventTrigger Rhombus Square View 2 START IF plot.rhombus-seen
EventTrigger Rhombus Square View 2 START IF plot.rhombus-seen
EventTrigger Rhombus Square View 2 START IF plot.rhombus-seen
EventTrigger Rhombus Square View 2 START IF plot.rhombus-seen

text.en_US: It works! That should help you start some conversations with the crew here.

desc: EventTrigger Rhombus Square View 2 START IF plot.rhombus-seen

text.en_US: Have a look around the ship.
So, ye ready for the battle?
That's what I like to hear! Let the battle begin!
Well then, tell me when ye are.
Carla!\. Are ye ready up there?
Yes, Cap! Don't forget the goggles!
Haven't worn these for some time...
I was told ye learned the basics down in the cargo hold.
Still, first I want ye to show me yer grip on aimin' and throwin'.
Time to say hello to an old friend!
Listen carefully.\. I want ye to hit that robot from this distance ten times.
And do it quickly! Got that?
Quickly hit the target-bot ten times.
I see ye understand the basics well enough.
Aye, just as I expected. Ye notice how half o' them balls missed the target?
Ye still need to understand how to aim properly.
Be patient, lass!\. Ye missed yer target too often again.
Ye're supposed to quickly throw balls at the target.
Ye're supposed to throw quickly, lass!
Not one darn charged ball after the other, ye understand?
Should I explain the basics to ye again?
I'll show ye how it's done.\. Watch closely.
See them dotted lines? That's the throwing range.
When I now start throwin' balls, they'll be flyin' randomly in between the two lines.
That's some pretty darn sloppy throwin'.\. We won't have that here, ye hear me?
Now fact is, when ye be throwin' balls yer precision will improve over time, like this.
Then ye better \c[3]keep the aim\c[0] and \c[3]stop the darn throwin'\c[0]!
Once ye get yer lines connected, ye can throw with high precision.
See how ye \c[3]keep your precision\c[0] after throwin'?
Once ye got the lines connected ye can quickly throw as many precise balls as ye want!
But, yer precision is lost when ye \c[3]change yer aimin' direction\c[0] too quickly.
So in short: \c[3]Don't rush with the throwin'\c[0]!
First wait for a split second to get the precision.\. Then ye can throw to yer heart's content.
Ye better get it right this time around, lass.
Good, let's see if ye got the message.
Quickly hit the target-bot ten times.
Yer choice.\. Just keep in mind that good aim is essential for combat.
Carla!\. We need that turret now!
Time to turn on ol' Betty.
Next we'll be practicin' the dash.
The turret will now start shootin' at ye.
I want ye to do two things.
First, \c[3]keep yer aim\c[0] on the turret but \c[3]don't throw\c[0] anythin'.
Second, \c[3]dodge\c[0] the turret's bullets \c[3]without losin' yer aim\c[0].

desc: EventTrigger regular-shot-fail START IF map.tutorialStep = 2 && tmp.turretStarted && (!playerVar.input.aiming || playerVar.input.hits > 0)

text.en_US: Ye have to be faster than that, lass.

desc: EventTrigger regular-shot-fail START IF map.tutorialStep = 2 && tmp.turretStarted && (!playerVar.input.aiming || playerVar.input.hits > 0)

text.en_US: Don't ye even think about simply walkin' past them shots. Dash at the right moment!

desc: EventTrigger regular-shot-fail START IF map.tutorialStep = 2 && tmp.turretStarted && (!playerVar.input.aiming || playerVar.input.hits > 0)

text.en_US: Stop right there! Ye need to keep yer aim, lass.

desc: EventTrigger regular-shot-fail START IF map.tutorialStep = 2 && tmp.turretStarted && (!playerVar.input.aiming || playerVar.input.hits > 0)

text.en_US: This practice is about dodgin' without losin' focus. So keep the crosshair on yer target.

desc: EventTrigger regular-shot-fail START IF map.tutorialStep = 2 && tmp.turretStarted && (!playerVar.input.aiming || playerVar.input.hits > 0)

text.en_US: Anyway...\. ye seem to be havin' a hard time with this practice.

desc: EventTrigger regular-shot-fail START IF map.tutorialStep = 2 && tmp.turretStarted && (!playerVar.input.aiming || playerVar.input.hits > 0)

text.en_US: Remember the way ye do aimin' and dashin'.

desc: EventTrigger regular-shot-fail START IF map.tutorialStep = 2 && tmp.turretStarted && (!playerVar.input.aiming || playerVar.input.hits > 0)

text.en_US: It's possible to do both of these things at the same time.
Keep your aim and dodge 3 shots.
Move and press \i[dash] without releasing \i[aim] to dash while aiming.

desc: EventTrigger regular-shot-end START IF map.tutorialStep >= 2 && tmp.turretStarted &&  tmp.regularShots >= 3
EventTrigger regular-shot-end START IF map.tutorialStep >= 2 && tmp.turretStarted &&  tmp.regularShots >= 3

text.en_US: Enough with dodgin'. Now try to handle this attack, lass!

EventTrigger mass-shot-end START IF tmp.turretInit &&  tmp.massiveShots > 0

text.en_US: Ms. Avatar! You totally rocked that crab! That was so awesome!
But that strange blue guy was pretty amazing, too!
Did you see how he just jumped up from the water?
Not to mention how he just dragged you through the air, telepathy style!
I'm sorry to interrupt, but we need you on the bridge!\. Right now!
Something is approaching us and quickly!
Sorry lass, we have to stop here.\. Duty calls.
Carla, ye clean up the balcony first and come to the bridge afterwards.
Girl, I have no idea what's going on here, but it'd be better for you to go inside too.
What a peculiar location we have here.
It's a darn cargo ship, ye dobber!
Ye look like someone who jumped right out of CrossWorlds.
This ship is not part of the bloody playground.
So, don't be a nuisance and get lost.
We are aware of the nature of this place.
Yet we perceive the presence of another misplaced individual.
... That's none of yer bloody business!
Get off this ship and back to the game ye came from!
Foolish mortal, do you truly believe we will abide by your command?
... Did ye just call me a "mortal", ye nutcase?
Ye better leave right now or I'll be glad to tighten yer grip on reality!
You bore us.\. We choose to no longer converse with the likes of you.
Besides, our search has already been concluded.
You.\. You do not belong here.\. You need to be removed.
Wait, you seem all too familiar.
Indeed, it might be a mere coincidence!
Oh, but we most definitely have a way to be certain!
I don't even know what to say!
I mean... seriously?\. What's next?\. Cyborg sea serpents?
This is the best day, man!
In all my years on this ship, this kind of thing never happened.
This spinning motion, one cannot find it twice in this world.
Truly, there is no doubt about it!
When was the last time we have laid eyes upon you?
Yes, you have our utmost interest!\. You will come with us.
Greetings from the Solar Fist, ye pile of instant matter!
What's this? Yer divine powers can't handle a proper explosion?
Okay, lass.\. Ye need to get off this ship.\. Right NOW!
Carla!\. Get her back to the teleporter as fast as possible.
And tell me once she's off the ship.
I'll make sure no trace of CrossWorlds is left on my ship!
Dude...\. I know you're new around here, but really, ya gotta be more relaxed about all this.
What? Just because I was too quick about cleaning duty?
Well, if ya keep this up, \c[5]people will notice\c[0].
Oh hey! You're that avatar girl right?
I was just giving our newbie here a lesson.
I've been working here for 6 months!
Ya sure? Before ya know it, ya'll be cleaning da whole deck back to front every day.
Dude...\. I know you're new around here, but really, ya gotta be more relaxed about all this.
What? Just because I was too quick about cleaning duty?
Well, if ya keep this up, people will notice.
Before ya know it, ya'll be cleaning da whole deck back to front every day.
Ye darn pile of instant matter!
Stop puttin' yer trash all over the ship!
There are probably some enemies left down in the cargo hold.
Puttin' even more trash in my cargo hold?
Okay, that's it, play time is over!!
You're meddling with matters that are not of your concern...
Dobbers like you messin' with my ship are on the bloody top of my list of concerns!
I said it before, I'll say it again:
This cargo ship is not part of the bloody Playground!!
What the bloody hell was all that about?!

This tech demo is a gameplay focused excerpt of the game. 
Expect this to grow into an Action-RPG with lots of puzzle elements and a compelling story. 
That's at least the plan.
Have fun!
Oh, is the speech synchronization malfunctioning?
... Apparently. Well, something had to go wrong.
Ok. We will make it work, somehow.
You... are probably confused about this situation, correct?
Alright. Let us take small steps.
Carla? We are ready. Please initiate the training sequence.

Press \i[key-throw] to aim.
Release \i[throw] to throw.

Use \i[right-stick] to aim.
Press \i[throw] to throw.
VRPs are your most essential tool and weapon.
Your task is to hit all these robots with VRPs.

So, give it a shot!\.
Or rather...\.\.\. a throw!

You're a quite one, aren't you?
You're a quite one, aren't you?

I mean, it's not exactly the most crowded place, right?
Well, except for those robots. But those aren't nice, I tell you!
Trust me, I know from experience...
So I don't know about you, but I do feel pretty lonely around here...
So... Why don't we just chat a bit...?

Anyway, those things will not stop me. The race is still on!

ANYWAY! Race. Still on. Not gonna give up.

Good luck, Lea!
I'll be waiting at the end!

These mountains stood 
for eons nearly unchanged.

Their frozen crown 
shimmering in the sun.

Among these heights and hurdles
you stayed persistent.

Whirling the blazing flames, 
you cut through ice and stone alike.

You, the traveler, 
the envoy of change.

Take this Shade 
and continue on your journey.

Let your every step
form the path of your growth.
It all started when \c[3]Di'orbis\c[0], the ethereal god of creation, was born into the emptiness of the void.
After pondering for eons in solitude, his desire for company gave birth to the \c[3]Gods of Shape\c[0].
Di'aro is one of these gods. The God of the \c[3]Square\c[0] and the creator of \c[3]solid surface\c[0].
Di'aro is the creator of \c[3]solid surface\c[0].
His powers could form the most \c[3]majestic mountains\c[0] and \c[3]freeze\c[0] the vastest of seas.
Indeed, his creations are enduring and overwhelming sights to behold, yet motionless and without life.
\c[3]E'nel\c[0] is a Goddess of Shape, the mistress of the flame, and creator of the sun.
Yet she was envious of her fellow gods, who created fascinating shapes and worlds full of life and color.
She longed to take part, adding a warming fire to these worlds, yet her flame was too mighty and consumed all in its path.
It was then when \c[3]Di'aro\c[0] had a proposal.
He shaped a sphere with an empty core and several holes surrounded by high mountains.
E'nel filled this shape with her flame, creating a world with a heated core and life on its surface.
Today, every \c[3]volcano\c[0] is a record of \c[3]E'nel\c[0] and \c[3]Di'aro\c[0] working in union.
Life on \c[3]Shadoon\c[0] has prospered and \c[3]Di'orbis\c[0] felt that our kind was ready to start our journey.
Di'aro, however, did not agree. He still saw our kind as infants crawling over the majestic surface he created.
Di'orbis then pointed to Shadoon and asked Di'aro to watch. Di'aro saw how our kind climbed the \c[3]highest of mountains\c[0] and reached the very \c[3]bottom of the sea\c[0].
Di'aro was shocked yet proud of our achievements.  Reluctantly he agreed that indeed we had been ready to start our journey.
Di'aro then prepared an \c[3]envelope\c[0] of solid rock and ice, used to send the \c[3]Message of the Sky\c[0].
That whole dungeon was one large abyss!
The last boss was right at a cliff for Pete's sake!
Still, you made it.\. I'm so proud of you!
So...\. Let's collect the shade already.\. We clearly earned it!
They will probably do that "float in space" thing again!
I can't take that right now, please!
Seriously, what was up with that battle for the master key?!
It's like they designed this dungeon after my worst nightmares!
Oh well!\. I'll get you next time!
Phew... to be honest, it was very close.
That dungeon was much longer compared to Newcomer's Bridge, non?
Hm, but this room is strange, non?
I didn't expect to see other players within the dungeon.
I guess rooms like these are simply not instanced.
Anyway, I think we should check out this statue up there.
Alors... do you see those \c[3]rotating info thingies\c[0]?
I bet those have all the info about the Ancients we need.
Read about the Ancients in the \c[3]Temple Mine\c[0] and take the quiz at the \c[3]First Scholar HQ\c[0].

text.en_US: We should head back to the \c[3]First Scholars HQ\c[0] and take that quiz!
Solid as rock, smooth as silk.
And, did you find all the chests already?
Yeah, me too. Somebody gave me a hint, though.
There is one chest that will only appear if you do certain things in that room.
Dunno. That's all she told me. She didn't want to "spoil" the whole secret.
Alright! Second boss defeated. What did you think?
Huge. Pretty slow, though. But I loved the bomb punching!
You know you can throw balls at the bombs, right?
I don't throw balls. I punch with an extension of my fist.
Sure, whatever you want to call it.
And I cut things with swords!

Sorry, nothing seems to work.
She still doesn't respond.

I'm not sure. It's possible that
she still perceives her surroundings.

I'm... very sorry.
I tried everything.

I honestly have never encountered
an issue like this.

It's possible that her past 
experiences have led to this.

That's why... there's one 
last thing we can try.

Sure...
It's supposed to be a long parkour.
It's all about the journey, no?
Yes, apple trees all over the place.
I suppose I might as well show that place to you.
You seem to be caught up in a long dream. Maybe have a look around?

It won't be integrated into the 
official playground anytime soon.

Right... There is enough room 
to run some experiments.

Still... we got this far!
We can't just stop now, can we?

Hey, I told you this 
one isn't for everybody.

Come on, I don't want 
you to break your fingers.

Penguins on mountains. 
I'm not kidding.

I know. 
They had plenty 
of strange ideas.

Apparently that's what 
people like these days.
I know, it can be a tad lonely.
But it's a small price to pay.

After all... 
we're about to revolutionize 
the entire field!

I'm just glad 
we found somebody
who embraces the potential.

It makes you wish...\.
you could just stay in this world...

This world...\.
He gave it to me
to design as I please.

This is what I always 
dreamed about.

So why would you 
foster all these doubts?

Things are just 
fine so far, no?
This is no race against time.

I really cannot imagine
how you must feel right now.

It must feel really strange, hm? 
Seeing me like this.
That's why they told me to stay away from you.
Because I want you to feel it as well.
Hey, you kinda look like me #whathappens
Really? Alright, talk to me again if you changed your mind!
Go on, do that quest for me!
Hey, I just unlocked a Lore Entry about \v[lore.unlock.lea]\c[3]Lea\c[0]!

A rock formation!
You're filled with \c[3]Determination\c[0]

Oh! So you've met those, too...
I want to strangle the person responsible for these enemies.
By the way! The cold element is great, isn't it?
You could almost say it is.\..\..\. cool!
A-Anyway... It's refreshing to have it in this hot environment.
To be honest, I was really craving for some ice cream since we've been running through the desert.
Oh~ Ice cream really would hit the spot right now!
It's too bad you can't just summon it with one of those cold skills.
Man, how strange would that be?
I'd enjoy throwing ice cream at those laser moths and seeing them SUFFER!
Gosh... you really do hate those moths, don't you?
Very much. Anyway, let's wrap up this race.
Yes! It shouldn't be much longer.
Oui, oui! And take your time!
Wait, why a D-Link?\. Isn't this a race?
Anyway, I guess you both have already met the new foes of this dungeon, non?
I don't care about the Jellyfish, Tronny.
Moths.\. They added moths.\. And once again, they are \c[3]huge\c[0].
I hate bugs!\. And those things are close enough!
But didn't you know that moths play an important role in our ecosystem?
Pollinating flowers, food source for birds...
They are also a great indicator for the health of the environment!
To me they are only a great indicator for places I want to leave.
In conclusion: Moths suck! Race continues now!
The rough gem in the west. Home to collectors and the Shad.
Here we are, that should be the village!
So...\. how about we go ahead and visit the major building now?
You know, to continue the plot and all.
Continue the plot within \c[3]Ba'kii Kum\c[0] together with Emilie.
I mend big light panel you humans gave to Shad.
Much work but still grateful for gift.
I mend big light panel you humans gave to Shad.
Much work but still grateful for gift.
Well, I guess we head into the dungeon?
We could also do some quests. You decide.
Yeah, that was one hell of an area.
But look at this right here.
I was told this was like an urban village for these Shad or whatever.
Looks like they're pretty advanced after all. I mean this is a solar farm, right?
I think this was built by humans.
At least a friend told me there's some kind of relationship going on between humans and shad.
Oh, that makes more sense... I guess.
Helps to protect Shad and humans from hard desert.
Uhh, look at this Lea. It's a solar farm!
I read about this. It's built by the humans to help the Shad.
Anything wrong?\. I'm just sitting here.
Anything wrong?\. I'm just sitting here.
C-crimes in the bazaar?\. What are you talking about?\. I don't know anything!
So it was you on the communicator?\. Damn that Billston...
I thought someone as ruthless as him would at least be more careful.
He roped me into this, I swear!\. Told me about all the money, threatened me if I refused, all that!
"No one will care about it."\. He said. "Those scaly idiots don't know how to handle the money anyway!".\. So much for that.
Well, time to come clean then, I suppose.\. At least I can bring down that jerk with me.
Well, well, well.\. Where might you lot be going?
I knew something was wrong once I noticed my communicator missing.\. You \v[lore.title.seeker]s are a sneaky lot, hm?
Forget it, man!\. You messed up!\. This is over!
Oh, for you it is.\. Me, though?\.\. I prepared something special just for moments like this!
This will be the end of you and no one will ever know the truth!
D-dude, look where we are...\.\. this is madness!
Silence!\. These expensive preparations won't go to waste.\.\. And I'm out of here!
W-well... you know how to handle this, right?
Good... so... I'll just be hiding around that corner.\. Good luck!
Well, that certainly was something!\. But leave it to a \v[lore.title.seeker] to save the day, eh?\. Hahahaha...
Anyway, time to go on our ways, right?\.\. Bye!
What...?\. After all we've been through?\. I was a victim as much as everyone here!
... Alright, alright... I will turn myself in.\. At least it's just across the street.
I'll see myself inside.\. So... bye \v[lore.title.seeker].\. Sorry for the trouble and...\. thanks for not letting me die, I guess.
Examine the insides of the vase
Yes, hello, I'm here.\. Is that you boss?
You sound weird today, boss.\. Please don't get angry again...
I am still laying low at the Solar Farm, just as you said.\. Everything is alright, yes?
Hello?\.\. Boss?\.\. Did anything go wrong?!
Hey, \v[lore.title.seeker]!\. Hands off that vase!\. Stealing is prohibited, even for the fancy likes of you!
I have nothing to offer human... yet.
Return later, once Ancients have given you more blessings.
Oui, I like this place! Everything is so bright and colorful.
I'm... not getting on your nerves, right?
You know... I'm aware that I talk a lot...
And you're very quiet most of the time, just listening.
I just hope I'm not bothering you in that way...
Oh and I'm very much fine with you being so quiet.
You actually remind me of an old friend of mine...
Still...\. I'd really like to know more about you.
So maybe some day, if you feel like it, please tell me more about you!
Well then... I suppose I better log off now.
Well... you see, I still gotta do my part of the assignment.
And again: Merci for playing with me and listening to my rambling.
That really helped me a lot.
Don't worry, I'll hurry up with my work. I'll be back soon enough!
And don't forget about our race at the Faj'ro Temple!
Lea...\. I am sorry I cannot...
You are wondering about your \c[3]real life\c[0]...\. Correct?
I was afraid you would ask sooner or later.
I am not sure if this is the right time...
Please promise me to stay calm.
Your \c[3]real self\c[0]...\. is currently in a \c[3]coma\c[0].
You have been suffering from head trauma for several months now.
For some strange reason, it seems that you regained your consciousness within CrossWorlds.
That is...\. why we play the game, Lea.
By recovering your memory in the game we hope that you will be able to wake up in real life.
We still have everything under control, okay?
Your situation is serious, but this is no race against time.
We just have to try out everything and hope for the best.
I am sorry that I could not bring myself to tell you this earlier...
I just...\. I knew it would be difficult.
I really cannot imagine how you must feel right now.
All I can tell you is that there is hope...
So... let us not give up, okay?
Anyway, it is probably better to give you more time to cope with this.
Should we call it a day?
Pretty human!\. Bestest, funnest toys for small ones!\. Make happy and cheer!
Human \v[lore.title.seeker] do search for troublemaker on market?
Hurray!\. Trade was hard times with money and goods being stolen.
Was worried guards lose interest in case.\. Mustache guard very watchful but he also speak much to rectangle.
Yes yes!\. Weird small rectangle he sometimes talk to.\. Seem much importance to him.
Hope human find solution.\. We Shad like market and sharing our goods.
The next dungeon is going to be \c[3]Faj'ro Temple\c[0].
As members of the \c[3]Omni Gilders\c[0] we have to gather as much loot as we can.
This is what this is about?
I'm sure everyone knows how to hit stuff by now.
Sshh! This might be important, Jena!
Yes, as I said. We gotta get as much loot as we can.
Hey bro, do you think we need a damage dealer at some point?
Twin tank bros all the way.
Alright, exactly what I wanted to hear.
You ever wonder what these do?
So basically, you're as clueless as I am?
Wow, the bird guy wasn't lying. That's one big bazaar, non?
Shad try to trade as much as they can.
Sometimes, they do over-promote I guess.
What is it, \v[lore.title.seeker]?\. Can't you see that I am busy keeping order in this unruly place?
What is it, \v[lore.title.seeker]?\. Can't you see that I am busy keeping order in this unruly place?
Shad merchants being robbed, is that the story of the day again?
That is completely impossible.\. Not on my watch anyway.\. And it's always my watch during business hours!
Listen, \v[lore.title.seeker].\. I know your kind always searches for grand adventures and villains to slay.
But this is just some village ploy by them shady scaleskins to cash in on compensations.
Anyway, there is watch to keep.\. Don't waste my time, unless you can present some solid proof.
There is watch to keep.\. Don't waste my time, unless you can present some solid proof.
There is watch to keep.\. Don't waste my time, unless you can present some solid proof.
When I first arrived here, the strange beings we call \v[lore.title.shad] made me uneasy.
But soon I learned what honorable people they were beneath their scaly skin.
Nowadays I love serving in this small village.\. It is so peaceful here, compared to the larger human settlements!
Hey \v[lore.title.seeker]!\. Can I help you with anything?
Ah, you are here because of those criminal activities here on the market?
I see, so the Sergeant is finally losing his patience.\. I can't blame him.
Listen, I want this to be solved as much as he does.
The Shad are an honest and trusting folk, they don't deserve this.
Just... it always happens without anyone of us or the traders noticing.\. We are completely at a loss!
Honestly, one would think that at least Billston would notice something, that crazy workaholic.
But no, the stuff seems to just vanish without any trace.\. Unbelievable.
I hope you can find anything, \v[lore.title.seeker]!
The Shad are an honest and trusting folk, they don't deserve this.
Human!\. Got quality tableware for sale!\. Best craftworks, it much smooth!
Such shame.\. Human table have sad.
Human asking about crime on market?
It big problem!\. Goods and money vanishing from market stand.
We Shad busy selling quality crafts for fair price to happy customers, so no notice!
But bearded guard, he care very much!\. Always visiting, asking about money, food breaks and giving hints for safety!
Still things get stolen.\. He very disappoint and sad I fear.
Hope human find solution.\. We Shad like market and sharing our goods.
Human, take look over market!\. Baki Bazaar crafts are finest on Shadoon!
Also, all profit go to hardworking \v[lore.title.shad] and helping humans.
Ah, \v[lore.title.seeker], you are greeted!\. Much pleasing is felt from heroic presence.
Much useful wisdom could be learned from communication, I dare proclaim with greatest certainty.
But, as humans like saying, time is of the essential ingredient for early bird.
To honor clever statement, let us swiftly slice core of problem at our hand.
Transport with important content is long expected to arrive from \v[area.bergen.name].\. It has not.
Content very precious and important.\. Desert dangerous.\. Human following?
Excellent.\.\. Concluding, you, strong \v[lore.title.seeker], find transport and help it reach us.\. Then get reward, yes?
That good decision, smart human.\. Wealth awaits the both of us!
Search transport along main route from \v[area.bergen.name] to \v[area.heat-village.name].
Should be guarded by two employees of generous Baki Bazaar.\. Unless eaten by hungry desertlife.
If still alive, complain about delay.\. Then help delivery to continue.
If eaten... shame but business must go on.\. Return for less convenient plan B.
Human certain?\. No interest in progress of shad and humans?\. Sad.
Search transport along main route from \v[area.bergen.name] to \v[area.heat-village.name].
Also find two delivery assistants and help.\. If alive.\. If not, shame, but you return for plan B.
\v[lore.title.seeker] returned.\. So has transport.\. Our thanks are boundless.
Rewards not boundless but still big.\. Human deserve it for bringing great contribution.
The Union is of hope for grand cooperation continuing in future!
Ah, human \v[lore.title.seeker].\. Return brings great joy.
It seem that indeed nose for business is among the many talents of the \v[lore.title.seeker].
In way of any, \v[lore.title.seeker] remember important delivery and unreliable employees?
Well, forget employees, they not important now.\. But content of crate is very much.
It core ingredient for profitable venture of great benefits:\. Creating drinks of enjoyment, in way of Ancients!
Human thirst for profit express signs of starving wolf.\. This tip scales of trade in most pleasant direction.
Scales however rare in this venture, since \v[lore.title.seeker] work with other human.\. Not bad luck we hope.
You speak to human woman with red hair in the trade-building behind me.\. She very popular, hard to miss I often hear.
Contents of precious chest will already be used by woman so work can start with hastiness.
Rest will be explained in human to human meeting.\. \v[lore.title.seeker] brain absorbed procedure?
Excellent.\. Then make hurry and do progress!
\v[lore.title.seeker] not want to reap fruit of mystery chest?\. Sun done damage to curiosity of brain?
You speak to woman with red hair in Trade house.\. Easy to find, she very popular for reasons of mystery.
\v[lore.title.seeker]! Happy report of success already flew into reach.\. Splendid!
Already sight is filled with smell of sweetness and taste of ripened drink... and lush profits, not to forget.
Also brewed liquid miraculous creator of friendship and persuasion according to human myths of trade.
Yes, yes.\. This indeed might be venture of century for bazaar.\. \v[lore.title.seeker] get regal reward and thanks from heart!
Human, take look over market!\. Baki Bazaar crafts are finest on Shadoon!
Also, all profit go to hardworking \v[lore.title.shad] and helping humans.
Did you have a bad dream?
I mean, it is a good thing that you have those dreams.
After all, they are the gateway to your lost memory.
But of course, they also include the things you would rather not remember.
I assume you do not precisely remember any people or places yet, do you?
Okay.\. We just have to give it enough time.
Anyway. I thought it would be better for you to have some company today.
... after all the things I told you yesterday ...
So I planned to wait until Emilie was online, but it seems she is rather busy at the moment.
But then I noticed that this Hexacast person went online.
The one that contacted you yesterday, remember?
Why not give him a call?
Uhm...\. I hope you're doing fine?
So...\. should we start a party today?
How about we meet at the \c[3]West Entrance\c[0] Landmark, the one right to the \c[3]north of Ba'kii Kum\c[0]?
Meet \c[3]C'tron\c[0] at the \c[3]West Entrance\c[0] Landmark to the north of \c[3]Ba'kii Kum\c[0].

desc: EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800
EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800

text.en_US: It seems like Emilie is still busy with the Maroon Tree Cave.

desc: EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800

text.en_US: Well...\. I guess I'll have a look around the market.

desc: EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800
EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800
EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800
EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800
EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800
EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800
EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800

text.en_US: Hm.\. Are you looking for my friend?

desc: EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800
EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800

text.en_US: He's not here.\. I plan to meet him soon, though.

desc: EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800
EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800

text.en_US: I heard you've been dueling, hm?

desc: EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800
EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800

text.en_US: And you even managed to defeat him.\. He was impressed.

desc: EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800
EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800

text.en_US: He told me you still have much to learn. I suppose you lost that match, hm?

desc: EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800
EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800

text.en_US: What'd you expect? He's an experienced player after all.

desc: EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800

text.en_US: Anyways, he talks a lot about you. Almost makes me jealous.

desc: EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800
EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800

text.en_US: Hm.\. A girl of few words, aren't you?

desc: EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800

text.en_US: It looks like you don't appreciate his attention.

desc: EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800
EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800

text.en_US: What can I say?\. That's just him.

desc: EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800

text.en_US: Always obsessed with strangers. Especially Spheromancers.

desc: EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800
EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800

text.en_US: So you'd rather avoid him, right?

desc: EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800

text.en_US: Better leave then before he runs into you.

desc: EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800
EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800
EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800
EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800

text.en_US: Ah, there you are. I was just browsing consumables.

desc: EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800

text.en_US: It's kinda funny how they decorate it with all those fruits you actually can't buy, isn't it?

desc: EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800
EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800
EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800
EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800

text.en_US: I heard you can still count with your fingers, right?

desc: EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800
EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800
EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800
EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800
EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800
EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800

text.en_US: It's actually quite amazing how precisely they managed to synchronize your dexterity.

desc: EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800

text.en_US: That means you can move your fingers as much as you could in real life. Wanna give it a try?

desc: EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800
EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800
EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800
EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800
EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800
EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800
EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800
EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800

text.en_US: Yeah, that one isn't for everybody.

desc: EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800

text.en_US: Anyway, since you can mimic things with your hand, maybe sign language would be an option for communications?

desc: EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800
EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800

text.en_US: Well...\. I guess it'd be a bother to learn it.

desc: EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800

text.en_US: Also, I guess most other players don't know sign language either.

desc: EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800
EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800
EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800

text.en_US: We really wouldn't have this problem if they'd simply support text-based communication.

desc: EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800

text.en_US: But they removed it all. Because of "immersion".

desc: EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800

text.en_US: People have complained about this before.

desc: EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800
EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800
EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800

text.en_US: I did it!\. I defeated that red worm!\. Finally!

desc: EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800
EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800
EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800

text.en_US: But man, those worms were annoying. So hard to punch.

desc: EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800

text.en_US: I guess projectiles would have been more feasible?

desc: EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800

text.en_US: I'm a Pentafist, non? What do you think my fists are for?

desc: EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800
EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800

text.en_US: Anyway, I'll now head back to Ba'kii Kum! See you soon!

desc: EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800
EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800

text.en_US: Okey-dokey!\. Let's go back to the \c[3]quest hub\c[0], then!

desc: EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800
EventTrigger WaitingForEmilie START IF tmp.questHubFront && plot.line >= 4800
