text.en_US: I hate this cave. Way too gloomy and wet. Ruins ma suit, ya know?
We're almost there, just down this way.
This is the part of the cavern that got breached by those darn guards.
Once I move the box here, the chip will start tracking ya movement.
Your goal is to find a way to the exit south of here without a guard noticing you.
You have to do it alone. No other Seekers.
Talk to me when ya ready, capiche?
And be prepared, because I won't let ya go until ya done, woman.
Oh wait, before my dad yells at me again. Here's a \c[3]Smokaway\c[0] and some \c[3]Intel on the Guards\c[0] our men found.
Use the Smokaway when you get caught, you'll be able to run back here and I close the box, got it?
Alright, talk to me again if ya want to chicken out.
Also, don't attack the guards in any way. Don't wanna raise suspicion, right?
Use \c[3]Direct Link\c[0] to call me once you're through.
Don't waste my time woman. Get on with it already.
I see ya got some people with you. As said; ain't gonna work. Come back when you lose ya company, capiche?
I knew ya would chicken out.
Then don't stand here and find a way woman.
Mh... Oh it's you. Did ya find a way?
Finally! And it only took you one try. I'm actually impressed.
Give me a minute, I'll use the same way using the tracker chip I gave you.
Damn woman, was this really the only way?
So much walking... \.\.\. Thankfully I don't have to carry the goods. That would be just awful.
Don't give me that look, will ya?
Ya can go back to my dad with the tracker chip and get your reward.
Ya can keep the \v[item.343.name] and explore this cavern if ya want.
Also, be a good girl and make sure to tell him I helped a lot, gotcha?
I know I could count on ya. Now off you go, the rest is just a long small tunnel anyway.
You... what? Come on... at least have some mercy, will ya?
Screw it then. Off you go. I can handle the rest without you.
What are you still here for? Go to my dad with the chip already.
Thank to ya, I'm now to stand here almost all day watching the carriers bringing in the goods.
So thanks for that, really nice of ya.
I know you mean no harm, but please leave Shad alone.
You broke trust and now my people want war.
Sal'ton human. I am sorry but great eldest has forbidden to sell goods to humans.
Sal'ton human. Great eldest has allowed trade with Seekers.
I trade many sets for very few items!
I do not sell valuable goods to filthy humans.
You may help village with black creatures, but my wares still not for human hands!
Humans have broken trust of Shad. Now we avoid them.
Great thanks, but still not trust humans fully.
This is Shad trade place. But we do not trade with untruthful humans anymore.
This is Shad trade place. You helped us, so maybe traders will help you.
Once humans and Shad were friends. Now many Shad here believe humans are evil.
Village is free of black fiends.
Maybe now we can be friends again.
Many believe humans are bad after \c[3]black monsters\c[0] arrived.
I think humans just made mistake.
Grandmother, I have good news. The Wiccats are history!
This Seeker helped got rid of the infestation that befell our village.
So you work with humans against my will?
I just wish for peace between our races.
I know child, but defeating Wiccats will be no solution for long.
As long as humans poison jungle, our struggle will continue.
Still... It is great relieve that our village has been freed.
You helped Shad. For that, we are thankful. I wish your kindness was more common for your kind.
I will order Shad to free way to sacred temple.
Should your poisoning continue and Wiccats return, there will be no more compromises.
I will go to old home now. K'tara you will come too. Need to talk.
There is not much I can give you, but I have a few human credits.
I hope we can meet again! For now, it seems I have a good scolding ahead of me.
Peace brought to the people of the village.
Let us hope the major learned his lesson too.
I'm not convinced that the power plant did all this. You saw these enemies.
There might be more to this than meets the eye.
If so, we will make sure nothing disturbs the peace of the people.
I don't believe humans did wrong.
Just evil ones that came here.
I agree, we should give humans second chance.
I can not trade with you human. Great eldest has forbidden it.
Eldress allowed to trade with Seeker.
I over many metals found in jungle.
Seeker helped us get rid of cats.
Maybe Shad can live in peace with humans after all.
K'tara house is now lost thanks to \c[3]black monsters\c[0].
You helped with black creatures, thank you Human.
Yes! Probably infested jungle in purpose.
They want to take our land!
Find the \c[3]Stone Key\c[0] inside my house and bring it here.
I saw you getting rid of the \v[combat.name.minibosses/shockcat-black] from here, thanks for that!
Good. And it looks as sturdy as ever.
Now we can sneak past the guards.
But we have to take a \c[3]little Detour first\c[0].
The hidden path we need to use is outside the village.
Following the \c[3]right path\c[0] to the Grand Krys'kajo at \c[3]Clinging River\c[0] there's a small tree.
This is the northern part of the village.
As you will see, the beasts have already come this far.
These are the black cats that have taken over our village.
But these are only a few. The real threat is further ahead in the \c[3]Chief's Den\c[0].
However, there is no way the other Shad will let you through.
The villagers are dead set on shutting down the power plant. They will deny any other kind of outside help.
Yes, I know it's cumbersome. It's the same kind of stubbornness I know from a certain someone...
Anyway, that means we have to help them... in a sneaky way. And I have a plan.
You see this house over there?
This is my home. It's now overrun by those creatures, but it has a valuable treasure!
One that lets us sneak our way around the guards.
All we need is to get it. This is where you come in.
You need to go into my house and grab my old \c[3]Stone Key\c[0].
Do you think you can do that?
I leave it up to you if you want to get rid of the cats or not.
The more are gone, the happier they will be I imagine.
But they are very aggressive so be careful!
Okay, let's open these ropes so you can jump down from here.
Sadly, there is no other way in...
I'll be waiting here for you.
Good Luck and may the Krys'kajo be with you.
Move away human, great eldest has forbidden entry to old home because of \c[3]black monsters\c[0].
Look up to see what you humans did.
You brought \c[3]black monsters\c[0] into our land.
We had to give up great eldest house to keep fiends here.
This path, leads to great eldress house.
You may pass, since you helped.
Let's act quickly. If I remember correctly, the spot was somewhere here.
Eeek! I forgot how sudden it came up...
Back when I was young, me and the other younglings played here and found this.
I believe it was an old escape route build by the founders of our village.
The important part: We can now get to the Chief's Den.
Up ahead are a lot of Wiccats. And also something which I believe must be their source.
I don't know exactly where the source is, but my bet is in one of the houses.
The others told me it should be very hard to miss as it looks very much out of place.
Some kind of \c[3]glowing pole\c[0]... They believe it's an extension from that cursed powerplant.
My hope is that by getting rid of the source, we can but an end to this infestation.
Seeker, you must go in and find this source.
I'm sure that by doing so, we can calm the Shad and bring an end to the tension.
I'll wait here. Come back to me once you're done.
Seeker, you must go in and find this source.
I'm sure that by doing so, we can calm the Shad and bring an end to the tension.
I'll wait here. Come back to me once you're done.
You're back! Did you find the source of the infestation?
Where did you find it? What was it?
It was below the Chief's house? And some strange poles that summoned the Wiccats?
That really doesn't sound like something humans could do.
This is a sacred place to my people. We better not tell them that you've been there...
Well, all those Wiccats sure are gone suddenly...
This is amazing. Let's quickly go to our Eldress and tell her the news!
If she sees the cats gone, I'm certain the Shad will calm down.
She is resting in the western part of the village. There is a large tree in the middle of the lake.
Thank you again for bringing peace to our village.
Hello Seeker! It's good to see you.
No more Wiccats have infested the village.
And the Shad have calmed down.
Looks like we found the source of the infestation.
Summoning evil black cats on poor villagers. This can't stand!

desc: EventTrigger battleEnd START IF map.algo2Dead && map.algo3Dead
EventTrigger battleEnd START IF map.algo2Dead && map.algo3Dead

text.en_US: Looks like these were the last of them.

desc: EventTrigger battleEnd START IF map.algo2Dead && map.algo3Dead
EventTrigger battleEnd START IF map.algo2Dead && map.algo3Dead
EventTrigger battleEnd START IF map.algo2Dead && map.algo3Dead
EventTrigger battleEnd START IF map.algo2Dead && map.algo3Dead

text.en_US: Mh... A mystery that still needs solving?

desc: EventTrigger battleEnd START IF map.algo2Dead && map.algo3Dead

text.en_US: Let's return to that K'tara girl for now.

desc: EventTrigger battleEnd START IF map.algo2Dead && map.algo3Dead

text.en_US: Oh! My guardian senses are detecting that precious \c[3]\v[item.288.name]\c[0] in your belongings!
Don't gimme that look, lady! It's all that I'm detecting!
Anyway, you're free to enter. Good luck!
I'm sure you're dying to enter this temple here to my back, but I have to ask you to show me the \c[3]\v[item.288.name]\c[0] first.
I know it's an annoying formality, but rules are rules!
Just head to \c[3]\v[area.jungle-city.name]\c[0]. Really, it should be a breeze for you to acquire that pass over there.
A white Shad came a while back and all the Shad left.
I assume you have something to do with this?
Thanks a lot. I wouldn't know what do if this escalated...
I'll just pretend they are not here...
The path to the north leads up to the \c[3]Grand Krys'kajo\c[0].
You first need to enter the dungeons to the \c[3]left\c[0] and \c[3]right\c[0] to collect the \c[3]\v[item.231.name]\c[0] and \c[3]\v[item.286.name]\c[0].
If you've already finished those dungeons... just revisit the \c[3]boss rooms\c[0]. I'm sure you'll find the shades somewhere in there.
It looks like you're ready to enter! Better be prepared then. This is the last dungeon of Gaia's Garden.

desc: EventTrigger firstEntry START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 2200
EventTrigger firstEntry START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 2200

text.en_US: Shad will not stand down! Humans have poisoned great jungle.

desc: EventTrigger firstEntry START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 2200

text.en_US: No more! We block entrance for all to save jungle!

desc: EventTrigger firstEntry START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 2200

text.en_US: This is too much for a single guard...

desc: EventTrigger firstEntry START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 2200

text.en_US: I’m very sorry Seeker, but as you can see we have a situation here.

desc: EventTrigger firstEntry START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 2200

text.en_US: The Shad formed a wall and block the path to \c[3]Grand Krys'kajo\c[0] and its trials.

desc: EventTrigger firstEntry START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 2200
EventTrigger firstEntry START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 2200
EventTrigger firstEntry START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 2200

text.en_US: They let no one through and are clearly agitated.

desc: EventTrigger firstEntry START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 2200

text.en_US: I fear that as long as they will be this way, no Seeker can progress any further.

desc: EventTrigger firstEntry START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 2200

text.en_US: To be honest, I’m not sure what to do.

desc: EventTrigger firstEntry START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 2200
EventTrigger firstEntry START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 2200

text.en_US: Oh, you already talked with our major about this?

desc: EventTrigger firstEntry START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 2200

text.en_US: And you are trying to solve this dispute and bring peace to both races?

desc: EventTrigger firstEntry START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 2200
EventTrigger firstEntry START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 2200

text.en_US: This is great news! Please let me know if there is anything I can help you with.

desc: EventTrigger firstEntry START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 2200
EventTrigger firstEntry START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 2200
EventTrigger firstEntry START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 2200

text.en_US: What we need here is an official statement from our major.

desc: EventTrigger firstEntry START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 2200

text.en_US: I have yet to receive any instructions concerning this whole mess…

desc: EventTrigger firstEntry START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 2200
EventTrigger firstEntry START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 2200

text.en_US: Seeker, it would be a huge help if you could send word to the Major.

desc: EventTrigger firstEntry START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 2200
EventTrigger firstEntry START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 2200
EventTrigger firstEntry START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 2200

text.en_US: Thank you! I will try and hold the fort here.
Is there no way for us to find common ground?
No! Humans have broken trust with Shad.

desc: EventTrigger shadInvade START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && map.barrierOpenZone && !map.barrierOpen2
EventTrigger shadInvade START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && map.barrierOpenZone && !map.barrierOpen2
EventTrigger shadInvade START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && map.barrierOpenZone && !map.barrierOpen2
EventTrigger shadInvade START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && map.barrierOpenZone && !map.barrierOpen2
EventTrigger shadInvade START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && map.barrierOpenZone && !map.barrierOpen2
EventTrigger shadInvade START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && map.barrierOpenZone && !map.barrierOpen2
EventTrigger shadInvade START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && map.barrierOpenZone && !map.barrierOpen2
EventTrigger shadInvade START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && map.barrierOpenZone && !map.barrierOpen2
EventTrigger shadInvade START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && map.barrierOpenZone && !map.barrierOpen2
EventTrigger shadInvade START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && map.barrierOpenZone && !map.barrierOpen2
EventTrigger shadInvade START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && map.barrierOpenZone && !map.barrierOpen2

text.en_US: I'm so sorry. I could not stop them.

desc: EventTrigger shadInvade START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && map.barrierOpenZone && !map.barrierOpen2
EventTrigger shadInvade START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && map.barrierOpenZone && !map.barrierOpen2

text.en_US: The \c[3]Wiccats\c[0], they're back already! Some of my people have been attacked!

desc: EventTrigger shadInvade START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && map.barrierOpenZone && !map.barrierOpen2

text.en_US: Now they're hell bent on shutting down the power plant for real.

desc: EventTrigger shadInvade START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && map.barrierOpenZone && !map.barrierOpen2
EventTrigger shadInvade START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && map.barrierOpenZone && !map.barrierOpen2

text.en_US: Hey Tara, it's been a while. And you brought a lot of company as well!

desc: EventTrigger shadInvade START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && map.barrierOpenZone && !map.barrierOpen2
EventTrigger shadInvade START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && map.barrierOpenZone && !map.barrierOpen2
EventTrigger shadInvade START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && map.barrierOpenZone && !map.barrierOpen2
EventTrigger shadInvade START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && map.barrierOpenZone && !map.barrierOpen2

text.en_US: Let me guess, the Cats are back?

desc: EventTrigger shadInvade START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && map.barrierOpenZone && !map.barrierOpen2
EventTrigger shadInvade START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && map.barrierOpenZone && !map.barrierOpen2

text.en_US: Well, we got them too. Right at the power plant.

desc: EventTrigger shadInvade START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && map.barrierOpenZone && !map.barrierOpen2
EventTrigger shadInvade START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && map.barrierOpenZone && !map.barrierOpen2
EventTrigger shadInvade START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && map.barrierOpenZone && !map.barrierOpen2

text.en_US: I got them right where I want them!

desc: EventTrigger shadInvade START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && map.barrierOpenZone && !map.barrierOpen2

text.en_US: This is the perfect opportunity to research the heck out of these Buggers!

desc: EventTrigger shadInvade START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && map.barrierOpenZone && !map.barrierOpen2

text.en_US: To determine their source - the actual reason for their existence!

desc: EventTrigger shadInvade START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && map.barrierOpenZone && !map.barrierOpen2

text.en_US: Spoilers: It won't be the power plant.

desc: EventTrigger shadInvade START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && map.barrierOpenZone && !map.barrierOpen2

text.en_US: I wish I had your confidence...

desc: EventTrigger shadInvade START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && map.barrierOpenZone && !map.barrierOpen2

text.en_US: Oh I don't need confidence! I got science!

desc: EventTrigger shadInvade START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && map.barrierOpenZone && !map.barrierOpen2

text.en_US: Anyway Tara... Please try to keep your folks calm.

desc: EventTrigger shadInvade START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && map.barrierOpenZone && !map.barrierOpen2

text.en_US: I can't have them charge the power plant for the time being.

desc: EventTrigger shadInvade START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && map.barrierOpenZone && !map.barrierOpen2
EventTrigger shadInvade START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && map.barrierOpenZone && !map.barrierOpen2
EventTrigger shadInvade START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && map.barrierOpenZone && !map.barrierOpen2
EventTrigger shadInvade START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && map.barrierOpenZone && !map.barrierOpen2

text.en_US: You have experience in dealing with those Wiccats, correct?

desc: EventTrigger shadInvade START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && map.barrierOpenZone && !map.barrierOpen2
EventTrigger shadInvade START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && map.barrierOpenZone && !map.barrierOpen2

text.en_US: Great! Follow me this way, I need your assistance asap!

desc: EventTrigger shadInvade START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && map.barrierOpenZone && !map.barrierOpen2
EventTrigger shadInvade START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && map.barrierOpenZone && !map.barrierOpen2
EventTrigger shadInvade START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && map.barrierOpenZone && !map.barrierOpen2

text.en_US: Yeah, she's the kind that takes your assistance for granted.

desc: EventTrigger shadInvade START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && map.barrierOpenZone && !map.barrierOpen2

text.en_US: Still... this might be our only chance to resolve this conflict peacefully...

desc: EventTrigger shadInvade START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && map.barrierOpenZone && !map.barrierOpen2
EventTrigger shadInvade START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && map.barrierOpenZone && !map.barrierOpen2

text.en_US: Lou and I know each other for a long time.
Without her, I probably wouldn't have found my interest in human society.
Anyway, if she's that confident I'm sure she has a plan that will help us all.
You follow her to the power plant. I'll try and hold off my people for as long as I can.
The good Seeker, what can I do for you?
It was build pretty much at the same time we build the city.
We made sure to no interfere with the track at all.
To put it simple: The plant only absorbs energy that is naturally emitted by the temple.
Simple and clean energy. Quite brilliant if I do say so myself.
Make yourself comfortable, Seeker. This may take a while.
So...\.\.\. We know that the power plant isn't causing this problem, you know why?
Because the jungle was already "infested" when we started building the plant.
The Shad here seem to forget about that. But I understand their frustration.
Also these cats...\.\.\. \c[3]They attack on sight\c[0].
Normally sub-types of the same family follow the same patterns.
Because the jungle was already "infested" when we started building the plant.
Meaning they SHOULD behave like Shocats. But they don't.
This made me thinking: \c[3]Where have I seen this before?\c[0]
The track itself spawned these little bugs that took over our machinery and integrated it into its temple.
So... Maybe the same thing is happening here!
\c[3]Something\c[0] is controlling those cats and making them so hostile.
I studied these bugs for quite a while you know. Fascinating technology.
They used a special frequency and impulses to override systems.
Obviously I extracted both the frequency and the semi-magnetic impulse rate.
And done! This was easier then I expected.
Everything's ready! Let's head outside for the field experiment!
Please come back and report your findings once you do, okay?

desc: EventTrigger firstTime START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 3200

text.en_US: Well, well. You certainly match the description.

desc: EventTrigger firstTime START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 3200
EventTrigger firstTime START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 3200

text.en_US: Are you not the Seeker who solved the problem the Shad?

desc: EventTrigger firstTime START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 3200
EventTrigger firstTime START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 3200
EventTrigger firstTime START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 3200
EventTrigger firstTime START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 3200

text.en_US: Ah, so my calculations were indeed correct. As always.

desc: EventTrigger firstTime START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 3200

text.en_US: I'm quite thankful for that. My name is \c[3]Dr. Lou Cretia\c[0].

desc: EventTrigger firstTime START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 3200
EventTrigger firstTime START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 3200
EventTrigger firstTime START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 3200

text.en_US: Of course the Shad are a tad of in their thesis that the power plant is the root cause for this strange "infestation".

desc: EventTrigger firstTime START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 3200

text.en_US: I would know, it's my obligation to make sure of it.

desc: EventTrigger firstTime START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 3200
EventTrigger firstTime START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 3200

text.en_US: There is no leakage, no parameters off the expected spectrum.

desc: EventTrigger firstTime START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 3200

text.en_US: From the track's perspective, the plant might as well not be here!

desc: EventTrigger firstTime START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 3200

text.en_US: Obviously something else must be causing this.

desc: EventTrigger firstTime START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 3200

text.en_US: I'm not sure what exactly, but I will continue to investigate.

desc: EventTrigger firstTime START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 3200
EventTrigger firstTime START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 3200

text.en_US: Well...I'm sure you're here to enter the temple. So I won't distract you any further.

desc: EventTrigger firstTime START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 3200

text.en_US: Good luck and if there is anything you'd like to know, feel free to drop by in my office.

desc: EventTrigger firstTime START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 3200

text.en_US: It's in that building to the left!

desc: EventTrigger firstTime START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 3200
EventTrigger firstTime START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 3200
EventTrigger firstTime START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 3200
EventTrigger firstTime START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 3200
EventTrigger firstTime START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 3200

text.en_US: Polly, you do realize that they only react to Lea because she's the party leader?

desc: EventTrigger firstTime START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 3200

text.en_US: But that never happened with just the two of us!

desc: EventTrigger firstTime START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 3200
EventTrigger firstTime START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 3200
EventTrigger firstTime START IF g.storyContinuesJungle && plot.jungleQuest < 3200

text.en_US: Good. First step, let's get rid of the \c[3]cats and their source\c[0]!
You know how to deal with those, right?
Let's first get rid of these \c[3]cats and their source\c[0]!
Perfect. I took some measurements and things are behaving exactly as I expected.
You see, you might think the \c[3]\v[combat.name.minibosses/shockcat-black]\c[0] and their source are already defeated.
But in fact, we only scratched the surface of the problem!
I call this the \c[3]Frequency And Impulse Rattler\c[0] or the \c[3]FAIR\c[0].
This device is able to disrupt a rather large field around you.
Anything that uses the same frequency should get picked up by this device.
And if my calculations are correct, you should be able to see the real source of the problem!
See? I knew it! We just uncovered another hidden part of the tracks working!
See? I knew it! We just uncovered another hidden part of the tracks working!
These poles must be the \c[3]true source\c[0], controlling and spawning the cats over time!
Now that we can see them, we should be able to remove them!
Go ahead, Seeker! But be careful, these poles are the real thing. They might behave differently!
Go ahead, Seeker! But be careful, these poles are the real thing. They might behave differently!
Who would have thought the track can hide these poles in plain sight.
And it seems they form a kind of chain stretching out over a larger area.
This mechanism feels somewhat familiar, though I can't put my finger on what it does exactly.
This pole here pointed downwards, right?
So this means there are more of these, maybe they lead to a kind of root from which all these pole originated.
In which case you must find it!
Please come back and report your findings once you do, okay?
Great! I'll be in my office again, pondering on what we found so far.
Dr. Cretia told us to close of this area for now.
Dr. Cretia told us to close of this area for now.
Please ignore them for now. We'll deal with those in a bit!
We need to make sure they don't escape.
So much data... Come back to me, Seeker.
Looks like it's not over yet.
Another minute in this infested mess and I would have died of boredom.
Now come on. Let's get this over with. And stay out of my way, capiche?
Welcome to the Jungle, we got cats and plants. We got everything you want Seeker, we know the names.
Welcome to the Jungle, we got cats and plants. We got everything you want Seeker, we know the names.
I d-d-don't have any probes left, but I g-g-guess you know how they look.
I wonder if she turns up again...
At t-this point, someone might t-think you're stalking me.
It has been a while! And a-a-as usual you came in the right moment.
Another player has just p-placed a probe somewhere in t-t-t-this jungle.
Even though I had some problems earlier.
D-D-Don't worry about it... It was just a misunderstanding.
It j-j-just means I don't have much t-t-time left.
S-So would you be willing to help me surveying this area too?
T-Thank you! T-this will be the last time, I p-p-promise.
I d-d-don't have any probes left, but I g-g-guess you know how they look.
It seems we meet yet again. It must be fate.
Reports in this area have been made by dutiful players that a strange player was seen here.
One that appears as a humble player seeking help from other players.
Let me ask quite bluntly here Lady Lea...
Did you accept a quest by a player by the name of... let me see here... \.\.\. \c[3]Henry\c[0]?
Well this is quite unsettling. You are the third person to report so.
I fear we have a person with malicious intent here.
Ah, hear not Lady Lea. I do not believe you are involved in such shady business.
I must however follow procedure and file a report against this player.
Even if it is highly probable that \c[3]Henry\c[0] is just a cover name.
For now, I will manually complete the quest that has been given to you.
I will follow a lead that will bring me all the way to \c[3]\v[area.forest.name]\c[0].
May we meat again under more pleasant circumstances next time, Lady Lea. Goodbye!
This here jungle has a startlin' variety of flora.
Jes' look at this'un here. Weren't too far away I found the same plant, but open.
An' Ah found a fish inside!
Well, how's the explorin' comin' along? Y'all must be close ta done soon, Ah'd reckon.
CHEATER! CHEATER! CHEATER! CHEATER! CHEATER! CHEATER! CHEATER! CHEATER! CHEATER! CHEATER! CHEATER! CHEATER!
Oh, they added a welcome sign. Very hospitable.
Are you looking for that redhead pentafist from before?
Well... I am afraid you will not find her here.
You see, each player is placed into a separate instance of these rooms.
You will find plenty of puzzles ahead.
You really would not want other players to interfere around here.
So it is all about who will be fastest by themselves, right?

desc: EventTrigger intro OLD START IF false
EventTrigger intro OLD START IF false

text.en_US: Oh, they added a welcome sign. Very hospitable.

desc: EventTrigger intro OLD START IF false

text.en_US: Anyway, this is supposed to be the first dungeon for new players.

desc: EventTrigger intro OLD START IF false

text.en_US: It should be feasible for you. Especially after Carla's track on the cargo ship.

desc: EventTrigger intro OLD START IF false
EventTrigger intro OLD START IF false

text.en_US: Wait, I see a developer note over here.

desc: EventTrigger intro OLD START IF false

text.en_US: "Sorry, this dungeon is still incomplete. Expect more content in the next release."

desc: EventTrigger intro OLD START IF false
EventTrigger intro OLD START IF false

text.en_US: Huh. This is strange. I thought CrossWorlds was released several years ago.

desc: EventTrigger intro OLD START IF false

text.en_US: Anyway, there should be at least some puzzles to solve here.

desc: EventTrigger intro OLD START IF false
EventTrigger intro OLD START IF false

EventTrigger QUICK MENU START IF tmp.tutorialQuick

text.en_US: Press and hold \i[quick] to open the \c[3]quickmenu\c[0].

desc: EventTrigger QUICK MENU START IF tmp.tutorialQuick
EventTrigger QUICK MENU START IF tmp.tutorialQuick
EventTrigger QUICK MENU START IF tmp.tutorialQuick

text.en_US: A chest! But what is inside?
A Chest! Some yummy \c[3]\v[item.1.name]es\c[0] were inside.
A Chest! But what is inside?
Alright, Lea... I will be gone for a couple of minutes.
I will contact Jet and Carla, and try to investigate that blue individual.
I am sure you will be fine by yourself. See you later!
...I really have to work on your vocabulary.
THE TIME FOR REVENGE IS NIGH!
Complete the final dungeon of \c[3]Newcomer's Bridge\c[0].

desc: EventTrigger Equip Notification START IF map.headGet ||  map.armsGet ||  map.beltGet ||  map.feetGet

text.en_US:
Press \i[menu] to open the menu.
Select \c[3]equipment\c[0] to equip the new items.

desc: EventTrigger Wave 2 START IF map.wave1 && map.enemyCount == 10

text.en_US: Oh...\. Right. Enemies start to give EXP at this point.
Greetings from Jet and Carla.\. Everything is back to normal on the M.S. Solar.
There are no traces left of that blue individual.
I also tried to find some information about him, but there is nothing.
We can be pretty certain that he is not connected to the official game.
I just cannot imagine a regular player leaving CrossWorlds and going on a rampage like this.
Something very strange is going on here.
...\. Not to mention that he recognized you.
Your memory might, in fact, contain some answers to all of this.
Anyway, there is no need to worry about this right now.
Our goal is simply to play CrossWorlds!
And I see you made a lot of progress already!
You already reached level 3?\. That is strange.
I thought you were supposed to reach level 2 at this point.
I suppose they may have added more enemies...

desc: EventTrigger EQUIP MENU TUTORIAL START IF tmp.tutorialEquip
EventTrigger EQUIP MENU TUTORIAL START IF tmp.tutorialEquip
EventTrigger EQUIP MENU TUTORIAL START IF tmp.tutorialEquip

text.en_US: \c[3]Equip items\c[0] to prepare yourself for battle.
I have a little upgrade for you, as well!
I finally managed to add another word to your vocabulary.
Well, you know how it is.\. No shiny effects from me.\. Just the upgrade.
I think you will need this one, since I will not be able to introduce you to other people anymore.
Do not look at me like that...
I know, it takes a long time to add these words.
It is a very involved process, actually.
I need to manually extend your Thought Control Model...
...essentially modifying a statistically generated code base by hand.
The technology to control avatars is...\. well...\. complicated.
Anyway, the second word is done.\. I will work on the next one right away!

desc: EventTrigger CIRCUIT TUTORIAL START IF tmp.tutorialCircuit

text.en_US: Activate circuits using \c[3]Circuit Points (CP)\c[0], earned with each level up.

desc: EventTrigger CIRCUIT TUTORIAL START IF tmp.tutorialCircuit

text.en_US: Certain skills unlock \c[3]combat arts\c[0] that can be used in battle.

desc: EventTrigger CIRCUIT TUTORIAL START IF tmp.tutorialCircuit

text.en_US: You can \c[3]switch between branching skills\c[0] at any time without spending CP!

desc: EventTrigger CIRCUIT TUTORIAL START IF tmp.tutorialCircuit

text.en_US: You can \c[3]switch between branching skills\c[0] at any time without spending CP!

desc: EventTrigger CIRCUIT TUTORIAL START IF tmp.tutorialCircuit

text.en_US: You now got \c[3]special points\c[0] (SP) used for \c[3]combat arts\c[0].
That was fun! Can't wait to reach the mainland.
You can quickly reach all of CrossWorlds from here.
Though there should only be one destination for us newbies: \c[3]Rookie Harbor\c[0].
This is the central teleportation hub of this world.
From here you will be able to quickly travel to all locations you have reached on the mainland.
Note that new recruits will only be able to travel to \c[3]Rookie Harbor\c[0] at first.
You will visit several locations as you travel along the \c[5]Track of the Ancients\c[5].
Do you want to know more about the \c[3]Track of the Ancients\c[0]?
The \c[3]Track of the Ancients\c[0] is an ancient \c[3]assessment system\c[0] based on a highly advanced technology.
As Seekers it is your task to walk the Track and discover all the secrets it holds.
Once you reach \c[3]Rookie Harbor\c[0] you can attend the Introductory briefing to learn more about it.
Once you reach a new major location on the mainland, a connection to CrossCentral will be established for quick travel.
Huh, those poor advisor NPCs. Just explaining the same thing over and over again.
You know that those NPCs are actually artificial intelligences, right?
Yeah, it's hard to tell at the beginning, but you will notice eventually.
Their interactions with players are somewhat limited.
Man, we've come pretty far with AI research, haven't we?
Sure... yet we still have trouble passing the \c[5]Turing Test\c[0].
Hey there, can we help you?
Oh, are you wondering about the \c[3]Turing Test\c[0]?
Oh? You're a curious one, I like that!
The Turing Test is quite simple:
You have two people writing each other via text.
The twist: one of them is actually a machine.
If the actual person can tell from the conversation that the other person is a machine, you fail the Turing Test.
It's difficult, because it's not just about simulating natural language.
The machine needs to have a memory, general knowledge and many other things to properly respond like a human being would.
Oh! It's you from Newcomer's Bridge again.
Look, we're getting closer to the mainland!
If you look closely, you can already see Rookie Harbor on the horizon.
You can go ahead! Just take any of those sky rail terminals.
Ha!\. ...\. Told you I would be...\. first...
Ah, oui~\. But wasn't that fun?
I was very surprised by that boss at the end!
Um...\. Pardon.\. I didn't even introduce myself.
So...\. Are you ready to take the sky rails?
I wish we could already explore the city itself, but non~
Didn't you know?\. The sky rail will take you straight to \c[3]CrossCentral\c[0].
From there you'll be transported to the mainland.
You will only be able to enter Rhombus Square much later.
Before, you just appeared out of nowhere.\. Suspicious!
And what do I see now?
And this is unheard of.\. I'm forced to assume~
Monsieur, going straight for the accusations?
How can you be so sure about it?
Just because you are stuck at level 3 doesn't mean...
No player on record has ever reached level 4 at this point.
Young lady, surely I don't need to explain to you the faults of such actions.
Cheating will never pay off in the long run!
Is that all you have to say?
Oh dear, what is going on here?
Joern, I have exposed this cheater here.
Yes, about the wrongness of her actions!
I'll just go ahead and pretend I don't know you.
He sometimes pretends to be a moderator.\. He is not.
Young lady, I'll let you off this time.
Mon Dieu!\. What was the deal with him?
I hope we don't meet players like this around here too often.
I want to finally reach \c[3]Rookie Harbor\c[0]!
You can come with me, if you want to.
Whoa...\. My heart just stopped there for a second.\. That was close.
It is all because you collected those extra EXP from that \c[3]crab boss\c[0].
I should have noticed this earlier.\. Sorry.
From here you can take the sky rails to reach \c[3]CrossCentral\c[0].
No floor... there is no floor....
You just fly through the air... it's all transparent!
Please stay strong, just this one last time.
I'm sure things will be better once we reach the mainland.
Dear Seekers, you are now permitted to enter the \c[3]mainland of Shadoon\c[0].
You can take the sky rails from here to reach \c[3]CrossStation\c[0], our central teleportation hub.
Note that as new Seekers you are not yet permitted to enter the \c[3]city of Rhombus Square\c[0].
Such permission will be granted once you've made sufficient progress along the \c[5]Track of the Ancients\c[0].
Do you want to know more about the \c[3]Track of the Ancients\c[0]?
The \c[3]Track of the Ancients\c[0] is an ancient \c[3]assessment system\c[0] based on a highly advanced technology.
As Seekers it is your task to walk the Track and discover all the secrets it holds.
Once you reach \c[3]Rookie Harbor\c[0] you can attend the introductory briefing to learn more about it.
Those sky rail terminals will bring you to \c[3]CrossStation\c[0].
You can take any one of them, they all go to the same place.
Woah, this city looks huge! And so clean and shiny!
Yeah, and they won't let you in it until much later.
Well, in case you are wondering why I'm sitting here...
Apparently he felt sick after the last stage.
Now I have to wait here for him to come back.
Damn it, I want to go on so badly!
Aww, don't look so sorry! We're talking first world problems here.
That turret boss at the end was pretty cool, huh?
Most def! That ball streaming attack was intense, dude!
I also like how it was mostly about ranged combat.
Whatcha talking about, dude? I just went in and punched it hard!
What?\. How did you do that?\. It moved to the center of that hole in the second phase, didn't it?
Well, I just jumped on its platform and did ma punching!\. Also, some dodging.
That sounds like a risky tactic.
Well, I ain't choosing a Pentafist for no reason! Gotta punch stuff! That's ma skill, dude!
I still cannot believe what just happened on the M.S. Solar.
Anyway, we are now in the official Playground.
This area is packed with all kinds of security measures.
More interference from that blue individual is highly unlikely here.
For now, let us just proceed.
This is the official introduction to CrossWorlds.
I placed you right in front of the last part.
It is important that we do this part the official way to avoid suspicion.
It is absolutely essential that you pass as a regular player.
We must avoid being reported at any cost.
Do not worry too much about your speech synchronization issues.
You are in fact not the first player with these problems.
Most of these players here should be newcomers just like you.
Veterans usually skip this part, obviously.
C'mon, there's no need to be afraid.
You know I can't deal with heights...
It's all a game, there's no danger, y'know?
I know... It just feels so real.
Just give me some time, ok?
First a greeting and now silence? You're a strange one.
S-Sorry... that came across the wrong way.
You must be here for the view.
CrossWorlds expands over the whole land you see up there.
People call it the \c[3]Croissant\c[0]... because the island is shaped like one.
It's not my first time up here.
I usually redo the introduction phase with each character.
I just enjoy the view from here.

desc: EventTrigger EmilieCollision START IF map.southPassage ||  map.northPassage
EventTrigger EmilieCollision START IF map.southPassage ||  map.northPassage
EventTrigger EmilieCollision START IF map.southPassage ||  map.northPassage
EventTrigger EmilieCollision START IF map.southPassage ||  map.northPassage
EventTrigger EmilieCollision START IF map.southPassage ||  map.northPassage
EventTrigger EmilieCollision START IF map.southPassage ||  map.northPassage

text.en_US: Hm...\. But I have not noticed you up here before.

desc: EventTrigger EmilieCollision START IF map.southPassage ||  map.northPassage

text.en_US: Oh!\. Does this mean you caught up after me?

desc: EventTrigger EmilieCollision START IF map.southPassage ||  map.northPassage
EventTrigger EmilieCollision START IF map.southPassage ||  map.northPassage
EventTrigger EmilieCollision START IF map.southPassage ||  map.northPassage

text.en_US: Huh!\. You must be very quick with the tutorials!

desc: EventTrigger EmilieCollision START IF map.southPassage ||  map.northPassage

text.en_US: But I got the hang of it now, too.

desc: EventTrigger EmilieCollision START IF map.southPassage ||  map.northPassage

text.en_US: You will not beat me on the last tutorial stage, non!

desc: EventTrigger EmilieCollision START IF map.southPassage ||  map.northPassage

text.en_US: Let's meet at the end.\. I will be waiting!

desc: EventTrigger EmilieCollision START IF map.southPassage ||  map.northPassage
EventTrigger EmilieCollision START IF map.southPassage ||  map.northPassage
EventTrigger EmilieCollision START IF map.southPassage ||  map.northPassage
EventTrigger EmilieCollision START IF map.southPassage ||  map.northPassage

text.en_US: Dear \c[3]Seekers\c[0], you're about to enter the final stage of Newcomer's Bridge.
You will be confronted with a multitude of puzzle and combat situations.
Make use of all the skills you learned in the previous stages!
Expect your skillset to be further expanded over the course of the final stage.
As a reward for passing Newcomer's Bridge you will be granted access to the mainland.
Please step on the red teleport panel to enter the final stage.
Dang, I can barely see a thing!
"You should totally choose a short avatar", they said.
You're on the same page, huh?
Congratulations on passing the third stage of Newcomer's Bridge!
You have just arrived at the final waiting area.
You can take a break here and enjoy the view.
Once you are ready, proceed to the teleporter at the other end of this area to enter the final stage!
Yeah, good thing they added those laser railings!
The best type of laser there is.
Ocean as far as the eye can see.
Huh... now that we're on this distant moon...
It makes you wonder what kind of sea life you'd find down there.
Hell yeah! You think we can just jump down into the water with our avatars and explore?
More like "explode"... I heard avatars are not all that water resistant.
One step at a time, Carla.
Lea, do you remember the concept of an MMO?
Well, MMO stands for "Massively Multiplayer Online".
It is a term for video games that support a large number of players simultaneously.
Usually, all these players are connected to a virtual environment from all around the world.
Now, CrossWorlds is like an MMO, just with one striking difference.
The world of this game is not virtual.\. It is real.
All players are remotely connected to this world through special avatars.
These avatars have a physical form and are tightly connected to all 5 senses of the player.
And you, Lea, are currently logged into this game as well.
Oh, me?\. No, I'm not a player.\. I just work here!
In fact, you're the only avatar on this whole ship.
That is correct.\. This cargo ship belongs to the maintenance staff of CrossWorlds.
The actual game takes place in the land you see over there - the Playground.
The reason you are here, Lea, is because you are not a regular player.
You have lost your memory and we are trying to recover it.
You see, you have been in this game before.
Being logged into this game, there is a chance you might remember your past.
And that is why we will try to get you into the real Playground soon.
Yeah, in fact you'll be going to that glass palace of a city over there!
That's Rhombus Square. It's where all players start.
Hey Lea!\. Please don't just run off like that, d'accord?\. We're over here!
Hoi!\.\. We're not set up yet, but we're giving it our all to deliver the bestest foods as soon as we can!
Come back later, yeah?!\. It will be amazing, just you watch!
Ah, hello.\. I'm sorry, but we haven't properly prepared our shop yet.
Please visit us later to get a taste of our high-quality foods.
Sorry \v[lore.title.seeker], but this shop isn't ready yet.
Come back later if you want to get some revitalizing tea.
Did you know that these treasure chests are instanced for each player?
Oh well... it means I opened this treasure chest myself before.
The content is replicated for each player.
That's cool, right? No more annoying empty chests because some random player reached it before you!
Yeah.... anyway, gotta meet my friends at the entrance.
Heh, you reached this spot. Not bad!
No reason to hold back. Go claim your prize!
I wanna go through the market later~
Also,I wanna take a bath in that fountain, naked.

If you put water into a fountain...
It becomes the fountain.
You just jumped into the fountain, didn't you?
That's not how you become water, my friend.
What is it? You learned the \c[3]Wave\c[0] element?
Wave doesn't make you water, my friend.
Clearly waves are merely an aspect of water, as it is of sound and more.
Really...\. What even is wave? Such nonsense.
Water is what you need to be.\. Water and only water.
Could I interest you in some cool and delicious ice cream?
Well... unfortunately we are out of stock right now.
But, if you bring me some \c[3]fresh ice from Bergen Trail\c[0], I could quickly produce new ice cream.
So... could you bring me some \c[3]Bergen Ice\c[0]? About \c[3]5\c[0] should suffice.
You can find \c[3]Bergen Ice\c[0] in the snowy parts of \c[3]Bergen Trail\c[0].\. Just continue to the west until you reach the mountain area.
Did they seriously ask you to fetch ice from a distant mountain?
What is this, the middle ages?
Oh, that's too bad. Maybe another time!
Hm... it seems you don't have enough \c[3]Bergen Ice\c[0] yet. I need about \c[3]5 pieces\c[0].
You can find \c[3]Bergen Ice\c[0] in the snowy parts of \c[3]Bergen Trail\c[0]. Just continue to the west until you reach the mountain area.
Oh, you brought me the \c[3]Bergen Ice\c[0]! Thank you so much!
And here's your ice cream! Don't eat it all at once, it might make your head hurt!
You know what? They could have declared "Bergen Ice" a speciality.
That would explain why you would have to go so far just to fetch it.
People perform all kinds of elaborate tasks, because it is a speciality, do they not?
Well, nevermind. I am not a game designer.
Ice cream sure sells quickly when the weather is right.
I'm sorry, the northern part is currently under construction.
It will open up to the public with the next content update!
Sorry, the northern part of the town is blocked due to construction.
It will be open again in a future update!
I'm really looking forward to the next content patch.
I heard rumors about a black market!
By the way, does it make sense to call it a "patch"?
I mean it's not just code. They're doing actual construction work over there.
It's just a habit from old virtual MMOs. Don't overthink it.
Yeah. I'm also still waiting for that kitchen patch.
My sink is broken. Landlord's gotta patch that!
Stop it, you're making my brain hurt.
Where are you going Lea?\. We're over here!
Hmpf, didn't your father tell you not to startle people?
Kids these days, don't know their manners!
Now now, don't be sad, young lady.
At least you look like you are actually sorry.
I think I like your attitude.
Look, if you want to make up for startling me, why not help me out?
Now don't look at me like that. It's not hard at all. All I want you to do is find me a \c[3]Broken Chakram\c[0]. Simple enough, right?
Very good. Someone told me it was hidden in \c[3]\v[area.autumn-area.name]\c[0].
Apparently there is an area where you have to defeat lots of \c[3]\v[combat.name.hedgehog]s\c[0] while it's raining.
Do you think you can find it?
Good to hear! But don't keep me waiting alright?
What? Young lady, I expected more of you!
But, I'll give you another chance, so come back when you are ready to redeem yourself.
Aha! Look who's back. Are you ready to help me now, young lady?
Very good. Someone told me it was hidden in \c[3]\v[area.autumn-area.name]\c[0].
Apparently there is an area where you have to defeat lots of \c[3]\v[combat.name.hedgehog]s\c[0] while it's raining.
Do you think you can find it?
Good to hear! But don't keep me waiting alright?
What? Still nothing? My patience has its limits!
Welcome back young lady. Did you find the \c[3]Broken Chakram\c[0] yet?
Oh, that's unfortunate. I do hope you find it.
Some player told me it was hidden in \c[3]\v[area.autumn-area.name]\c[0].
Apparently there is an area where you have to defeat lots of \c[3]\v[combat.name.hedgehog]s\c[0] while it's raining.
Welcome back young lady. Did you find the \c[3]Broken Chakram\c[0] yet?
I knew I could count on you.
Such a fine young lady with expert listening skills.
Thanks a lot. I even have a little something for you as a reward!
Oh, I never asked you for your name!
Well, I'm not good with long goodbyes, so let's keep this one short.
That man just now... \.\.\. He looked like he was wearing gear from each class.
Normally that should not be possible. I wonder how he managed to sneak this past the developers.
I really love all these gifts, but I sure would like to know where they're coming from.
Alright, I don't know what you mean.
Just forget I asked. I'll find out myself.
Alright, next stop, the town center!
Oh, is that a market over there?
Yap!\. You'll find most of the \c[3]traders\c[0] around here.
...Well, they're all over the place to be frank.
The catch: you first need to collect all the \c[3]required trade items\c[0] in the wild.
It takes time, but it's worth it.
Further up is another important building.
Surprise, you'll find a lot of \c[3]quests\c[0] there!
... Just like in many other places in town and elsewhere.
All those quests are optional, but the rewards usually make it worthwhile.
Hey Lea, are you still with us?
But she was really fast at the tutorial, almost beat me to it!
Well like they say -\. still waters run deep, right?
Oui, oui.\. What about that main quest?
They kept talking about the \c[3]Track of the Ancients\c[0].
Oh right, I almost forgot about that.
You'll have to enter the Quest Hub, anyway.
There is a mandatory introduction for all new players.
They'll explain all about it there.
I suggest you go in right away and just get it over with.
Listen to the \c[3]Mandatory Introduction\c[0] inside the \c[3]Quest Hub\c[0] of Rookie Harbor. It's mandatory.

desc: EventTrigger SchneiderPostExpo START IF tmp.centerEntered && plot.line >= 2560

text.en_US: So, how was it, Lea?\. Enjoyed being in Space?

desc: EventTrigger SchneiderPostExpo START IF tmp.centerEntered && plot.line >= 2560
EventTrigger SchneiderPostExpo START IF tmp.centerEntered && plot.line >= 2560

text.en_US: Well, now you should understand your task, being part of Track Walker and all.

desc: EventTrigger SchneiderPostExpo START IF tmp.centerEntered && plot.line >= 2560
EventTrigger SchneiderPostExpo START IF tmp.centerEntered && plot.line >= 2560

text.en_US: By the way, Lea.\. Spheromancer?\. That's surprising.

desc: EventTrigger SchneiderPostExpo START IF tmp.centerEntered && plot.line >= 2560
EventTrigger SchneiderPostExpo START IF tmp.centerEntered && plot.line >= 2560

text.en_US: They're pretty unpopular.\. Don't ask me why - they're fine balance wise.

desc: EventTrigger SchneiderPostExpo START IF tmp.centerEntered && plot.line >= 2560

text.en_US: What about Pentafist?\. They're awesome, right?

desc: EventTrigger SchneiderPostExpo START IF tmp.centerEntered && plot.line >= 2560

text.en_US: Jepp!\. And I couldn't imagine you in any other class.
Greetings, \v[lore.title.seeker]. I have to keep watch on the market and protect our citizens, so please excuse me.
Good day, \v[lore.title.seeker].\. Are you the reinforcements I was promised?
Finally!\. We got some really pesky thieves at the markets lately, stealing from both the stands and customers.
I just saw one committing theft at the stands but he was gone before I could catch him.
I have to remain here and keep watch, so it's up to you to catch him, understand?
Great. I saw him running towards the small park in the southeast, so go and get that crook!
The thief should be in the small park in the southeast, so go and get him!
Damn, I saw that he got away from you.\. What the hell happened there?
Well, what's done is done.\. I saw him running southwest to a dead-end alley by the sea.
Make sure to catch him this time!
I saw him running southwest to a dead-end alley by the sea.
Make sure to catch him this time!
He escaped again?! You've got to finally nail him down, before we become a laughingstock!
I put that scoundrel behind bars, thanks to you!\. You better report back to Sgt. Brassler now.
Good to see you again, \v[lore.title.seeker]. The market has been rather quiet since we nailed that pickpocket.
Ahh!\. What... what do you want from me?
I...\. I see.\. So you want to arrest me for my crimes?
Alright, it was only a matter of time.\. But I just had to earn money somehow for...\. for...\. here let me show you...
That mean scoundrel ran past here!\. You must have given him a solid spanking, good job!
Still not satisfied?\. Well, he ran towards \c[3]\v[area.autumn-area.name]\c[0] if you wanna whip him some more.
Young people these days... no manners, I tell you.
Young people these days have no manners.
Running through the streets \c[5]like they're fleeing from the police\c[0] without regard for others.
Hello, young lady.\. Did you also see that unkempt ruffian running through the street like a madman?
He was stinking of smoke and looked very suspicious, I tell you!
I saw him running to the southwest to a dead end by the sea if you wanna teach him a lesson.
All this buzzing in the town...
Back in my day everything was better.
Oh boy, here we go again.
People were nicer, greeting you on the street and everything.
Even the \c[5]name of this damn city\c[0] was better.
See? Look at that Seeker just staring at me, like I'm some decorative prop.
Ignore him. He just doesn't like it when things change.
You're damn right! \v[lore.unlock.rookie-harbor.Page-02-01]\c[3]Port Harbor\c[0] was such a nice name for this town.
But they changed it because of all the Seekers starting their journey here.
My only real solace is that I can still enjoy my fish with fresh apples.
I can't stand all these Seekers buzzing around.
Please excuse me, I've got calls to do.
Ah, good day.\. I appreciate your desire to work for us, but you should get your official faction-briefing in \c[3]\v[lore.title.seeker]-Central\c[0] first.
It is on the ground floor of this huge building here.
Ah, it is you again.\. Are you interested in assisting me now?
It's a deal then.\. My client requires \c[3]two Fruit and Veggie Sets each\c[0] and also a precious \c[3]Spice Set\c[0] to boot.
You can procure them right here on the central market near the fountain.
For the exchange, you will need raw trading materials from the various plants of \v[area.autumn-area.name].
That is unfortunate.\. But you can change your mind as long as the job is still for the taking.
You can get all the required goods on the central market near the fountain.
For the exchange you will need raw trading materials from the various plants of \v[area.autumn-area.name].
I see you managed to get everything.\. Quickly, go to the \c[3]Pub at the Beginner's Arc\c[0] and give it to the barkeep.
I've already gotten the message from our satisfied customer.\. Good job!
Here is your payment.\. I hope I can count on your future assistance.
Oh my, oh my, oh my!
Ah, there you are again.\. I'm currently facing a high priority problem and it is giving me quite the headache.
You see, I am waiting for an urgent delivery of fresh ingredients from one of our contracted food collectors.
An important business lunch will be ruined if she doesn't show up soon!
Yes, thank you for asking.\. It would indeed be very helpful if you could lend me a hand again and keep your eyes open for our collector.
She should be somewhere in Autumn's Rise.\. Could you try to find her and examine what happened?
Excellent! I am expecting swift results.
Hrm, it can't be helped then.\. Please come back if you change your mind, this is no joke matter!
Please concentrate on your task at hand.\. Time is of the essence here!
Ah, there you are. I've already received the package. Well done!
This could finally mean a breakthrough for my career, I can feel it in my gut!\. Along with a burning hunger for nutritions.
In any case, here is your due reward.
By Jove!\. This is your big chance, Philamore.\. All you need to do is find the right...
Ah, it is you again!\. I say, you truly find the most opportune times to accost me.
I have another task for you.\. And this time the main headquarters are involved.\. Truly, a huge opportunity!
So please lend me your assistance!
Oh, what a relief, to hear that from one as reliable as yourself.\. Now the road to success shall be smoothly paved.
I any case, I cannot tell you much about the mission itself.\. My task was simply to acquire an able helper.
So please go to the very North of the \c[3]Alley Quarters\c[0] and enter the \c[3]Traders Kontor\c[0].
Then go upstairs to talk to the high board.\. I will announce your arrival and task so you can enter.
And please, give the board my warmest of regards.\. They will surely appreciate it.
Oh no, what a dilemma.\. Please rethink your decision, there is so much on the line!
Head to the very North of the \c[3]Alley Quarters\c[0], enter the \c[3]Traders Kontor\c[0] and go \c[3]upstairs\c[0].
Please be very professional when talking to the board.\. This is a crucial step in both of our careers.
\v[lore.title.seeker], let me thank you again for your splendid work with the headquarters.
The chairman thanked me most sincerely.\. My promotion is just around the corner, I can almost smell it!
Ah, good day, \v[lore.title.seeker].\. Pleased to meet you.
My name is Mr. Nomsworth and I am a humble mediative employee of the local trading association.
Now, as you might've already assumed, a man of my position is always busy brokering business agreements big and small.
Thus, there's always a need for helping hands willing to do some necessary legwork.\. For a generous payment of course.
Just now I have an unresolved assignment by the Pub for a delivery of mixed food ingredients.
It requires collecting raw materials in the wild, trading them for the required items here in the market and of course delivering them to my client.
A rather simple task, fitting for the beginning of a lucrative relationship, I would say.\. Can I count on your cooperation?
It's a deal then.\. My client requires \c[3]two Fruit and Veggie Sets each\c[0] and also a precious \c[3]Spice Set\c[0] to boot.
You can procure them right here on the central market near the fountain.
For the exchange, you will need raw trading materials from the various plants of \v[area.autumn-area.name].
That is unfortunate.\. But you can change your mind as long as the job is still for the taking.
Hello, Lea! It's good to see you again.
Oui, you almost made me worried!
Now I really wonder what happened with you~
I guess I should start poking you with questions now!
Come on, Emilie. I'm sure that would be bothersome.
Anyway, I want to show you something! This way!
They finally opened the \c[3]North of Rookie Harbor\c[0]!
Yes, and you can find even more traders up there!
Also, the stores now offer \c[3]better equipment\c[0], since we've beaten Faj'ro Temple.
Oui! And you better make sure to upgrade!
Because here comes the big news!
Oui! I can hardly believe it myself.
They found a raid event where players of our level can participate!
That means we'll be fighting together with Lukas, Lin and the others!
...Well, kind of. There will be two tracks with two teams running in parallel.
Anyway, the raid is happening tomorrow. You showed up just in time!
You still didn't collect that shade, right?
It's one of the prerequisites to join the raid.\. You first need to collect the \c[3]Green Seed Shade\c[3].
You find it in \c[3]Autumn's Fall\c[0]. That's to the north of Rookie Harbor. Just take the exit in \c[3]Rookie Harbor East\c[3].
That's right, just look for the \c[3]glowing bird statue\c[0]. You can't miss it!
Anyway, C'tron and I already did the quest... But I'm fine doing it again with you, if you want.
Same for me! Do you want us to join?
Ah, I see...\. well that's ok! We may just spoil the surprise for you, right?
Ah oui...\. Anyway, please tell us when you collected the Shade!
Just contact me quickly via D-Link!
Enter \c[3]Autumn's Fall\c[0] via the exit in \c[3]Rookie Harbor East\c[0] and find the \c[3]statue\c[0]. It has a quest for you.
Hey you, are you interested in something real special?
The five Virtues mirror the foundation on which the Ancients' culture was built. Before a participant can begin the Track of the Ancients they must choose a virtue as part of their \c[3]Class\c[0].

\c[3]Triangle: The Virtue of Strength. \c[0]
Usually associated with the Element Heat.

\c[3]Square: The Virtue of Endurance. \c[0]
Usually associated with the Element Cold.

\c[3]Pentagon: The Virtue of Agility. \c[0]
Usually associated with the Element Shock.

\c[3]Hexagon: The Virtue of Wisdom. \c[0]
Usually associated with the Element Wave.

\c[3]Circle: The Virtue of Balance. \c[0]
This Virtue is not specifically associated with any elements and instead opts to balance each element.
Obtaining each element in turn is the only way, as far as we know, of unlocking the mystery of the Ancients.
Humankind found the moon Shadoon 30 years ago.
At first we tried to harvest the moon for its precious resources. We built mines, uncovered ruins, and drilled into the ground.
While doing so, we also destroyed part of the Track of the Ancients. This activated the self-defense program of the self-sufficient system that keeps the Track intact.
After this it became almost impossible to harvest any more resources as the Track itself fought back. We became aware of the finesse with which this system was built.
The Goal of Operation Track Walker is to \c[3]research the Ancient Technology instead of destroying it\c[0].
We began to look for ways to be part of the Track itself, to have humans participate. To our surprise integrating ourselves into the system was easy.
We were even able to augment the Track to make it possible for humans, or \c[3]Seekers\c[0] as we now call them, to choose one of the five virtues and collect the four elements.
What happens when all four elements are collected and brought to the center temple in Shadoon is still unknown to us.
Even after 10 years of Operation Track Walker not a single Seeker has managed to overcome the final challenge.
All we can guess is that the Ancients left their vast knowledge base for their descendants to find, as some legends and artifacts we've uncovered seem to indicate.
Rhombus Square is the capital of humankind on Shadoon. Seekers start their journey in a custom course simulating challenges on the Ancient's Track.
However, in order for a Seeker to gain access to the city, they must first collect all four elements on the Track of the Ancients.
Every Seeker must collect the four elements, which are scattered all throughout Shadoon. Each one of them gives the Seeker control over a specific elemental domain.
These elements are \c[3]Heat\c[0], \c[3]Cold\c[0], \c[3]Shock\c[0], and \c[3]Wave\c[0]. This enumeration also reflects the order in which the elements are usually collected.
The Track of the Ancients is a lengthy trial of agility, intelligence, and strength, which played a large role in the Ancients' Society.
It is a self-sufficient system in which a challenger selects one of \c[3]five Virtues\c[0] to collect four distinct \c[3]Elements\c[0].
Even now, after 10000 years this system is still intact and active.
The Ancients were a highly advanced humanoid society which lived on Shadoon approximately 10000 years ago.
For unknown reasons they left this planet. Only a few native tribes remained.
The descendants of these tribes are known to us as the \c[3]Shads\c[0].

desc: EventTrigger ExpositionStart START IF tmp.theZone && plot.line >= 2556

text.en_US: Suddenly I was in the middle of space and this old geezer kept talking to me.
I suppose they wanted to pep up the boring introduction, non?
Oui, oui! \c[3]Track of the Ancients\c[0] it is!
Let's go back.\. Lukas is waiting.
By the way, Lea.\. I took the liberty of adding a few more entries to your \c[3]encyclopedia\c[0].
For example... all past events and people we have met so far.
And a few insights on the technology, of course.
What?\. I just like to organize things.
Meet up again with \c[3]Schneider\c[0] and \c[3]Emilie\c[0] to continue your tour through Rookie Harbor.
In this room you can read more about the history of \v[lore.title.planet] and \v[lore.title.operation-trackwalker].
Welcome.\. This is the hunting counter, where we hand out quests to defeat monsters.
You have finished the first group of quests.\. There are more quests available now.
I am sorry but there are no more Hunting Quests we can offer you at the moment.
Welcome.\. This is the collection counter, where we hand out quests to collect materials.
You have finished the first group of quests.\. There are more quests available now.
I am sorry but there are no more Collection Quests we can offer you at the moment.
