text.en_US: I am sorry but there are no more Hunting Quests we can offer you at the moment.
I am sorry but there are no more Collection Quests we can offer you at the moment.
Large parts of Humankind are organized into the \c[3]4 big factions\c[0].
Each of them are responsible for different aspects of human civilization, all of them crucial for survival and prosperity.
The main headquarters of the factions are located in \v[area.rhombus-sqr.name] but every human settlement harbors one \c[3]local subdivision\c[0] for each of them.

The \c[3]Venture Alliance\c[0] is mainly responsible for doing pioneer work by exploring and claiming new land, hunting and scavenging wildlife and mining natural resources.
It is represented in \v[area.rookie-harbor.name] by the \c[3]Falldivers\c[0].

The \c[3]Human Preservation Department\c[0] is mainly responsible for the protection and discipline of the human settlements on \v[lore.title.planet].
It is represented in \v[area.rookie-harbor.name] by the \c[3]Rookie Harbor Guard\c[0].

The \c[3]Association of Human Advancement\c[0] is mainly responsible for trade, manufacturing and scientific research.
It is represented in \v[area.rookie-harbor.name] by the \c[3]Coastal Trading Coalition\c[0].

The \c[3]Amity of Balance\c[0] is mainly responsible for farming, gathering and the research of native life and gaining an understanding of the inner workings of the \v[lore.title.track-of-ancients].
It is represented in \v[area.rookie-harbor.name] by the \c[3]Fruits of Autumn\c[0].

While the factions are filled with highly resourceful experts of their field, they often need the support of the \c[3]\v[lore.title.seeker]s\c[0] because of their special connection to the \c[3]\v[lore.title.track-of-ancients]\c[0].
Greetings, \v[lore.title.seeker].\. We should talk after you have gotten your briefing upstairs.
Greetings, \v[lore.title.seeker]. I see that you have completed the introduction to \v[lore.title.operation-trackwalker].
Thus you are now also qualified to use your abilities as a \v[lore.title.seeker] to assist the \c[3]4 factions\c[0] in their duties.
They are organizations that secure humanity's survival and prosperity through their special fields of expertise.
More detailed information can be accessed in the terminal behind you.
For now you should know that each faction has a subdivision in \v[area.rookie-harbor.name], like in every settlement.
To better understand our society and your place in it, you should get introduced to all of them.
For this purpose I will now issue an official assignment.\. Please accept.
Good.\. Visit the representative of every faction in \v[area.autumn-area.name] and introduce yourself.
Most of them can be found in their respective headquarters \c[3]near the market or the western entrance\c[0].
Though the HQ of the CTC is still inaccessible to new \v[lore.title.seeker]s, but their ambassador can be found \c[3]just outside this building\c[0].
Once you have visited all of them, return to me to get your reward.
Visit the representative of every faction in \v[area.autumn-area.name] and introduce yourself.
Most of them can be found in their respective headquarters near the market or the western entrance.
Though the HQ of the CTC is still inaccessible to new \v[lore.title.seeker]s, so their ambassador can be found just outside this building.
Once you have visited all of them, return to me to get your reward.
You have visited all of the factions in \v[area.rookie-harbor.name]. Excellent.
I hope you now understand how you can help humanity, besides solving the \v[lore.title.track-of-ancients].
And remember that they might have new tasks available for you as time goes on.
So you should return and offer your help as you progress further.
But for now take these rewards as a gesture from the \v[lore.title.human-government].
Remember that all factions might have new tasks available for you as time goes on.
So you should return to offer your help as you progress.
That's such a cute little cactus~
Look! I think it's starting to blossom!
Do you really have to sit on the table to watch it?
You already said that 5 minutes ago!
Blame that messed up search interface.
What you see here is the \c[3]Bulletin Board\c[0]. You can use it to see \c[3]open quests of this area\c[0].
If you want to know more about quests, I suggest you talk to the fellow advisors at the counter over there.
All new recruits, please go to the \c[3]upper floor\c[0] for the introductory briefing.
Greetings, \v[lore.title.seeker].\. We should talk after you have gotten your briefing upstairs.
Greetings, \v[lore.title.seeker]. I see that you have completed the introduction to \v[lore.title.operation-trackwalker].
To become the best \c[3]Seeker\c[0] you can be, we host a famous Teacher here in Rookie Harbor: \c[3]Master Sensei\c[0].
He can teach you everything you need to know and more. Please accept this quest and meet him in the \c[3]Rookie Harbor - Info Hub\c[0].
Good.\. Thank you for your support in our ambition.
I see, please return if you changed your mind.
Find \c[3]Master Sensei\c[0] in \c[3]Rookie Harbor - Info Hub\c[0].
Congratulations on mastering your Seeker abilities with Master Sensei.
Sorry, lady, but no entry for you.
We're currently investigating a rather unpleasant animal incident here.
EVERYTHING IS OKAY! PLEASE ENJOY YOUR DAY!
I really wonder what's behind those boxes...
Wow, that's quite the view. Didn't expect this.
You can say that again. Look! You can even see all these weird ruins.
Small lass try'n to get in a secret club, aye?
Sorry litt'l one, not gonna pass 'til some's gonna vouch for ya.
I like this spot, always calms me down.
I see you got the \c[3]\v[item.230.name]\c[0] with you! Nice, nice!
Well then, good luck on your journey!
If you want to pass the barrier up ahead you first have to collect the \c[3]\v[item.230.name]\c[0].
You get it at the end of the \c[3]Faj'ro Temple\c[0], right after the boss battle.
Can thee not seeth yond I ponder?
This briefing serves as an introduction to the history of this place and the nature of our cause.
We're currently located on the natural satellite \c[3]Shadoon\c[0].
This place was once inhabited by an intelligent lifeform we refer to as the \c[3]Ancients\c[0].
While the Ancients ceased to exist a long time ago, they left behind a technological heritage to behold:
Originally, it served as an assessment of social standing within the Ancients' culture.
It is a technological marvel, a highly-advanced and self-sufficient system that remains intact to this day.
It wasn't long after humankind arrived on Shadoon that we realized its value.
We augmented the Track so that humanity might walk it as well.
And that is where you come in, new recruit.
Together with the other Seekers you will start the journey along the Track of the Ancients.
Your path will be paved with obstacles, but every step you take will further our cause:
Your main task will be the collection of four elements: \c[3]Heat, Cold, Shock and Wave\c[0].
Beginning with the element \c[3]Heat\c[0], your first destination will be the village of \c[3]Bergen\c[0].
To reach it, you need to pass the \c[3]western barrier\c[0] of Rookie Harbor.
I will now give you your first \c[3]Shade\c[0] to grant you passage to the west.
Finally, I will give you the \c[3]Disc of Insight\c[0].
This device will record all of the knowledge you encounter on your journey.
We offer higher quality equipment made in Rookie Harbor!
Yes, yes, this interior design might seem familiar to you, but it really is the details that make the difference.
Also we are currently remodelling.\. So, you buying or what?
We offer higher quality equipment made in Rookie Harbor!
Hello \v[lore.title.seeker]. Welcome to the headquarters of the \c[3]Fruits of Autumn\c[0].
If you are interested in advancing humanity's understanding of this moon, talk to the Chief Woodkeeper.
He should currently be studying the local plantlife in our gardens.
Greetings, \v[lore.title.seeker].\. The Track is in harmony right now, so there is no need for your assistance.
Welcome to our humble garden, \v[lore.title.seeker].\. I appreciate your interest in our work, but you should visit \c[3]\v[lore.title.seeker]-Central\c[0] first.
On the ground floor is an introduction into the different branches of the great tree that is human civilization.
It is mandatory for receiving assignments from us or any other branch in \v[area.rookie-harbor.name].
Ah, \v[lore.title.seeker]. I am glad to see you return to us.
Do you desire to help us in our plight now?
Excellent. I will give you some bottles, filled with concentrated and fermented juice made from the fruits of our garden.
It has proven in the past to have a beneficial effect on the self-regulatory instincts of the Track.
Use \c[3]your instincts as a \v[lore.title.seeker]\c[0] to find the afflicted trees and treat them with the extract.
It should suffice to cure the trees at this stage.\. Take care, young \v[lore.title.seeker]!
I understand that your life is a restless one, but I still implore you to not take this matter lightly.
Please make haste, before the sickness spreads and endangers the stability of the entire Track.
Ah, you are done. Wonderful!\. Your effort should have quenched the threat to \v[area.autumn-area.name].
You have our deepest thanks.\. May we continue to preserve the harmony on this moon together.
Greetings, \v[lore.title.seeker]. It is good to see you return to us.
As it happens, the well-being of our precious nature requires our attention once again.
Another case of the sickness has been observed in \v[area.autumn-area.name], this time in a more intense form.
Worse yet, it has stricken a sacred tree that has been proven to be vital to the ecosystem of the entire area.
I fear that healing it will be more arduous than with the other cases, but it must be done at all costs.
So, can I ask you for your assistance once again?
Excellent. I will give you a cup, filled with a highly concentrated salve made from the fruits of our gardens.
With it you can treat the disease just like before, but there are two vital differences.
First, since the condition is more severe, the medication will \c[3]take time\c[0] to fully take effect.
Also, the strong smell and taste of the salve will \c[3]lure the creatures of the area towards it\c[0].
Thus, after applying the salve, you will need to \c[3]defend the tree\c[0] until it is fully healed.
I see you understand.\. Now please be swift!
I understand that your life is a restless one, but I still implore you to not take this matter lightly.
Remember that you will need to \c[3]defend the tree\c[0] for some time after treating it.
I heard that your efforts have once again quelled the threat to \v[area.autumn-area.name].\. Wonderful!
You have our deepest thanks.\. May we continue to preserve the harmony on this moon together.
Greetings, \v[lore.title.seeker]. I am glad to see you, for our land is in peril once again.
A proud bovine has fallen victim to a vile sickness and is now experiencing a burning pain.
It annihilated its whole herd in fiery anguish before starting fires all over \v[area.autumn-fall.name].
Will you help us to bring peace to this tortured being?
You are a true hero!\. I know how revolting the thought of putting down a living being must be to you.
Thanks to its burning trail it became clear that the Bovine has hidden itself in a cave on the \c[3]Secluded Path\c[0].
You can reach that location by travelling to the \c[3]northeast of \v[area.autumn-fall.name]\c[0].
Though beware: You might need to accept a challenge by the track before you can enter this part of the land.
Make haste, young \v[lore.title.seeker], before the flames of rage can ignite more precious lives!
Much will be at stake if the rage of this once proud Bovine is not stopped.\. Please rethink your decision!
Enter the \c[3]Densewater Caverns\c[0] to bring peace to the raging Bovine.
You can find it on the \c[3]Secluded Path\c[0] in the \c[3]northeast of \v[area.autumn-fall.name]\c[0].
Ah, you are back, \v[lore.title.seeker].\. So the wrath of the proud beast has finally been extinguished?
That is good to hear.\. May it rest in peace.\. And may you continue to bring peace and harmony to this world!
True words, my friend,\. and wise.\. Goodbye.
Greetings, \v[lore.title.seeker]!\. I am glad to see you, for our land is in peril once again.
A proud bovine has fallen victim to the sickness that before has affected several trees and is now experiencing great pain.
In its anguish it extinguished its entire herd before starting to terrorize the entirety of \v[area.autumn-area.name].
Will you help us to bring peace to this tortured being?
You are a true hero!\. I know how much the thought of putting down a living being must be to you.
Reports have stated that the poor bovine has developed great power and extreme resistance to damage.
Go to \c[3]Path 3 in \v[area.autumn-area.name]\c[0] and meet up with \c[3]Helen\c[0], one of our leading herbalists, to find a solution.
I understand that your life is a restless one, but I still implore you to not take this matter lightly.
Please quickly meet up with our chief herbalist Helen.\. You should find her on \c[3]Path 3 in \v[area.autumn-area.name]\c[0].
Ah, you are done. Wonderful!\. Your effort should have quenched the threat to \v[area.autumn-area.name].
You have our deepest thanks.\. May we continue to preserve the harmony on this moon together.
Greetings, \v[lore.title.seeker].\. The Track is in harmony right now, so there is no need for your assistance.
Welcome to our gardens, \v[lore.title.seeker]. I am Manzana, the Chief Woodkeeper of this branch.
It is always reassuring to have your kind supporting our fruitful endeavours.
In fact, your appearance comes at a fortunate time, as we have noticed unrest brewing among the thickets of \v[area.autumn-area.name].
A sickness has befallen trees in different locations and threatens the balance of the Track in the entire region.
Would you be able to assist us in stemming it, before it can cause widespread harm?
Excellent. I will give you some bottles, filled with concentrated and fermented juice made from the fruits of our garden.
It has proven in the past to have a beneficial effect on the self-regulatory instincts of the Track.
Use \c[3]your instincts as a \v[lore.title.seeker]\c[0] to find the afflicted trees and treat them with the extract.
It should suffice to cure the trees at this stage.\. Take care, young \v[lore.title.seeker].
I understand that your life is a restless one, but I still implore you to not take this matter lightly.
Move along, nothing to see here!
Nice seeing you around, rookie. We have no need of your assistance just now though.
A \v[lore.title.seeker] recruit?\. You better get your faction-briefing at \c[3]\v[lore.title.seeker]-Central\c[0] first, before going sightseeing.
You can find the responsible official on the ground floor of that building.
Ah, it looks like the young \v[lore.title.seeker] has returned to plain ol' me.
Can you finally squeeze some work in the name of justice into your schedule?
It's good to see a young \v[lore.title.seeker] recognize the importance of such mundane tasks.
You can find the guard in question in the central area of the Marketplace, near the \v[lore.title.seeker]-HUB.\.
Ask her about the problem and solve the case.
Well then, in that case you better get going.\. I'm sure there are a few Ancient dragons in need of slaying.
You better get going, recruit, before it's too late.
I already got the report.\. You did a fine job out there... for a rookie.
In any case, you are welcome to help us out again in the future.\. The Rookie Harbor Guard is always busy.
Nice to see you around, rookie.\. We have need of your assistance again.
As if the usual struggle with the Track isn't enough, we have violent threats growing from within our own settlements.
And it seems like some people are smuggling dangerous weapon systems onto the continent through our harbor.
Needless to say, this is a danger for every law-abiding citizen on the planet.
So, can I count on your help again?
Excellent.\. We already got \c[3]Officer Cedric\c[0] investigating the case right on location.
Meet up with him at the harbor on \c[3]Beginners Arc\c[0] and he will brief you on the details.
Got too important already to handle boring guard work, huh?
You better go to the harbor, before more weapons get through.
Cedric already made a report and brought the criminal in.
For such an unimpressive guy, he sure caused a lot of trouble.
Yes, it's unlikely that he acted alone.\. For starters, those shipments must have been sent by someone else.
We will put him through some sharp interrogation 'til he spills the beans about his instigators.
Right, that's on us now.\. Cedric told me that you did well in handling this, so enjoy your reward.
Ah, \v[lore.title.seeker].\. Found your way back to humble \v[area.rookie-harbor.name], eh?
About time to be honest.\. The whole weapon smuggling business didn't do us the courtesy to just stop.
In fact it has only gotten worse.\. You got some free time again, to do your contribution to a peaceful society?
Good to see you didn't forget your roots.\. Stopping criminals like the old days.
Problem is, they're not delivering their shipments to our harbor the usual way, where we can find and catch them.
Instead the weapons are sent over the ocean on their own to who knows what secret transfer point.
Basically we have to catch and destroy them midway on their route from \v[area.rhombus-sqr.name].
We got something prepared.\. Go to \c[3]Beginners Arc\c[0] and talk to \c[3]Captain Turbine, South of the teleporter\c[0].
He will give you a more detailed briefing and send you in the right direction.\. Now get going, \v[lore.title.seeker]!
Got no more time for boring ol' \v[area.rookie-harbor.name], eh?\. Quite a shame.
Go to \c[3]Beginners Arc\c[0] and talk to \c[3]Captain Turbine, South of the teleporter\c[0].
He will explain how to stop those shipments.
Welcome back, \v[lore.title.seeker].\. I already received the combat report.\. Splendid work.
What you sunk must've been an entire month's worth of work.
That should set them back a lot and give us some room to breath and work on long-term solutions.
Well, I'm sure we will see you around again, when the time comes.
Until then, good fortune on your adventures, \v[lore.title.seeker]!
Nice seeing you around, rookie. We have no need of your assistance just now though.
Ah, a \v[lore.title.seeker] graces the plain ol' city guard with her presence.
Got some time off from solving ancient mysteries, do you?
Well, we could also use some help here in the city.
One of our watchmen at the market called for reinforcements a moment ago.
None of those fancy Trackwalking-adventures, I suppose, but matters of inner security are not to be taken lightly either, yes?
It's good to see a young \v[lore.title.seeker] recognize the importance of even mundane tasks.
You can find the guard in question in the central area of the Marketplace, near the \v[lore.title.seeker]-HUB.\.
Ask her about the problem and solve the case.
Well then, in that case you better get going.\. I'm sure there are some Ancient dragons in need of slaying.
Hey, girl, welcome to the cozy adventurers hangout of the \c[3]Falldivers\c[0].
Just go to our lounge if you wanna chill and share stories with other kindred spirits.
\c[3]Forerunner Elenya\c[0] should also be there, if you're searching for whomever calls the shots right now.
Sorry sweetie, got nothing for you right now.\. Unless you're just here for the pleasure of my company, of course.
Hey there \v[lore.title.seeker].\. We love fresh company around here, but you gotta visit \c[3]\v[lore.title.seeker]-Central\c[0] before joining the action.
We can only hand you assignments once you took that faction-briefing on the ground floor.
Annoying, but even we gotta follow some of those pesky rules around here, y'know?
Heya \v[lore.title.seeker].\. Did you come back to help us out with our problem?
Awesome!\. I'll transmit you the alleged location of the whole debacle so you should be able to track the thing down.
Just remember to mind \c[3]your instincts as a \v[lore.title.seeker]\c[0] and you'll be back here enjoying my company in no time.
Alright. That's a shame, but we'll manage somehow.\. Just hit me up if you change your mind.
I don't wanna stress you out but you better get on the case before the data wanders into some beast's stomach.
Welcome back.\. I see retrieving the data went off without a hitch?
Great job.\. Hopefully that will stop Tucos from moping around.
He's a great scout, when he isn't a reckless airhead.\. He shouldn't be down over some lame misstep.
Anyway, take this reward.\. I hope to see you around for future endeavors or quality time.
Hi Sweetie, you arrived at just the right moment!
You see, we just went through Tucos' data and found something interesting.
Turns out, that ambush on him wasn't just a random stroke of bad luck.
Believe it or not,\. our information hints towards an organized band of Hillkats that are performing coordinated strikes.
They might've trailed Tucos specifically after spotting him doing the exploration.
I know right?\. You never know with the Track, but intelligent digging rodents?
But I guess we should've expected some intelligence from those sneaky buggers with their fancy headsets.
In any case, Tucos has already gone out again to find their hideout and requested a Seeker to meet up with him.
So how about it, did that weirdness pique your interest?
I knew you couldn't resist.\. Heck, I'd love to trade if not for those pesky responsibilities in here.
Tucos wanted to wait for reinforcements at \c[3]Pathway 5\c[0] in \c[3]\v[area.autumn-area.name]\c[0].
You better not keep him waiting, he will definitely also want to meet you and give his thanks for last time.
Aw, really?\. I would've bet my lunch that you'd be all over that.
But that problem won't be gone anytime soon, so you can talk to me again if you changed your mind.
Tucos should be waiting for you at \c[3]Pathway 5\c[0] in \c[3]\v[area.autumn-area.name]\c[0].
You better hurry up, before he loses patience and does something reckless.
Welcome back.\. From his bragging, it seems like you and Tucos had quite the adventure.
Don't worry, his report was twice as much about you as it was about himself, which must mean a lot, I suppose.
In any case, I'm more interested in this mysterious artifact you've apparently found.
Huh, interesting.\. Doesn't look compatible to human tech.\. Not to our standard equipment anyway.
But don't you worry!\. We'll somehow crack this nut and get whatever useful information is in there!
Just come back later and we'll fill you in on whatever we find!
Welcome \v[lore.title.seeker], it's been a while!\. Seems like you've really been around by now, eh?
Your experience will come in handy!\. We made progress with that device you found back then.
Yep, it was quite the busywork, but it gave us some leads for future expeditions.
How about it?\. We could really use the help of a \v[lore.title.seeker] who knows their stuff!
Great!\. Now we can finally use our new toys, with you on board!
Can't tell you much about it myself, but we got one of our tech-specialists, Deggart, waiting for you.
Meet him at the \c[3]Village Remains\c[0] in \c[3]\v[area.autumn-fall.name]\c[0] and he will explain everything!
That's right at the border of \c[3]\v[area.autumn-area.name]\c[0], in case you forgot.
Alright, then good luck with that.\. And give Deggart my regards!
Aw, dang, that's disappointing.\. Maybe you just need some more time to prepare?
The device is with our Scout Deggart by the \c[3]Village Remains\c[0] in \c[3]\v[area.autumn-fall.name]\c[0].
He should be waiting directly at the border to \c[3]\v[area.autumn-area.name]\c[0].
Oh, sorry, your success made me overly excited.\. I gotta keep up my dignified leader image or whatever.
So, honored \v[lore.title.seeker], your performance in the last operation was exceptional.
Hereby, in my function as kickass leader of our organization, I give you our most official of thanks.
There was also a great quantity of classified information that was uncovered from the data that the probe exposed.
Expect a big expedition into unknown lands in the future.\. We'll keep in touch, yeah?
Sorry sweetie, got nothing for you right now. Unless you're just here for the pleasure of my company, of course.
Heya \v[lore.title.seeker].\. Nice meeting some valiant fresh blood around here.
I would love to do some bonding with a fellow explorer, but right now there's a problem with one of our jobs.
Tucos had just finished a detailed geographical survey that's supposed to serve as the basis for future expeditions.
But then he had to get jumped by wildlife and lose the storage unit with all the data, that careless klutz.
So, since you're here, could you help us out with that?\. A \v[lore.title.seeker] should be more than qualified for that kinda task.
Awesome!\. I'll transmit you the alleged location of the whole debacle so you should be able to track the thing down.
Just remember to mind \c[3]your instincts as a \v[lore.title.seeker]\c[0] and you'll be back here enjoying my company in no time.
Alright. That's a shame, but we'll manage somehow.\. Just hit me up if you change your mind.
Hey there, \v[lore.title.seeker].\. You can make yourself comfortable but you better also order something.
Ah, finally, another \v[lore.title.seeker] visiting my humble establishment.\. Are you the one with the new supplies?
About time.\. That Mr. Nomsworth promised me those ingredients hours ago.
Makes me wonder why we even pay fancy paperpushers like him for just doing some calls anyway.
Next time I might just contact those doing the real work myself.
Anyway, I'll send him a confirmation about the job.\. You better go back to him to get your reward.
I've already transmitted the okay to that good-for-nothing.\. Better go get your pay before it vanishes from his memory.

desc: EventTrigger enemySpawn START IF tmp.enemy1 || (tmp.multiEnemy && (tmp.enemy2 || tmp.enemy3 || tmp.enemy4 || tmp.enemy5))

text.en_US:
\s[0]You can spend one \c[3]\v[item.428.name]\c[0] to reset a circuit. 
Which circuit do you want to reset?
You can spend one \c[3]\v[item.428.name]\c[0] to reset a circuit.
Once you reset a circuit you can \c[3]reset it again for free\c[0] as often as you want - until you leave this room.
Greetings, \v[lore.title.seeker].\. You can purchase additional \c[3]Circuit Overrides\c[0] from me that you can use to \c[3]reset your circuits\c[0].
But beware: These legendary items are still costly to acquire.\. Please handle your circuit with care!
A new Seeker in my dojo? Hmm.
If you want my help, on the list you first need to get.
Speak to the \c[3]Advisor\c[0] in the \c[3]Quest Hub\c[0] you must, yes.
A new Seeker in my dojo? Hmm.
On my list you are. Ready to train are you? Yes, hrrmmm.
Call me Master Sensei they do. But \c[3]Van Pummelson\c[0], my true name is.
Up to you it is, what name you choose, yes?
A strong spirit I sense in you. Which training you will choose, curious am I.
However, once begun, endure until the course is finished you must.
Wisely made your decision must be, yes.
A good choice. To the art of balls, open your mind must be.
A good choice. The path to mastery repetition is. Yes, hrrmmm.
A good choice. To the art of the blade, open your mind must be.
A good choice. The path to mastery repetition is. Yes, hrrmmm.
Oh? Remember: A flimsy shield overconfidence is.

text.en_US: Tested in this training your precision and perception will be. Hrmmm.
Floating you must be for this, yes?
Worry not. Trust in your sensei, you must.
First, your basic understand we will test, yes.
\c[3]Hit all the targets you must\c[0]. That you can do, can you not?

text.en_US: But. Far from over your training is.

text.en_US: For now, rest. When ready for your next lesson, speak to me you will.

text.en_US: In you perhaps, a true seeker sleeps. Hmm.

text.en_US: I think this is an instanced room... Must be something good going on here, no?
It is I, the \c[3]Hexacast\c[0]. If you seek my guidance, I am greatly knowledgable when it comes to \c[3]element modes\c[0].
Press \i[cold] to switch to \c[3]Cold Mode\c[0] and \i[heat] to switch to \c[3]Heat Mode\c[0].
To return to Neutral Mode, just press the key of the current element \c[3]again\c[0].
You can switch element modes almost at any time.
They will influence the elemental properties of default attacks which may result in more damage for certain foes.
When you use the right element, you'll see a \c[3]yellow arrow\c[0] pointing upwards next to the damage numbers.
When using an element mode other than Neutral, your \c[3]element load\c[0] will increase.
This happens when you do any action during \c[3]any\c[0] element mode: throwing a ball, doing a slash, etc.
It is of no matter if you hit a foe or not.
If you want to know the current level of your element load, pay close attention to your element icon on the upper left corner while making use of an element mode.
This icon will fill up in a \c[3]yellow\c[0] color.
Once it fills up, you will enter an \c[3]elemental overload\c[0], which forces you back to neutral mode and disables the use of any element modes for some time.
If you want to decrease the element load, I strongly advise you to switch back to \c[3]Neutral Mode\c[0] and continue attacking enemies.
Forsooth, hitting enemies in Neutral Mode will make the element load drop much more swiftly.
I hope my lecture was of help.
How do I switch element modes?
I'm the \c[3]Triblader\c[0]. You got questions about \c[3]Combat Arts\c[0]? Then you're at the right address!
You learn Combat Arts by activating the right \c[3]skills\c[0] in the \c[3]circuit menu\c[0].
The Combat Art skills are always the bright, blue and shiny ones with black symbols.
You can learn 4 different types of combat arts: \c[3]Melee Arts\c[0], \c[3]Throwing Arts\c[0], \c[3]Dashing Arts\c[0], and \c[3]Guarding Arts\c[0].
In fact, you will find two \c[3]skills for each type of Combat Art\c[0] and you'll be able to switch between them!
You can learn more about skills from the orange dude next to me.
You can use all combat arts by pressing the \i[special] key.
Depending on what you're doing while pressing \i[special], you perform a different type of Combat Art.
Just pressing \i[special] will perform a \c[3]Melee Art\c[0].
Press \i[special] while \c[3]aiming\c[0] and you will perform a \c[3]Throwing Art\c[0].
Similarly, pressing \i[special] during \c[3]guarding\c[0] will result in a \c[3]Guarding Art\c[0].
Finally, when you press \i[special] at the same time when pressing \i[dash] for a dash, you will perform a \c[3]Dashing Art\c[0].
\c[3]SP\c[0] (Special Points) are those blue stripes you see next to your HP bar.
You gather SP by fighting enemies with \c[3]regular attacks\c[0]. They also regenerate over time up to 25% of their maximum amount.
Using Combat Arts will consume your SP. There's a pretty simple rule: each level 1 Combat Art will consume exactly one SP.
But keep in mind: as soon as you don't have any SP left, you won't be able to perform any Combat Art until you've gathered new SP.
Cool. I reckon you got it all figured out, then!
How do I learn Combat Arts?
How do I perform Combat Arts?
G'day, mate! I'm the \c[3]Pentafist\c[0] professional and I know all about \c[3]skills and the circuit menu\c[0]. Ask away!
First of all, you need to collect \c[3]CP\c[0] (Circuit Points) to learn skills.
You get CP whenever your level increases, so you should already have at least two of them. Go out there and punch some hedgehags to get more of 'em!
Once you have at least one CP, you may want to press \i[menu] and select \c[3]Circuit\c[0].
Select the central \c[3]Neutral Circuit\c[0], because that's all there is for now.
You'll see a whole bunch'a skills. You're able to activate those by using your CP.
Note that you can only reach skills \c[3]next to already activated skills\c[3].
At the beginning, you can only reach 4 skills close to the center.
I'm sure you'll find the skills you like. Just give it a burl, mate!
Did you see those parts of the circuit where the connection will \c[3]split into two branches\c[0] and then join together again?
Those things are called \c[3]skill branches\c[0], mate.
The downside of skill branches: you can only activate the skills of \c[3]one branch\c[0].
Yes, it is not possible to have the skills of both branches active at the same time.
But that's not necessarily a bad thing! You can \c[3]switch between the two branches\c[0] at any time. It doesn't even cost any CP.
All you need to do is click the skill of the branch next to the activated skill and select \c[3]"Switch"\c[0].
Switching between branches allows you to adapt your skills to match your environment. Survival is all about adaptation, mate!
Ok. Come again whenever you're confused about skills and the like.
Why, hello there. I'm a so-called \c[3]Quadroguard\c[0] and I'm here to explain the \c[3]equipment menu\c[0] to you. Got anything on your mind?
To equip any gear you've collected, just press \i[menu] and select \c[3]Equipment\c[0].

There you can select your equipment for 5 different \c[3]body parts\c[0]:
head, left arm, right arm, torso and legs.
You can select the same equipment for both left and right arm. That means most weapons can be equipped twice.

There are 4 basic stats in CrossWorlds:
\c[3]HP, Attack, Defense, Focus\c[0].
You probably already know about \c[3]HP\c[0]. The more HP you have, the more damage you can take and therefore survive significantly longer during battle.
\c[3]Attack\c[0] increases the damage you inflict with your attacks. Keep in mind that the final damage can vary depending on the type of attack and other factors.
\c[3]Defense\c[0] will reduce received damage and thus protect your precious HP from vanishing too quickly.
\c[3]Focus\c[0] determines how often you will do \c[3]critical hits\c[0] during combat. If your focus is higher than the focus of your enemies, you will do more critical hits.
But keep in mind that your enemies will have the same advantage over you if their focus is higher than yours.
Alright. Just drop by, when you've changed your mind!
How do I change my equipment?

desc: EventTrigger Grinding Explanation(2) START IF false

text.en_US: You are about to enter \c[3]Rookie Harbor\c[0].

desc: EventTrigger Grinding Explanation(2) START IF false

text.en_US: We worked intensively on this town, but unfortunately it is \c[3]not quite finished.

desc: EventTrigger Grinding Explanation(2) START IF false

text.en_US: Only few houses can be entered, NPCs are not very talkative and most traders are slacking.

text.en_US: Hey, girl! How have you been?

desc: EventTrigger Grinding Explanation(2) START IF false
EventTrigger Grinding Explanation(2) START IF false
EventTrigger Grinding Explanation(2) START IF false

text.en_US: That's why the Cap send me here to give you a quick introduction.

desc: EventTrigger Grinding Explanation(2) START IF false
EventTrigger Grinding Explanation(2) START IF false
EventTrigger Grinding Explanation(2) START IF false

text.en_US: In fact, this is the western end of \c[3]Rookie Harbor\c[0]!

desc: EventTrigger Grinding Explanation(2) START IF false

text.en_US: It's quite the busy town with \c[3]markets\c[0] all over the place!

desc: EventTrigger Grinding Explanation(2) START IF false

text.en_US: And there is more when you continue to the east.

desc: EventTrigger Grinding Explanation(2) START IF false

text.en_US: You gotta check out that central plaza!

desc: EventTrigger Grinding Explanation(2) START IF false

text.en_US: I heard you might find some \c[3]quests\c[0] over there!

desc: EventTrigger Grinding Explanation(2) START IF false

text.en_US: And on to the west you will enter \c[3]Autumn Rise\c[0].

desc: EventTrigger Grinding Explanation(2) START IF false

text.en_US: It's a large area to explore with plenty of treasure.

desc: EventTrigger Grinding Explanation(2) START IF false

text.en_US: Well, obviously a \c[3]lot of foes\c[0], too. So be careful!

desc: EventTrigger Grinding Explanation(2) START IF false

text.en_US: And finally there is so much new stuff you can do!

desc: EventTrigger Grinding Explanation(2) START IF false

text.en_US: Like changing \c[3]equipment\c[0], learning \c[3]skills\c[0], performing \c[3]Combat Arts\c[0] and more!

desc: EventTrigger Grinding Explanation(2) START IF false

text.en_US: Sure, getting to know all of this ain't a small feat.

desc: EventTrigger Grinding Explanation(2) START IF false

text.en_US: And that's why I gathered all these folks over there.

desc: EventTrigger Grinding Explanation(2) START IF false

text.en_US: They are all experienced CrossWorlds players. If you have any questions, they'll be glad to answer them for you!

desc: EventTrigger Grinding Explanation(2) START IF false

text.en_US: If you want to buy something just come to me. I have all the tasty stuff.

desc: EventTrigger Grinding Explanation(2) START IF false

text.en_US: But before you go, here is your \c[3]basic equipment\c[0] and an \c[3]experience head start\c[0]. Happy exploring!

desc: EventTrigger Grinding Explanation(2) START IF false

text.en_US: Press \i[menu] to open the \c[3]main menu\c[0] and \i[quick] to open the \c[3]quick menu\c[0].
Hey, girl! How have you been?
Don't worry, I'm just here to explain stuff the devs didn't have time for.
They are all experienced CrossWorlds players. If you have any questions, they'll be glad to answer them for you!
Though to be fair... their wisdom might be somewhat outdated.\. They don't get out much, these days.
And if you want to reset your skilltree, just come and talk to me!
Though it comes with a price, so have some cash ready for me!
What can I hook you up with?
You sure you wanna reset all your skills?
No problem! Come back if you change your mind.
No problem! Come back if you change your mind.
Greetings, \v[lore.title.seeker].\. If you desire more in-depth knowledge about your abilities, talk to our experts here.
Also you can reset your skills using a \c[3]\v[item.428.name]\c[0] using the \c[3]Circuit Reset Terminal\c[0] downstairs!
Be greeted, \v[lore.title.seeker]!\. I am Mys Li, grandniece of the great Master Sensei.
The art of combat was flowing through our lineage long before \v[lore.title.seeker]s were even a mere thought.
All that wisdom can be yours, if you are willing to learn.
What aspect of the fist do you seek to refine?
Yes, the art of close combat is indeed fast and powerful.
Even groups of enemies can be kept at bay by skilled fighters.
You, Spheromancer, will execute a series of \c[3]3 swings\c[0] followed by a powerful \c[3]spin attack\c[0] of great range.
Though the last attack is rather slow, creating openings for counterattacks.
Thus a wise fighter considers to \c[3]dash\c[0] out of a combo to continue attacking without delay.
This legendary technique is called \c[3]dash cancel\c[0] and can be used to cancel almost everything.
The dash is an essential technique in fights and allows you to traverse short distances at blinding speeds.
The speed alone allows for safer evasion, but it has another property: the mystical \c[3]Flash Step\c[0].
A dashing fighter will be completely invincible for a fleeting moment and even phase through some objects!
The time is short, but it can be prolonged by strengthening your \c[3]Flash Step\c[0] ability and \c[3]Focus\c[0].
When facing vicious attacks, raising your Guard is often the wisest course of action.
It will greatly reduce all damage in the direction you face and is often safer than trying to evade.
Though beware that your shield can \c[3]break\c[0] after absorbing a lot of damage.
The efficiency and endurance of your shield depends on your \c[3]Defense\c[0] and the specialized \c[3]Solid Guard\c[0] modifier.
However, if your guard is timed perfectly, it will never break and negate all damage.\. This is fabled to be a \c[3]Perfect Guard\c[0].
There are, however, some mighty attacks that mysteriously \c[3]ignore\c[0] a shield.\. Be wary of those.
Fine.\. Come back when you desire guidance again.
Hey, girl! How have you been?
Don't worry, I'm just here to explain stuff the devs didn't have time for.
They are all experienced CrossWorlds players. If you have any questions, they'll be glad to answer them for you!
Though to be fair... their wisdom might be somewhat outdated.\. They don't get out much, these days.
And if you want to reset your skilltree, just come and talk to me!
Though it comes with a price, so have some cash ready for me!
Bro!\. Straighten up and get in shape!\. Your body is your temple, man!
No "but"s or "if"s or "maybe"s.\. Your body is what keeps you alive so you must work for it, bro!
And you must know how your body works, man.\. I can explain, just hit me up.
Bro, what do you need to know?

Bro, there's 4 basic stats in CrossWorlds:
\c[3]HP, Attack, Defense, Focus\c[0].
The \c[3]HP\c[0] are your life. More HP means more damage that you can take and survive by tanking like a boss.
Pumping HP will also make \c[3]healing more effective\c[0], both for eating and your body's own healing.
More \c[3]Attack\c[0] increases the damage you inflict with your attacks.
But bro, remember there's more factors that change the damage, like modifiers you get from your gear.
Your \c[3]Defense\c[0] will reduce received damage and protect your HP from getting chipped.
It will also strengthen your \c[3]shield\c[0] when you try to block and tank damage.
And \c[3]Focus\c[0]... bro... dude... that's doing a lot of things, man.\. Like \c[3]how fast\c[0] you increase those \c[3]SP\c[0].
Also having higher Focus increases the chance of doing \c[3]critical hits\c[0] and decreases the chance of taking them.
And then there is the window for \c[3]Perfect Guards\c[0] and \c[3]Dash Invincibility\c[0] that gets longer with higher Focus.\. Believe it, man!
It's all important, bro, so train your body!\. And get good \c[3]equipment\c[0], cuz that's actually \c[3]way more important for stats\c[0].\.\.\. Bummer.
Dude, you're interested in a proper diet?\. Good thinking, bro!
\c[3]Foods\c[0] are the primary source of getting \c[3]buff\c[0].\. Use it and look at your power soar, man!
It's only \c[3]temporary\c[0], though, and you can only have \c[3]two food buffs active at a time\c[0].\. Limited digestion, man.
Staying buff can make a huge difference, so stay well fed.\. Your body will thank you!
G'day, mate!\. I'm the Tech professional, specialist of circuits and other hardware.
\v[lore.title.seeker]s like you are utilizing advanced biolink-hardware to draw powers from the Track.
If you wanna know more about the application just shoot your questions.
Well, to improve your Circuit you need to collect \c[3]CP\c[0] (Circuit Points).
You can get more CP by \c[3]growing your level\c[0] and from some \c[3]special artifacts\c[0] that sometimes get rewarded to dutiful \v[lore.title.seeker]s.
If you have CP you can use them in one of your \c[3]Circuit\c[0]s, either Neutral or one of the elements, if you have any.
\c[3]Skill nodes\c[0] need to be connected to the center and have one of 3 levels.
Higher levels tend to be more powerful but also need more CP to activate.
Skills on \c[3]branches\c[0] can be \c[3]switched at any time without a cost\c[0].\. For the rest you gotta do a \c[3]full reset with the advisor here\c[0].
See, as you grow as a \v[lore.title.seeker] you will wield up to \c[3]4 elements\c[0] in addition to Neutral.
Each of them have their own Circuit that \c[3]only empowers you with the right Elemental Mode\c[0].
An exception is the \c[3]Neutral Circuit\c[0] that represents the very core of your Circuit Board.
Activated Nodes on the Neutral Circuit also empower elemental modes with \c[3]50% of their values\c[0].
Ah, some modifiers can be tricky.\. Which one confuses you?
The \c[3]Iron Stance\c[0] modifier lets you \c[3]ignore the stun and knockback from attacks\c[0].\. So you can just keep on fighting!
Though you can only ignore attacks up to a certain \c[3]limit\c[0], depending on their \c[3]damage\c[0].
The \c[3]maximum damage\c[0] you can ignore is the \c[3]Iron Stance percentage of the Max HP value\c[0].
So a fighter with \c[3]1000 MaxHP\c[0] and \c[3]10% Iron Stance\c[0] can ignore all attacks of \c[3]100 damage or less\c[0].
Obviously it's more reliable against many small attacks compared to powerful hits.
And without a decent Defense and MaxHP you won't find it very useful either.
Any other mods that confuse you?
The Pin Body modifier \c[3]reflects a certain amount of damage\c[0] to attackers when \c[3]blocking\c[0] their attacks.
The reflected damage depends on how much is \c[3]absorbed by the shield and your overall defense value\c[0].
While the attacker's defense reduces the damage as usual, the \c[3]defense of the defender further increases it\c[0].
Thus it is a very useful ability for defensive fighters.\. Just tank your enemies to death, mate!
Any other mods that confuse you?
The Assault modifier adds \c[3]additional shockwaves\c[0] to your melee attacks.
The total strength of all shockwaves is the modifier percentage of the normal strength.
\c[3]Additional shockwaves\c[0] will appear each \c[3]25% modifier value\c[0], though the overall damage stays the same.
Any other mods that confuse you?
The Cross Counter modifier increases \c[3]damage on a counter\c[0].
This means attacks against enemies that are either \c[3]currently attacking\c[0] or \c[3]preparing for an attack\c[0].
Any other mods that confuse you?
The Bouncer modifier increases \c[3]damages against weakened enemies\c[0].
This explicitly affects enemies that have been \c[3]broken in some way\c[0].\. Breaking works differently for every foe.
You'll find this only in special equipment, though, not in any Circuit.
Any other mods that confuse you?
Alrighty.\. Come again, whenever you're confused about skills and the like.
Yes, what is it?\. Who dares interrupt my science?
Oh, it is a \v[lore.title.seeker].\. Oh well, you might be worthy of my knowledge.
You must know, I am the greatest expert of the Elemental Science in all of Southern Rookie Harbor!
So give me all your banal questions and let me enlighten you!
You need help from my genius?
Oh, you still need to understand the basics?\. Alright.
By drawing upon the power of the Track, \v[lore.title.seeker]s can extend their basic abilities with one of \c[3]4 elements\c[0].
To actually do that, though, you will need to \c[3]earn\c[0] each Element in the \c[3]Temples of the Track\c[0].\. Prove yourself worthy, so to speak.
Aside from being \c[3]superior in raw power\c[0] compared to Neutral, it can also deal \c[3]additional damage\c[0] to the right enemies.
However, there's also the possibility of enemies being \c[3]resistant\c[0] to some Element or another, so don't turn your brain off!
This also applies to you as well, so keep an eye on your \c[3]resistances\c[0] if you enter dangerous environments.
Also you should know that Elemental Modes cause a \c[3]natural resistance malus of 50%\c[0] to their \c[3]counterpart\c[0].
For example, using \c[3]Heat-Mode\c[0] you will take \c[3]50% more damage by cold attacks\c[0], unless you raise your resistances.
When using an element mode other than Neutral, your \c[3]element load\c[0] will increase.
This happens when you do any action during \c[3]any\c[0] element mode: throwing a ball, doing a slash, etc.
It is of no matter if you hit a foe or not, so blindly attacking is a foolish thing to do.
Just pay attention to your \c[3]elemental display in the upper left corner\c[0], if you want to know your Overload.
The icon will fill up in a \c[3]yellow\c[0] color.\. Once it's filled, an \c[3]Elemental Overload \c[0]will happen and force you into Neutral.
To decrease the element load, you can switch back to \c[3]Neutral Mode\c[0] and \c[3]continue attacking\c[0] enemies.
\c[3]Using Neutral\c[0], especially when attacking enemies, will cool down the Overload much quicker.
Ah, status conditions.\. An immensely fascinating topic.\. Some see it as the truly cultured way of fighting.
In any case, each Element has an associated Condition that will weaken an enemy in some way.
\c[3]Heat\c[0] can cause \c[3]Burn\c[0], which causes \c[3]damage over time\c[0].
\c[3]Cold\c[0] can cause \c[3]Chill\c[0], \c[3]slowing\c[0] down the victim's movement and attacks.
\c[3]Shock\c[0] can cause \c[3]Jolt\c[0], which does some \c[3]damage over time\c[0] while also \c[3]interrupting and stunning\c[0] the enemy shortly.
\c[3]Wave\c[0] can cause \c[3]Mark\c[0], which will \c[3]increase all ranged damage\c[0] that the victim will receive.
To trigger a condition you have to repeatedly use \c[3]charged shots\c[0] or \c[3]certain combat arts\c[0] on an enemy.
You will see a \c[3]special bar\c[0] under the enemy that fills until the condition is finally triggered.
I hope my lecture was of help.
Did you notice that strange device next to the Inn-Keeper?
Yeah, I forgot you joined CrossWorlds a bit later.
In the first release, you had to recharge your balls once you ran out of stamina.
There even was an extra gauge for that in the HUD.
Really? Wow, I can't imagine having fun doing that.
That's why they removed it, I guess. No one was happy.
But they keep this asset in as a reminder of the old times.
Kehahaha. Dornt fash yerse quine. Jean tauld me aw abit ye!
Shocker fur ye, huh? Heard yer speech module is broken.
Ye swatch loch th' cheerful lassie nonetheless.
Keha, sae ye want tae ken somethin' abit th' \c[3]legendary bunny\c[0], aye?
Alrecht, haur is whit Ah ken!
Ah heard, ye need tae fin' some sort ay roon capture device.
Ye can teel Jean Ah micht hae foond thes device, but she still needs somethin' else.
But ah dunnae kinn whit 'at is, kehahaha.
Ah will send Jean aw th' details.
Ye micht foond it mair when ye gab tae uir triblader mukker.
Awrite Lea, Ah send everythin' tae Jean.
Hello, how can I help you?
That's quite the promotion for a sandwich.
I prefer my good old ordinary sandwiches, really.
Good day, Miss \v[lore.title.seeker]. I welcome you to the headquarters of the \c[3]\v[lore.title.faction-shock-rookieharbor]\c[0].
If you are looking to trade, you can find goods from all over \v[lore.title.planet] here.
If you are on an assignment for our corporation, you can find the management upstais.
I am sorry, ma'am, but this part is restricted to the staff.
I am sorry, ma'am, but this area is restricted to the staff.
I see you have business with the board.\. In that case please go upstairs and have a nice day.
Good day, ma'am.\. You can go upstairs.\. Have a nice day.
I am sorry, \v[lore.title.seeker] but the market is hot.\. Please do not distract me.
Ah, good evening, \v[lore.title.seeker].\. We have been expecting you.
Mr. Nomsworth spoke very highly of your abilities.\. Let us hope that his trust is not misplaced.
As you hopefully know, \v[area.rookie-harbor.name] is a central settlement with strong connections all over \v[lore.title.planet].
There is barely a commodity that can not be found through our mighty venues of capitalism.
Though we still lack the capacity to acquire high-quality metal without relying on the other settlements.
It will be your most urgent task to remedy this.\. I hope we can still count on your assistance?
Excellent.\. Then go to \v[area.bergen.name] and visit their trader of metalworks.
We have already negotiated a satisfying arrangement.\. You will fulfill our end of the bargain.
Good.\. Now go and carry out your task.
Go to \c[3]\v[area.bergen.name]\c[0] and talk to their \c[3]trader of metalworks\c[0] in the \c[3]Trader's Den\c[0].
He will have a task for you to fulfill.
\v[lore.title.seeker], welcome back!\. The necessary tools have already arrived and they work splendidly.
From now on, we will be able to trade higher quality metal directly in \v[area.rookie-harbor.name].
You have been a great help.\. Nomsworth really deserves a pat on the back for picking you.
You on the other hand will get your reward.\. We should stay in contact for future deals.
I am sorry, \v[lore.title.seeker] but the market is hot.\. Please do not distract me.
We offer high quality equipment made in Rookie Harbor!
Hey!\. It's nice here in the shade, isn't it?
Your friend's still not here. What's the holdup?
I dunno... he said he'd arrive around this time.
Maybe stuck in Rhombus Square, watching the city from afar... you know how it is...
Yeah... Can't wait to finally enter that place, too!
... Oh well... Ever notice how that tree has fruit?
I heard those are not instant matter but actual fruit!
Now I really wonder how they taste...
Oh well... it's not like you can eat real-life fruit as an avatar.
If you're waiting for somebody, this is the right spot.
Pretty much everyone here is waiting for new players arriving from Cross Central.
... You seem to be a new player, too. So you know what I mean, right?
C'mon, relax. There is still time.
The raid is scheduled in 10 minutes.
Nothing is planned. It's going to be a mess...
Don't be so serious about it. It's supposed to be fun, remember?
All that water... makes you want to jump right into it!
Not sure I'd do that with your amount of armor.
Also, you'd just dissolve and respawn.
Mh... I swear there was an entrance here...
Look at all these old style buildings!
It's like we are in some kind of medieval fantasy world, non?
So...\. Right now I'm waiting here to meet a friend.
But I haven't seen him so far.
There are just so many people here...
I see you brought a friend?
Ah oui, that's Lea!\. I met her during the tutorial.
And this dark lord meanie here is \c[3]Lukas\c[0].
So you finally reached the \c[3]Croissant\c[0].\. Having fun so far?
The mainland.\. You'll get the idea once you see the map.
Anyway, this is \c[3]Rookie Harbor\c[0].\. It's known for the incoming shipments of rookies like you.
It's also a fairly big place, which tends to be confusing for said rookies.
So I thought I'd give you a small tour!
\c[3]Schneider\c[0] is kind enough to show you around Rookie Harbor. Just follow him together with \c[3]Emilie\c[0].
Thanks! I don't know why, but lately random people just give me stuff for free.
If you really want to dig into all the details of CrossWorlds, this is your place.
Combat arts, skills, all the stats from A to Z, you name it.
Frankly, it's a good thing to know about all that stuff.
It's just a place to go back to whenever you're confused about something.
I know!\. What's "Schneider" supposed to mean?

desc: EventTrigger runAwayBlocker START IF tmp.stopBarrier && plot.line < 2510

text.en_US: Oi, Lea!\. Why are you running away?

desc: EventTrigger runAwayBlocker START IF tmp.stopBarrier && plot.line < 2510

text.en_US: I promise, I'll make it short!
Okay... I guess that's the end of the line then.\. It's really a shame...

\c[1]Cannon Ready!\c[0]
Use \c[3]Charged Throw\c[0] to mark target!

\c[1]QUEST FAILED\c[0]

Restart task to try again

\c[2]Patrol successful!\c[0]

The Shipments have been destroyed!
\c[1]You let too many weapons pass by that will now reach the continent!\c[0]
Hi... make it quick, I think I'm gonna close soon and head to the bar...
Good Day! Do you by chance carry any Sandwiches for me?
Yepp, only 2500 Credits! Should wrap it up for you?
Why do they always run away? My wares are top-notch, right?
Come back here to get your reward!
I'm sure you can rock them railings too!
Try to reach them boxes back there, \c[3]without touching the ground\c[0]!
Just ollie up the box here and start \c[3]grinding those rails\c[0]!
Whadda ya say? Ready to style?
Chilidog!\. Show me what ya got!
If ya change your mind, just come visit me.
Try to reach them boxes back there, \c[3]without touching the ground\c[0]!
Just ollie up the box here and start \c[3]grinding those rails\c[0]!
Aww yeah, that was sick, girl!
May your mushrooms always be sauteed and your onions always be grilled. Gravy, girl!
You'll find a lot of awesome rails to grind all around this planet!
May your mushrooms always be sauteed and your onions always be grilled. Gravy, girl!

desc: EventTrigger Entrance Sequence UNUSED START IF false
EventTrigger Entrance Sequence Post UNUSED START IF map.upgradePost && false

text.en_US: Fantastique! Right at the sea, just like they said!

desc: EventTrigger Entrance Sequence Post UNUSED START IF map.upgradePost && false
EventTrigger Entrance Sequence Post UNUSED START IF map.upgradePost && false

text.en_US: Look, you can still see Rhombus Square over there.

desc: EventTrigger Entrance Sequence Post UNUSED START IF map.upgradePost && false

text.en_US: The futuristic city is cool, but it's nice to be at the sea for a change, non?

desc: EventTrigger Entrance Sequence Post UNUSED START IF map.upgradePost && false
EventTrigger Entrance Sequence Post UNUSED START IF map.upgradePost && false

text.en_US: ... Woah! Would you look at the time.

desc: EventTrigger Entrance Sequence Post UNUSED START IF map.upgradePost && false

text.en_US: Have we been really playing for that long?

desc: EventTrigger Entrance Sequence Post UNUSED START IF map.upgradePost && false
EventTrigger Entrance Sequence Post UNUSED START IF map.upgradePost && false

text.en_US: ... So yes, I have to logout.

desc: EventTrigger Entrance Sequence Post UNUSED START IF map.upgradePost && false

text.en_US: Merde!\. And I was having so much fun.

desc: EventTrigger Entrance Sequence Post UNUSED START IF map.upgradePost && false
EventTrigger Entrance Sequence Post UNUSED START IF map.upgradePost && false
EventTrigger Entrance Sequence Post UNUSED START IF map.upgradePost && false

text.en_US: But hey! Before I leave, we really should share contacts, non?

desc: EventTrigger Entrance Sequence Post UNUSED START IF map.upgradePost && false
EventTrigger Entrance Sequence Post UNUSED START IF map.upgradePost && false
EventTrigger Entrance Sequence Post UNUSED START IF map.upgradePost && false

text.en_US: Next time, let's go out there and beat things up together!

desc: EventTrigger Entrance Sequence Post UNUSED START IF map.upgradePost && false
EventTrigger Entrance Sequence Post UNUSED START IF map.upgradePost && false
EventTrigger Entrance Sequence Post UNUSED START IF map.upgradePost && false
EventTrigger Entrance Sequence Post UNUSED START IF map.upgradePost && false

text.en_US: ...So it seems you already made a friend!

desc: EventTrigger Entrance Sequence Post UNUSED START IF map.upgradePost && false
EventTrigger Entrance Sequence Post UNUSED START IF map.upgradePost && false

text.en_US: I was worried that your speech malfunction would isolate you from other players.

desc: EventTrigger Entrance Sequence Post UNUSED START IF map.upgradePost && false

text.en_US: It is good to know there are players like Emilie that just overlook that.

desc: EventTrigger Entrance Sequence Post UNUSED START IF map.upgradePost && false

text.en_US: Though she did not seem to notice it in the first place, did she...

desc: EventTrigger Entrance Sequence Post UNUSED START IF map.upgradePost && false
EventTrigger Entrance Sequence Post UNUSED START IF map.upgradePost && false

text.en_US: ... Anyway, it has been a really long day, Lea.

desc: EventTrigger Entrance Sequence Post UNUSED START IF map.upgradePost && false
EventTrigger Entrance Sequence Post UNUSED START IF map.upgradePost && false

text.en_US: I suggest we log off, too.

desc: EventTrigger Entrance Sequence Post UNUSED START IF map.upgradePost && false

text.en_US: I sort of need a break as well, you see?

desc: EventTrigger Entrance Sequence Post UNUSED START IF map.upgradePost && false
EventTrigger Entrance Sequence Post UNUSED START IF map.upgradePost && false
EventTrigger Entrance Sequence Post UNUSED START IF map.upgradePost && false

text.en_US: Do not worry... We will be back in the game soon enough.

desc: EventTrigger Entrance Sequence Post UNUSED START IF map.upgradePost && false
EventTrigger Entrance Sequence Post UNUSED START IF map.upgradePost && false
EventTrigger Entrance Sequence Post UNUSED START IF map.upgradePost && false
EventTrigger Entrance Sequence Post UNUSED START IF map.upgradePost && false

text.en_US: Sorry, I'm not in the mood for small talk.
I just want to sit here alone.
You probably have a gift for me, right?
It always comes around this time of the year.
They're always very sweet presents, really.
This time just reminds me of another player who... \.\.\. is not playing anymore.
Sorry, I'm just unloading my baggage on you. Just leave the present here.

EventTrigger AfterLogin UNUSED START IF plot.line >= 2320 && false
EventTrigger AfterLogin UNUSED START IF plot.line >= 2320 && false
EventTrigger AfterLogin UNUSED START IF plot.line >= 2320 && false
EventTrigger AfterLogin UNUSED START IF plot.line >= 2320 && false
EventTrigger AfterLogin UNUSED START IF plot.line >= 2320 && false
EventTrigger AfterLogin UNUSED START IF plot.line >= 2320 && false
EventTrigger AfterLogin UNUSED START IF plot.line >= 2320 && false

text.en_US: And...\. you still remember everything from yesterday, right?\. Meeting Emilie and all that?

desc: EventTrigger AfterLogin UNUSED START IF plot.line >= 2320 && false
EventTrigger AfterLogin UNUSED START IF plot.line >= 2320 && false
EventTrigger AfterLogin UNUSED START IF plot.line >= 2320 && false
EventTrigger AfterLogin UNUSED START IF plot.line >= 2320 && false

text.en_US: Oh, by the way!\. It seems that Emilie is online as-

desc: EventTrigger AfterLogin UNUSED START IF plot.line >= 2320 && false
EventTrigger AfterLogin UNUSED START IF plot.line >= 2320 && false
EventTrigger AfterLogin UNUSED START IF plot.line >= 2320 && false

text.en_US: It's like a call. Just take it!

desc: EventTrigger AfterLogin UNUSED START IF plot.line >= 2320 && false
EventTrigger AfterLogin UNUSED START IF plot.line >= 2320 && false
EventTrigger AfterLogin UNUSED START IF plot.line >= 2320 && false
EventTrigger AfterLogin UNUSED START IF plot.line >= 2320 && false

text.en_US: This is a direct link!\. First time you've see it?

desc: EventTrigger AfterLogin UNUSED START IF plot.line >= 2320 && false
EventTrigger AfterLogin UNUSED START IF plot.line >= 2320 && false
EventTrigger AfterLogin UNUSED START IF plot.line >= 2320 && false

text.en_US: Anyway, I just saw that you came online!

desc: EventTrigger AfterLogin UNUSED START IF plot.line >= 2320 && false

text.en_US: I logged in a few minutes ago myself!

desc: EventTrigger AfterLogin UNUSED START IF plot.line >= 2320 && false

text.en_US: I'm in the city just to the north.\. Come on, let's meet up!

desc: EventTrigger AfterLogin UNUSED START IF plot.line >= 2320 && false
EventTrigger AfterLogin UNUSED START IF plot.line >= 2320 && false
EventTrigger AfterLogin UNUSED START IF plot.line >= 2320 && false
EventTrigger AfterLogin UNUSED START IF plot.line >= 2320 && false

text.en_US: See? That was fast, was it not?

desc: EventTrigger AfterLogin UNUSED START IF plot.line >= 2320 && false

text.en_US: You should meet her.\. It is much more fun to explore CrossWorlds with others.

text.en_US: How to use \c[3]Landmarks\c[0] for fast travel.
You can \c[3]teleport to Landmarks\c[0] by selecting them within the \c[3]Map menu\c[0]
You can also switch to the \c[3]World Map\c[0] view.
Here you can move to \c[3]other areas you visited before\c[0].
Fantastique! Right at the sea, just like they said!
The city should be right up ahead!\. Go, go!

desc: EventTrigger SYNOPSIS MENU TUTORIAL START IF tmp.tutorialSynopsis

text.en_US: Check your \c[3]accepted and solved quests\c[0] and read about the game's \c[3]lore\c[0]!
I see you've found something here.\. But what was up with that noise?
What, there was an automated Turret in the crate and it just attacked you on its own?
That's worse than we thought.\. And there might be even more of those around here.
But at least we have a suspect who is involved in this crime and should still be near.
Keep an eye out for a \c[3]shady looking dockworker\c[0] checking on crates.
We might be able to properly solve this mess once we get him.
Greetings, \v[lore.title.seeker]. I have to keep watch on the harbor and protect our citizens, so please excuse me.
Hello, \v[lore.title.seeker].\. I assume they sent you to help me investigate this smuggling case?
Excellent.\. I want you to examine the crates on the eastern part of the harbor.
The data signature of the suspicious goods has already been sent to you, so you should be able to sense it.
I'll be here investigating our leads to potential culprits.\. Come back when you've found something.
The crate should be somewhere around here so you better find it!
You go find that suspicious dockworker!\. I'll make sure he doesn't leave for the city.
Well met, \v[lore.title.seeker]. There has been no further trouble at the docks so far but we should stay vigilant.
Huh... what?\. Can't you tell I'm working?
You wanna know what I'm doing?\. Keeping this harbor running without proper payment, as usual.
But hey, if the high and mighty Seeker wants to inspect our shipments that badly... just give me a second.
Can't let a humble worker earn his cash in peace, huh?
But trying to annoy me on my home-turf was a bad move, lady.
Now stay here and stop bothering me, will you?\. I'll even leave you some company.
Don't think that's all I got!
Still not satisfied after all those shipment inspections?\. You sure are persistent.
Well, I guess it is time to bury the hatchet and get one of those lawyers, eh?
Or maybe I'll just get rid of you and walk away.\. How does that sound?
Say all you want, there is no turning back now.
Hrm, after all that trouble, those buckets of junk can't even get rid of some \v[lore.title.seeker]s.
Really makes you question the point of it all...
Hey, I'll be nice. No need to get violent with me.
But, I guess I do have to face my problems the responsible way now...
I've had just about enough of illegal turrets and smokebombs being thrown around here.
Don't let falling for his little trick bother you, \v[lore.title.seeker].\. Seems to happen all the time lately.
You did good work flushing him out and disposing of those toys of his.
You sure like to get rough as long as it's just us lowly workers, don't you?
Keep your mouth shut.\. We can have a nice long talk back at the station.
And you better go there too and report to Sgt. Brassler.
He'll be pleased with what you've done here, even if he doesn't show it.
Alright, off you go.\. Don't make me tie you up and carry you all the way.
Okay, okay.\. At least leave a hard-working citizen some dignity.
Sacrebleu! Why would they add a door at this place?!
This door honestly just went where it was supposed to. Very consistent.
What was that? Did they honestly design it that way?
Yarrr, the sea sounds restless.\. A storm is afoot.
Arr, \v[lore.title.seeker].\. You the one they sent to board our proud battleship here?
Hope ye landlubber can hold yer own without steady land under yer feet.\. The sea is a fickle lady, I tell ye.
Alright, alright.\. Just wanted to get you in the mood.\. Think like a smuggler to catch one, eh?
Got a lot of those criminals these days, sending weapons directly over the sea.
Only way to catch them is by intercepting them directly on the sea.\. This is where you come in, \v[lore.title.seeker].
You will patrol the suspected smuggling routes with our state of the art combat platform here.
It's equipped with a \c[3]Naval Protection Cannon\c[0], or \c[3]NPC\c[0] for short, that's linked with your fancy Trackwalker systems.
So you'll be able to easily mark targets with your \c[3]charged projectiles\c[0] and the cannon will do the rest.
Everything's been set up already, so just talk to me again if you wanna start your patrol.
Good.\. The route is already programmed into the ship.\. Just get aboard.
Make sure to destroy as many weapons as you can.
If \c[3]too many get through\c[0] this operation will be considered \c[3]failed\c[0].
Well, I'm sure you could've guessed that already.
Don't take too much time.\. More shipments are arriving every day!
Well, you will patrol the smuggling route and make sure those weapons don't reach the continent.
To help you, we prepared this masterpiece of naval warfare that is able to fire devastating projectiles.
To use it, just \c[3]mark\c[0] an enemy with a \c[3]charged projectile\c[0] when the turret is \c[3]ready\c[0].
Aside from doing \c[3]high damage\c[0] those will also \c[3]stun\c[0] and \c[3]disrupt shields\c[0].
Also, depending on the \c[3]element\c[0] you used to mark the enemy, the type of shot will differ.
\c[3]Neutral\c[0] shots are your standard single-target projectile.\. \c[3]No special attributes\c[0] but \c[3]fast reloading\c[0].
\c[3]Heat\c[0] shots cause an \c[3]explosion\c[0] on hit, damaging \c[3]nearby targets\c[0] as well.
Lastly, \c[3]Cold\c[0] shots are \c[3]single-target\c[0] as well, but they are \c[3]more powerful\c[0] and also \c[3]slow down\c[0] whatever they hit.
\c[3]Other Elements\c[0] are still \c[3]not implemented\c[0], so they will just trigger the \c[3]Neutral projectiles\c[0].
The turret is also pretty sturdy.\. Though, you should still be careful of \c[3]explosives\c[0] and \c[3]disruption shots\c[0].
Those will do \c[3]great damage\c[0] to your ship and also \c[3]stun\c[0] it shortly.\. You won't want it exploding in the ocean, right?
Anyway, are you ready to go now?
Report back to Sergeant Brassler.\. The logs have already been sent.
Well met, \v[lore.title.seeker]. There has been no further trouble at the docks so far but we should stay vigilant.
Welcome back, \v[lore.title.seeker]!\. Seems like you wrecked that shipment nicely!
It was also a good testrun for our NPC here.\. I think it will be very useful defending against future attacks.
In any case you did well, but I'm sure you wanna be back on land again.
Report back to Sgt. Brassler now, to get your due reward.
I will send him those impressive combat logs immediately.
A painting is a memory that never fades.
Man, there are markets literally everywhere in this town.
I know, right? The city plaza is filled with market stands!
And there is another market in the northern part, too.
You can find a lot of rare stuff there, I heard.
Nobody told me that CrossWorlds is essentially a part-time shopping spree...
... Now I really feel like bashing some hedgehags.
... for a change of pace, you know?
I'm afraid this resting spot is for one person only.
Go look for another crate. This one is mine.
Good question, I'd like to leave ASAP. I have some errands to run later.
He's probably chilling at that chest in the center again.
Bugging people about how they should "claim their prize".
Really? I just arrived! Let's rest for a while.
Man, you were just chillin' at the chest right?
Hey! I was \c[5]helping this girl\c[0], you gotta believe me!
Oh hey! Thanks again for helping me out with my friends!
I'll take that silent smile as a \c[3]No Problem\c[0], I guess.
Oh, it's you... Thanks for lying to my friends...
Oh! You're that girl I helped with the chest in the marketplace!
See Hina, told you I was helping someone!
Alright alright, you win... \. \. this time.
I knew it. You're were slacking off again.
Aw, come on. Why would you do that? I wasn't slacking off, promise!
I'm expecting a delivery, so if you have something for me just leave it here.
Finally, this is the \c[3]west\c[0] part of the town.
In this shop here you can buy \c[3]consumable items\c[0].
Further down you'll find an armory with basic \c[3]equipment\c[0].
And when you continue to the west from here you'll enter \c[3]Autumn's Rise\c[0].
You'll find a lot of enemies along the way.
Be careful not to take on too many \c[3]Hedgehags\c[0] at once, or those guys will eat you for breakfast!
Anyway, just follow that way to get to \c[3]Bergen\c[0].
By the way, do you two want to form a party?
Oui, that would be great, right Lea?
And you, Lukas?\. Will you travel with us, too?
Hm...\. I unfortunately have to leave you soon.
Trust me: it's not that fun to travel around with a high-level friend.
Unless you don't care for the challenge.
You could watch us take on those Hedgehags!
Japp.\. That totally sounds like a lot of fun, doesn't it?
No really, I have to head back to the guild.
There is just too much stuff going on right now.
The crap will be steaming if I'm gone for too long.
I see, Monsieur is just too important for us rookies.
Oh, please don't be that way.
You can set up a \v[lore.unlock.direct-link.p1]\c[3]Direct Link\c[0] if something comes up, alright?
Let's meet again once you reach Bergen Village.
Come on, Lea.\. Let's do some leveling until we're worth the Dark Lord's attention!
See you soon, Emilie!\. And you too, Lea!
So...\. where is the option...\. Ah, oui!
Voilà! We just formed a party!
Or maybe look for quests in town?\. I'll let you decide, Lea!
Learn about the party members, the Social menu and party strategy.
The status of your party members is displayed below your own.
You can change the behavior of your party members via the \c[3]Party Strategy\c[0] menu.
Here you can see detailed stats of all your party members.
Start your journey to \c[3]Bergen\c[0] together with \c[3]Emilie\c[0].
Howdy, partner!\. You sure look like a healthy gal who can appreciate a nice piece of meat.
Haha, I always sniff out good taste.\. It's, like, my special talent.
The name is Selena Teak and I have grand plans:\. To create the perfect steaks for everyone to enjoy!
At least that's what I want to do, but I still don't have the proper ingredients for that.
And since I can't just leave the city and search for them... Maybe you can help me with that?
Girl, you are the best!\. It will be amazing, you won't regret it!
Anyway, I definitely need some nice \c[3]Raw Meat\c[0] of course.\. The \c[3]Bovines\c[0] in \v[area.autumn-area.name] should do nicely!
Though I heard that you gotta have, like, \c[3]a good Rank\c[0] to get some meat from them.\. Whatever that means.
Then I need some firewood that brings out the taste perfectly.
I don't know much about all the trees here but... best bring me some \c[3]very light\c[0] and also \c[3]some sharp\c[0] wood.
You should find both of them \c[3]on a mountain\c[0] somewhere. Good luck!
Whaaaat, not interested?\. That's such a shame... just think of all the steaaaak!
Bring me some nice \c[3]Raw Meat\c[0], \c[3]very light\c[0] wood and \c[3]some sharp\c[0] wood.
You can get the meat from \c[3]Bovines\c[0] with \c[3]a good Rank\c[0] and you can find the wood \c[3]somewhere on a mountain.\c[0]
Amazing.\. That's, like, everything I asked for.
Just stay right here, okay?\. I have to try out my recipe immediately.
That's... mhm... not what I wanted...
The heat-balance was way off and the wood's fragrance didn't give the meat the taste I wanted...
I'm sorry girl, but I can't use this.\. Not for the steak of my dreams.
You will still get your reward, don't worry.\.  Just... for the steaks we will have to try something else next time.
Don't worry, I will, like, think of something.\. Talk to me later if you wanna help me again.
Howdy girl, good to see you again.\. I think I figured out a better wood combination for grilling the steak.
Yeah, I'm pretty sure about it this time!\. Let's give this another try, shall we?
Alright!\. It won't disappoint again, believe me!
This time I wanna go with a mix of \c[3]very dense and regal wood from a mountain\c[0] and \c[3]wood that is extremely dry\c[0]!
I guess you'd find the latter in, like, dry areas?\. Would make sense, right?
Well, and of course I will need more raw meat again!\. You got everything?
Great!\. So good luck finding everything.\. Think of the steaks!
Awww, no trust left because of that one failure?\. Come on girl, I think we are onto something here!
Remember, aside from the meat I need different wood that for the first try!
\c[3]Very dense and regal wood from a mountain\c[0] and \c[3]dry wood from, like, a desert \c[0] should do the trick!
Yay~, you are back again.\. And do I smell some nice meat and wood there?
Yes, that looks awesome!\. Let me have another try right now!

...absolutely perfect!!\.\.
The texture, the aroma!\. It is the perfect steak!
Thank you so much, girl!\. It never would've worked without those ingredients you brought me!
Here, I'll give you the first batch of steaks to enjoy.
You can get as many as you want from my booth here, as long as you bring the ingredients!
Howdy!\. Don't you love the smell of steak in the morning?
Howdy, gal!\. Did you come by to check how business is going?
Aw, how nice of ya.\. It's going great!\. Those steaks really hit the bullseye of people's tastebuds here.
But I talked a lot to some valued customers and got some ideas to improve my precious meat even more.
How about it, gal?\. You feeling it in you to help me out again?
Yeehaw, I knew I could count on you, my deer!
Just as last time, it's all about the ingredients.\. I've done some research on the precious plants of the East!
Once again, I'd like to try some new wood in combination with what we already got.
So please bring me some \c[3]old wood\c[0] from the \c[3]jungle in the east\c[0].
I also want to experiment a bit with marinating the meat before grilling.
For that I would love to get my hands on some \c[3]honey\c[0] and a bunch of \c[3]sweet apples\c[0]!
You should find all of that in \v[area.autumn-fall.name] in the east or that jungle I mentioned!
As for the meat, I still got a lot of that here to experiment.\. Is everything else clear?
Alright!\. Then give it your all.
Awwwww, really?\. You're already satisfied with what we got?\. Think of the possibilities!
Get me some \c[3]old wood\c[0] from the \c[3]jungle in the east\c[0] and some ingredients for the marinade.
Some \c[3]honey\c[0] and a bunch of \c[3]sweet apples\c[0] from the East should do nicely!
Gal, you're back!\. And what is that?\. Do I see some of the most perfect ingredients that have ever been found?
Yes, yes!\. Exactly what I wanted, perfect!\. Just you wait, I will put it to good use immediately!
By the Ancients!\. This... this might be the best piece of meat that has ever grazed this planet.
Truly gal, I'm serious.\. You gotta taste some of this.\. This is perfect.
Here, take a few to enjoy.\. But make sure to brace yourself when eating!
I will make sure to stock up my booth right now.\. There'll be as many as you can eat!
Thank you again for all the hard work.\. I hope to meat you again, many times in the future.

Now you only need to collect other Shiny Thing from \c[3]So'najiz Temple\c[0] to enter \c[3]Grand Krys’kajo\c[0]!

You're filled with \c[3]Determination\c[0]

text.en_US: My very first test dialog, omg!
My dear, you do know we had these before?
IT'S A FISH WITH A TOPHAT!
Bloddy hell! You're not supposed to duplicate like that!
Look, I know there will be kinda two of you in the final plot.
But it won't be as simple as cloning yourself.
Also, one of the clones won't be able to talk.
... Yeah, and that clone will be...
WOULD YOU AT LEAST GIVE ME THE PROPER EXPRESSIONS FOR THIS KIND OF REACTION?!
You don't really seem happy to see me.
Huh, nice view from here, don't you think?
Follow her! She is probably just shy!
Do you have fun running in circles?
... Do you mind if I... join you?
...Hey, you really start hurting my feelings here!
She probably just likes to stand on containers! Follow her!
Is there something wrong with me?
Why do you avoid me like that?
She tries to escape! Quick! Follow her!
The path of a proper Spheromancer!
This is so mysterious, you guys!
